loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: Monique a 26 ans, est mariée et a trois enfants. Elle revend des harengs fumés et d'épices. C’est grâce à cette activité qu’elle arrive à gagner de quoi prendre soin de sa famille. Elle souhaite devenir autonome financièrement. Elle a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Monique, age 26, is married with 3 children. She sells smoked herring and spices, and this activity allows her to support her family. She needs this loan to increase her stock. Her ambition is to become financially self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy crates of smoked herring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 47 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her two sons and two daughters are in school. Her husband has been running a clothing business for seven years. Shazia's husband is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Shazia is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan will assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. 
Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is a 37-year-old married mother of three children who works hard to support her family. She is a teacher. Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of their children’s education. So a loan of (USD) $1,000 will allow Juliana to send her child, Mariano, to post-primary school. She will use the loan to pay for school registration, school uniforms, shoes, books, pens and other school materials. Juliana loves her daughter very much and hopes that further education will help her to have a brighter future. Her child is not in the picture because she already has gone to the capital to attend school.

loans.use: To pay for school registration, school uniforms, shoes, books, pens and other school materials.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is 32 years old, married with four children; and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in the business of fresh foods, mainly buying and selling tomatoes ,onions and other produce. She started the business to raise income for the family and school fees for the children; She gets additional income from selling charcoal but her main challenge is limited capital to expnad the business, educate her children and support family members. Safina has asked for a loan to buy more fresh food, like tomatoes, and charcoal for selling.

loans.use: To buy fresh food, like tomatoes, and charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Brave Women - 16-03-01P6Đcương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy is 48 years old, and she is married. Thủy lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Thủy is the group leader of 16-03-01P6ĐCương, which consists of four members.

Thủy has been working in construction, renting falsework for more than 10 years.

Thủy's family lives in a low-income household in the village; moreover, the income from this job is unstable. The main hardship that Thủy faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase necessary things for making falsework to rent.

This is Thủy first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standard.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes to maintain a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase necessary things for making falsework to rent.

loans.name: Believers - N16Mphúmlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ninh is 30 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has worked in agriculture raising pigs for more than 10 years. Ninh lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this job is unstable because when some diseases on pigs happen, her pigs could be dead and she will be in trouble with finance.

The main hardship that Ninh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.
In 2014, Ninh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Ninh has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the 16MPhúMLộc, which consists of 6 members.

With her business profit, Ninh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Rene Rose

texts.en:
Rene Rose is 44 years old, married and has a child. Her spouse is a tricycle driver.

She is raising hogs for income. She wanted to grow her hogs but had insufficient funds to sustain her family.

Rene Rose is asking for a loan of P4,000 to buy feed and vaccines for hogs. This will help maintain good growth and nutrition for or better sales.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hogs.

loans.name: Rosa Edita

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 31 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico de dos niveles, separada de su conyuge, vive con su hijo de 2 años de edad el cual todavia no esta en colegio, vive hace 15 años en el distrito de San Felipe, provincia de Jaén, Region Cajamarca, Sierra Norte de Perú. Cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

La actividad que realiza es la venta de abarrotes asi como venta de helados, tiene 2 años de experiencia en el rubro, los trabajos los realiza en su mismo caserio y caserios aledaños, el destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de abarrotes como mercadería para ampliar el stock de su negocio, ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 31 years old. She lives in her own two story house made of basic materials. Her house has water and electricity. She is separated from her spouse and lives with her two year old son who doesn't go to school yet. For 15 years she has lived in the district of San Felipe, Jaén province, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru.

Her business is selling groceries as well as selling ice-cream. She has two years experience in the field and her work in done in her own village and the surrounding villages. The loan will be invested in the purchase of groceries to expand the stock of her business. This will generate greater income and she will be able to improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy groceries as merchandise to expand the stock in her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita has been working in her farm for many years. She earns well from the business to able to  provide the family needs and has successfully repaid her previous loan used in business. She was determined enough in sustaining here business. Recently, she took a new loan to pay for her labor farm and to purchase fertilizer for her farm. In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to pay labor farm and to purchase fertilizer such as manure

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 39 years old. She is married and has three children. Her business farming. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of seven thousand shillings. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and fertilizers for top dressing her crops in order to meet her clients' demands, who have increased in the market, as well as family.

loans.name: Nelecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nelecia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell personal care product business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Nelecia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, lotion, perfume, etc. for her buy-and-sell personal care product business.

Nelecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, lotion, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Tuganeheza Group

texts.en:
Marie Claire is a group leader, aged 41. She is married with three children, aged 14 to 18.

Her group is called TUGANEHEZA, which means “GREAT VISION” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses to change their futures for the better.

Marie Claire sells charcoal and has been doing this business for the past 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is married and she has one child. Every day she sees all the women are always dependent on her husband, so one day she thought to help her husband, so that her husband could feel less responsible for the household. So she opened her business. She has been involving in business activities since 2015, with her own working capital of $ 500.00, and she made her best efforts on it.

She started with a small store so she is requesting a loan of $1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital to buy more additional items to keep in her store including hand- body lotion, coffee, noodles, biscuits, sardines, sugar,including soft drinks and other things to sell. She will improve her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy hand-body lotion, coffee, noodles, biscuits, sardines, sugar, including soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is selling petrol and gasoline because she is earning a good income from this business. She lives near the main road, and every day many people come to buy her petrol and gasoline, so she is still happy to do her business.

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more petrol and gasoline.

Maria has been involved in business activities since 2001. She started with her own working capital of $100. When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to her, she said that with this loan she will improve her management of her business to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy petrol and gasoline.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a retailer and farmer growing maize and cassava to sell to sustain her family.

She bakes local bread to sell from her stall but is faced with challenges of inadequate capital to buy enough ingredients for bread that are very expensive.

However, Mariam hopes of expand her business and to start up another income producing activity to diversify the sources of her income.

Mariam has asked for a loan to buy wheat flour and cooking oil for baking bread.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and cooking oil for baking bread.

loans.name: Dominica

texts.en:
Dominica plants, harvests and sells vegetables.

She started to planting vegetables in 2012 with her own working capital of $38.00. Now she is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

Everyday Dominica's life involves planting vegetables because she is earning a good income from it.

She taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to increase her business and taking the loan to fertilizer, seed shadow, a flush, other vegetables seeds and other things.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed shadow, a flush, other vagetables seeds and other things.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 52 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. Her husband owns a printing shop and is mainly responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members. Shehnaz has been running her own beauty salon for past 10 years, contributing her income to manage the household. 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics and creams, hair brushes and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints she is unable to. Therefore Shehnaz has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. She will then earn maximum profits to fulfill the needs of her business and family. For this financial assistance, Shehnaz is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty salon business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester for his BA in Elementary Teaching

loans.name: Rohel

texts.en: Rohel owns and operates a transportation business, providing transportation services to local community members. He has been in the business for ten years and earns 15,000 PHP per month. He has been successfully repaid his previous loan used to repaint and buy a new brake pad and accessories for his motorcycle. He is now taking a new loan to buy accesories and tires for his motorcycle for safe travel with customers. Rohel plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle for a better servcie

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 19-years-old single man from a village near Nablus city. His father works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely covers all the family needs.

Alaa is a student in the university where he studies Civil Engineering. He wants to take the BSc. degree and find a job in the future to support his family. Alaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Alaa will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses he has. Alaa appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester for his BSc. in Civil Engineering

loans.name: Maryse

texts.fr: Célibataire, Maryse, 30 ans, fait le commerce de produits alimentaires depuis 10 ans.  Elle a un fils. Grace à son commerce de produits alimentaires et cosmétiques, elle paie la scolarité de son fils et lui offrir les choses nécessaires au quotidien. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Maryse, age 30, is the single mother of one son. She has been selling food products for 10 years. Sales of food and cosmetic products help her to pay for her son's tuition and to support his day-to-day needs. She is seeking this loan to bolster her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy gallons of oil and some spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cartons of butter and crates of oil.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a mother of four who makes a living selling live chickens along the streets. The income from the business is, however, very little to sustain her family.

She has teamed up with other women who are facing similar challenges and together they have decided to create opportunities for themselves. Jane has found an opportunity to grow her poultry business by selling cooked chicken.

She is requesting a loan to buy a portable gas stove and a portable display warmer. These items will help her sell chicken stew, which is not only in demand but is also adding value to her product, thus allowing her to make more sales.

loans.use: to buy a portable gas stove and display warmer.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anecita is 53 years old and has two children who are in school.

Anecita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Anecita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell.

Anecita has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Anecita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a married 54-year-old woman living with her nine children in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in selling fresh foods as a vendor in the markets and gets additional income from growing and selling cocoa.

Zubeda is very hard-working but is challenged by inadequate capital to re-invest in her business. She has hopes of building a permanent house and also paying school fees for her children.

Zubeda has requested a loan to buy foodstuffs like tomatoes, cabbages, rice, and ground nuts to sell and meet the increased demand.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like tomatoes, cabbages, rice, and ground nuts to sell and meet the increased demand.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo vive Froilan, un señor de 57 años muy trabajador, comparte con su esposa, una hija y su pequeña nieta, juntos viven  en casa propia.
Froilan es cliente de la Fundación pudo recibir un crédito el mismo que lo invirtió para emprender su propio negocio junto al apoyo de su esposa y su hija, en vista de que sus ingresos como guardia  no eran suficientes quisieron aprovechar la oportunidad que su esposa prepara ricos almuerzos iniciar con el negocio de venta de comida; les ha ido tan bien que ahora nuevamente necesitan para fortalecer y comprar más activos para ampliarlo, con este nuevo crédito que la institución pudo ofrecerle por ser un buen cliente podrá comprar otro coche para la comida y además comprar la materia prima como el arroz, pollo y demás.
Froilan es un cliente muy agradecido porque además de apoyar con los créditos siempre están pendientes de que lo negocios marchen bien, dan capacitaciones y además tratamientos médicos para el microempresario y sus familias.
texts.en:
In the city of Santo Domingo resides Froilan, a 57-year-old gentleman who is very hard-working and shares with his wife, a daughter and a young grand-daughter. They all live in his own house.

Froilan is a client of the Foundation and is eligible to receive a loan to invest in launching his
own business together with his wife and daughter. Since his income as a guard is insufficient, he decided to seize the opportunity offered by his wife's delicious lunches to begin a business selling meals.

It has gone well and, now, once again, he needs to invest in order to strengthen and expand the business. With this new loan that the Foundation could offer Froilan for being a good customer, he wishes to buy another food cart plus supplies such as rice, chicken, and other items.

Froilan is a very grateful client since in addition to helping with the loans, the Foundation is always attentive to how well the businesses are doing. It offers training and, in addition, medical treatment for the micro-entrepreneurs and their families.

loans.use: purchase a new food cart plus primary materials for preparing dishes and, thereby, increasing customer numbers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of children's clothing for her store for Eid season.

loans.name: Tofu Of Panda - 16-03-03P6Đcương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền is 32 years old and married. She has operated a food stall, making and selling tofu for seven years.

Hiền lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the income from this job is unstable because there are many kinds of tofu in the market, including interior products and imported products, so people have diverse choices.

The main hardship that Hiền faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to make and sell more tofu.

This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her life standard. She is the group leader of 16-03-03P6Đcương, which consists of five members.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make and sell more tofu.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Ndinda is 56 years old. She is a widow, has five children and her business is farming. She has been in this business for 14 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy a water tank. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for her farm

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is 59 years old and married with five children. Concordia works very hard to provide for them.

Concordia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Concordia has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Concordia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a forty-five-year-old married female with six children used the previous loan to buy used clothes for selling. With her business of secondhand clothes and cocoa farming she has been able to cover her family's daily expenses.

Having been in business for six years, Amina has worked hard going to different markets to sell her merchandise and pay back her loan promptly. She is so determined to take her business to another level as she aims at having a permanent location and own a classic boutique. Amina is requesting a loan to buy more second hand clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes for selling.

loans.name: Fernanda Lisbeth

texts.es:
Fernanda es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene 20 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 4 años, tuvo a su hijo de muy joven pero su madre le apoya con el cuidado de su hijo cuando ella se dedica al negocio. Vive en casa familiar con su madre su hermano y su hijo. El padre de su hijo es responsable, ya que siempre está al pendiente de su hijo y paga sus mensualidades puntualmente.
Se dedica al comercio de animales desde hace un año, lo aprendió de su madre que también se dedica a esa actividad. Ella compra los chanchos para criarlos y luego los vende en las ferias cercanas los días martes y sábados. Solicita el crédito para la compra de chanchos, para incrementar su capital de trabajo e incrementar sus ventas, ya que su hijo muy pronto entrara al primer año de educación y quiere ofrecerle una buena educación.
Vive en la Merced de Cobuendo, en el sector la mayoría de personas se dedica a la crianza de animales. Cobuendo pertenece a San Antonio de Ibarra que es un lugar muy conocido por la venta de sus artesanías en madera y todo tipo de artículos en madera. Agradece a KIVA por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Fernanda is a very hard-working youth. She is 20 years old, single and has a four year old child. She had very son very young but her mother helps her care for the child when she is working in her business. She lives in the family house with her mother, her brother and her son. The father of the boy is responsible as he is always watching out for his son and pays his monthly payments on time.

Fernanda has worked with animals for one year. She learned from her mother who does the same business. She buys pigs to raise and then sells then in the surrounding markets on Tuesdays and Saturdays. She is requesting the loan to buy pigs to increase her working capital and increase her sales. Her son will soon be entering his first year of schooling and she wants to offer him a good education.

Fernanda lives in la Merced de Cobuendo, and the majority of people in the area raise animals. Cobuendo belongs to San Antonio de Ibarra which is a community that is very well known for it's wooden handicrafts and all types of items made from wood.

Fernanda is grateful to Kiva for the support she has been offered.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to increase her capital and sales and support her son with the additional revenue to get a good education.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a 27-year-old, married woman living with her three children in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in selling foodstuff like palm oil, cassava, and millet flour as a vendor in the markets and gets additional income from growing and selling cocoa.

She is very hardworking and committed to her business. She struggles to transform it to a more permanent place, since she is challenged by inadequate capital and weather changes, especially the rainfall, during which she cannot work.

She dreams of expanding the business and also educating her three children to a level of self-dependency. Zuhura has requested a loan to buy palm oil and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Yiriwaton Group

texts.fr: Bourama est l’homme qui tient le mouton dans ses mains. Il est malien, éleveur de son Etat. Il est marié, âgé de 60 ans et père de 9 enfants dont 1 enfant fréquente l’école. Il fait ses achats et ventes dans les marchés locaux. Il a fait recourt à l’IMF car ses  apports personnel ne suffisaient pas.  Il prend l’argent pour acheter beaucoup de moutons  pour l’élevage. Son rêve est   de venir  le plus grand éleveur dans son village. Les intérêts qu’il gagne lui permettent de prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille telle que de payer le prix de condiment. Il n’a pas rencontré de problème majeur pour le moment.
texts.en: Bourama is the man holding the sheep. He is a Malian livestock rearer. He is married, 60 years old and the father of nine children of whom one attends school. He makes his purchases and sales in local markets. He resorted to the MFI because his personal funds were not sufficient. He is borrowing money to buy many sheep for the flock. His dream is to become the greatest rearer in his village. The interest that he earns allows him to take care of the family's daily expenses such as paying for condiments. He has not encountered any significant problems for now.

loans.use: to buy sheep and resell them.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 17-year-old, single from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house, where he is the only breadwinner for his family and they depend on him for support.

Ahmad has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict. Ahmad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia has been  operating her  general store to make a living. For over four years in running the business, it was doing well and his previous loan used for the business has been repaid successfully. She took a new loan recently to buy more items to offer to his customers in order to increase her sales. Offering more variety of goods makes your customers loyal to you. Lilia wants to expand her store as well as improve the general living situation of his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito owns and operate a small food cafeteria. He has been running his business for many years. His earnings are enough to make a living. He had sustained the business and with his generated income, he was able to pay his previous loan, used for the business, successfully.

Improving his business is easier with his access to GDMPC. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase raw ingredients for the new recipes he has created. He plans to use the additional profit generated by the business, to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for the new recipes he has created.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lydia is 46 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lydia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lydia requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Lydia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to get supplies of biscuits, cases of sweets, crates of eggs, etc.

loans.name: Irma Haydee

texts.es:
Irma, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y a la albañilería, tienen en común 3 hijos, todos viven con ellos y estudian educación básica.

Irma, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la crianza de ganado, pues su padre le enseño a desempeñar esa actividad; de esa manera ha podido apoyar a sus hijos. 

Irma, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca lechera, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar su ganadería, además tendrá mejores ingresos económicos por la venta de leche y queso, que producirán las vacas y cubrirá necesidades puntuales que tienen sus hijos. 

Los sueños de Irma son, convertirse en una empresaria, colocar un negocio venta de leche y queso propio para salir adelante. Pero además, desea que sus hijos estudien para que salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Irma is 37 years old and studied up to Grade 6. She is in a relationship and her spouse works in agriculture and as a bricklayer. They have three children together who live with them and study basic education.

Irma works doing domestic duties and raising livestock as her father taught her to manage this business. In this way she has been able to support her children.

Irma needs the loan to buy a milk cow. This loan will help her improve her livestock farming as well as having more economic income through the sale of milk and cheese that the cows produce. She will be able to cover her children's needs on time.

Irma's dreams are to become a businesswoman, open a business selling milk and cheese of her own to get ahead. But she also wants her children to study and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en: Marianne is 40 years old, married and has four children. She is raising hogs to sell upon achieving the desired weight. She is also selling kitchen wares as additional source of income. She would like to improve her profits by selling more kitchen wares and raising healthy hogs. Marianne is now asking for a loan of P9,000 to buy feed and vaccines for hogs and kitchen wares to sell also. This loan will help her improve income in her business. She will pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hogs and kitchenwares to sell too

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more firm input for better harvest and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
Berta lives in Oecusse and she is a business woman. She has been involved in business activities since 2012 with her own working capital of $400.00 and she make her best of it. She has very high interest in doing business.

She has an small store and she hopes to open a bigger store but her capital is not enough so she is requesting a loan of $ 1500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will used this loan to buy additional items to keep in her store including milk, biscuits, noodles, aqua, cooking oils, detergents, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell. She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy milks, biscuits, noodles, aqua, cooking oils, detergents, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Sơn

texts.en:
Mrs Sơn is 29 years old and she is married. She has been working as a farmer for 8 years.
Sơn lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this job is not high enough for her to do what she really needs to comfort her life.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
In 2014, Sơn joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Sơn has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is very poor and a 25-year-old villager, a married father of three; five, three and one. His elderly parents, who live with them, receive a monthly pension in the total of $239 and social assistance of $57/month.

Alfred has one dairy cow and five goats and in the little agricultural land that his family owns, he mainly plants fodder, seasonal veggies and medicinal flowers. He needs to do transportation of things and for this he needs your financial help to buy a horse. While Alfred does agriculture and livestock during winter times he works in construction as well.

loans.use: to buy a horse for transportation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs for better harvest and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 56 years old. She is widowed and has seven children. Her business is farming. She has been in this business for 36 years. She earns a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings. 

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting. She will use the profits from expanded business to meet family expenses and pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable income that will give her family a good standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase spraying chemicals, fertilizers and pay laborers

loans.name: Marcellah

texts.en:
Marcellah is aged 42 years .She is married and has two children to support,and she has been in the business for the last 13 years earning an income of KES.13,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES.25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more farm inputs for a better harvest and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

She plans to use the anticipated loan to repay her loan and the surplus to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs for better harvest and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Musemeza

texts.en: Musemeza is a retailer faced with challenges of inadequate capital that hinder progress of his business. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda with his children and two attend school. However, he hopes of expanding  business and also building a permanent house for his family.  He engaged in business to have a source of income that will enable him provide for his family. Musemeza is requesting for a credit facility to buy sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil and bread for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil and bread for selling.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey operates a produce store alongside farming to earn extra income. He lives in Kamwenge with his 4 children and used his previous loan to buy more coffee to stock in preparation for the next season. Godfrey was able to pay back the loan using the profits,pay medical bills and look after his family as a loving parent. He is hard working and believes in the near future he will expand his business and be self sustainable. However he faces a challenge of competition and inadequate capital to purchase enough stock for selling to increase his returns.

He is requesting a loan to buy more groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Asylkan

texts.ru: Асылкан, 48 лет, вдова, воспитывает 2 детей. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, Асылкан на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Асылкан имеется 4 коровы, 20 овец. Бизнес приносит около 16,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Асылкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для дальнейшего развития бизнеса. Асылкан является лидером группы "КИВА Акжол", всего в группе состоят 3 человека. Доходы от кредита Асылкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, что улучшит благосостояние семьи и позволит накопить на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en:
Asylkan is 48 and a widow with two children. She has been working in animal husbandry for 15 years as a source of income for her family, a business she started with 20,000 KGS. She currently has four cows and 20 sheep on her farm and her business brings in about 16,000 KGS a month, an amount that is insufficient to cover living costs and care for her family.

With the goal of further developing her business, Asylkan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase livestock to develop her business. She is the leader of the KIVA Akzhol group, which consists of three people. She plans to put profits from the loan into further improving her farm, which will improve her family's living conditions and allow her to save toward buying furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her income

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Nat is a rural villager living in Mondulkiri province; she is ages 36 years old and a mother of four dependent children, two of whom are in school. The main source of her family’s income is from cassava farming for three years and working as a paid worker is an additional source of income for her family. She could earn about 10USD per day.

Recently, her cassava crop has not grown well because insects destroyed her farm and it earned her a very low income.
This is the first Kiva loan for her group which consists of three members with VisionFund. As a group leader, she is willing to take her loan portion to buy pesticide to protect her crop form threatening by insects. She hopes that her crop will grow well and earn her more income to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to protect her crop from being threatened by insects, in order to earn more income to support her children's studying.

loans.name: Aizhamal

texts.ru: Айжамал, 23 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, Айжамал 2 года занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Айжамал имеется 4 коровы, 20 овец. Бизнес приносит около 11,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айжамал обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для дальнейшего развития бизнеса. Айжамал является участником группы "КИВА Акжол", всего в группе состоят 3 человека. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, что улучшит благосостояние семьи и позволит накопить на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en:
Aizhamal is 23 and married with two children. She has been working in animal husbandry for two years as a source of income for her family. She currently has four cows and 20 sheep on her farm and her business brings in about 11,000 KGS per month. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Aizhamal has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 35,000 KGS to purchase livestock to further develop her business. She is a member of the KIVA Akzhol group along with two other people. She plans to put profits from the loan info further developing her farm, which will improve her family's well-being and allow her to save toward buying furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs for better harvest and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs for a better harvest and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase store needs as noodles, sugar, rice, cooking oil, wheat, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Peter is aged 26 years. He is married and has two children to support He has been in the business for the last 13 years earning an income of KES.13,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more farm inputs for a better harvest and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

He plans to use the anticipated loan to repay his loan and the surplus to expand his business.His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs for a better harvest and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es:
Rosa, de 35 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casada, se dedica a la agricultura y tiene tres hijos.

Rosa, se dedica a la agricultura desde que era una niña, desde entonces a ella le enseñaron este oficio, porque sus padres la llevaban a la milpa y le decían que aprendiera ese oficio porque eso le iba a servir mucho; ahora ella se levanta a las 5 de la mañana y le prepara el desayuno a su esposo, para que se vaya a su trabajo de la agricultura, mientras ella alista los niños, para que vaya a la escuela y después se va a ayudarle a su esposo en la agricultura, ellos trabajan desde las 6:00 am. Hasta las 10:00 de la mañana.

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar cuatro sacos de abono, dos para la milpa y dos para el frijol, ella cultiva mucho frijol porque le proporciona más ganancias; este crédito le ayudara mucho para que pueda preparar los cultivos.

Los sueños de Rosa, son seguirle ayudando a su esposo en la agricultura y así poder salir adelante con los hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 35, did not have the opportunity to study. She is married, and she works in farming. She has three children. Rosa has worked in farming ever since she was a young girl, when her parents taught her this profession. They used to bring her out to the cornfield and tell her that if she learned this profession it would serve her well.

Now days, she rises at 5:00 a. m. and prepares breakfast for her husband, so that he can get to his work on the farm while she helps the children get ready to go to school. Afterwards, she goes to help her husband with the farming. They work from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 a.m.

Rosa needs the loan in order to purchase four sacks of compost: two for the corn and one for the beans. She grows a lot of corn because it brings her more earnings, and this loan will be a great help to her in preparing the fields.

Rosa's dream is to continue helping her husband with the farming in order to be able get ahead, along with the children.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of compost: two for the corn and two for the beans.

loans.name: Kunduzkan

texts.ru: Кундузкан, 23 года, замужем. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, Кундузкан занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, 25 овец, 2 лошади. Бизнес приносит около 14,700 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кундузкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для дальнейшего развития бизнеса. Кундузкан является участником группы "КИВА Акжол", всего в группе состоят 3 человека. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Kunduzkan is 23 and married. She works in animal husbandry as a source of income for her family. She currently has four cows, 25 sheep and two horses on her farm. Her business brings in about 14,700 KGS per month.

With the goal of further developing her business, Kunduzkan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase livestock to further develop her business. She is a member of the KIVA Akzhol group along with two other people. She plans to put profits from the loan into further improving her farm.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, tiene 50 años de edad, es agricultor, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 3 hijos pero solo uno estudia porque los demás están pequeños.

Juan, se dedica a sembrar maíz en un terreno que posee, anteriormente tenia sembrado plátano, pero tiene que rotar y es por eso que hoy sembrará maíz y después sembrar plátano nuevamente, su esposa también se involucra en esta actividad. 

Juan, necesita el crédito para comprar seis sacos de fertilizantes y comprar doce tubos de PVC de 4 pulgadas para preparar el regadillo.  

Su mayor sueño es tener una yunta de bueyes para trabajar, porque en la zona donde vive son muy útiles.
texts.en:
50-year-old Juan works in agriculture. He went to school until the third grade and is married. His wife works at home. They have three children but only one is in school as the other ones are too young still. 

Juan grows corn in a piece of land that he owns. He used to grow plantains, but must rotate his crops. He will grow plantains again later. His wife helps him with this activity. 

Juan needs the loan to buy six sacks of fertilizer and twelve 4-inch PVC tubes to prepare an irrigation channel. 

His biggest dream is to have oxen, as they are very useful in the area where he lives.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of fertilizer and twelve 4-inch PVC tubes to prepare an irrigation channel.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan es un emprendedor hombre de 49 años que inició su propio negocio al pasar por una situación de desempleo; tras haber laborado durante años como guardia de seguridad de un colegio fue desvinculado y decidió organizar una tienda de víveres para sustentar a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y cuatro hijos.  Los residentes de Puerto Colombia tienen acceso a comprar diferentes productos que hacen parte de la canasta familiar, todos los días a partir de las 6 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. a buenos precios en distinta presentaciones.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar variedad en surtido de víveres; aceite, arroz, legumbres, carnes, verduras y frutas.  Con esta inversión obtendrá descuentos por pagos en efectivo.  Su meta a futuro es tener el negocio completamente surtido y garantizar que sus clientes encuentren lo que necesitan. A nivel personal desea comprar un vehículo para transportar las mercancías sin tener que generar sobre costos.
texts.en:
Juan is an enterprising man of 49 years who started his own business while going through a period of unemployment. After working for years as a security guard at a school, he was let go and decided to run a general store to support his family, comprised of his spouse and four children. The residents of Puerto Colombia have the opportunity to buy different familiar grocery products every day from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. for good prices and in various forms.

Juan is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first funding through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation], in order to buy a variety of food supplies including oil, rice, legumes, meats, vegetables and fruits. With this investment, he will receive discounts for paying in cash. His goal for the future is to have a fully stocked store to guarantee that his customers will always find what they need. On a personal level, he wishes to buy a vehicle to be able to transport merchandise without creating additional costs.

loans.use: buy a variety of food supplies including oil, rice, legumes, meats, vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат 55 летняя жительница маленького городка Турсунзаде. Город назван в честь талантливого писателя и героя таджикского народа Мирзо Турсунзаде. Адолат гордится, что живет в этом городе. Ее муж с двумя детьми живет в другом городе, Адолат с сыном - школьником живет в родном краю. Адолат опытная швея. Уже более 10 лет она работает в этом направлении. Адалат столь время работала не прерывно и вот этой швейной машинке. Адолат хочет сделать себе подарок и создать себе условия работы. Она планирует купить себе новую модернизированную швейную машинку. Ее собственных средств не хватает, и она решила обратиться за кредитом. Она верит, что ей помогут.
texts.en:
Adolat is 55 and a resident of the small city of Tursun-zoda. The city is named in honour of the talented writer and hero of the Tajik people Mirzo Tursun-zoda. She is proud to live in this city. Her husband and two children live in another city and Adolat and one schoolaged son live in her native region.

Adolat is an experienced seamstress. She has been working in this field for more than 10 years. She has worked constantly during this time, with her current sewing machine. Now she wants to give herself a gift and improve her working conditions. She is planning to buy herself a new modern sewing machine. She doesn't have enough of her own money for this and she has decided to request a loan. She believes that she will receive assistance.

loans.use: to get a sewing machine

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима  родилась в 1966 году. Она заботливая мать 3 детей. Детям 24, 22 и 20 лет. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. У Фотимы есть собственный бизнес. Она растет и продает продукцию сельского хозяйства. Фотима имеет небольшую часть земли, где она растет помидоры, кукуруза и другие овощи. Она сеет и собирает дважды в год и получает хороший урожай. Она собирается выращивать другие виды овощей и предлагать их местных жителей. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить семена и минеральные удобрения для посева эти дополнительные сорта овощей. Фотима ждет Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Fotima was born in 1966. She is a caring mother to three children aged 24, 22 and 20. Her husband is working in Russia and she runs her own business. She grows and sells farm produce. She has a small plot of land where she grows tomatoes, corn and other vegetables. She plants and harvests twice a year and receives a good harvest.

Fotima is planning to grow other types of vegetables and sell them to local residents. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for planting these additional types of produce. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Young And Ambitious - 08-03-07Tsơn3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hương is 29 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling snacks for 5 years. Hương lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this job is unstable. The main hardship that Hương faces is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for her snacks to cook and sell. In 2011, Hương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Hương is the group leader of 08-03-07TSơn3, which consists of 7 members.

With her business profit, Hương hopes her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snacks to cook and sell.

loans.name: Kimsrun's Group

texts.en:
Kimsrun, living in Kratie province, is age 43 years old and a mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school while the other one is too young to attend school. Growing rice and cassava are the main sources of her family’s income for twenty-five years and working on her co-villager’s farm for fee is an additional source of her family’s income. She could earn about 13 USD per day to spend on her family’s daily needs. Drought is the main challenge for her in doing farming and it causes her to earn a very low income recently.

Due to having not enough working capital to do farming, she is now leading a group of five to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund. This is first loan cycle for her and she is willing to manage her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to increase productivity of her crop yield and take the rest of money to buy pesticide and pay for plowing fee. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income and have ability to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to increase productivity of her crop yield, in order to earn more income to keep sending her children to school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs for a better harvest and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Carlos Amable

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre trabajador, él ha sacado a su familia adelante con su negocio, es casado, tiene 45 años y vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, viven en una casa arrendada incluyendo el espacio de su negocio. Su hijo mayor y su esposa le ayudan en el negocio. Sus hijos estudian en un colegio fiscal, ellos se llevan muy bien con su padre, Carlos mantiene un buen ambiente familiar en su hogar.
Vive en la ciudad de Atuntaqui, es reconocida por su gastronomía típica principalmente la fritada, en la zona las personas se dedican a la confección de prendas de vestir, un lugar muy visitado es el museo fabrica Imbabura ubicado en Andrade Marín cerca de la estación del ferrocarril.
Se dedica a la mecánica en general, su negocio lo tiene en su domicilio, por ello no tiene problema en atender a sus clientes en cualquier horario, trabaja de lunes a sábado, además de la ayuda que recibe de su hijo y su esposa también tiene un ayudante a quien paga por obra.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de pastillas, zapatas, y otros materiales que necesita para poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, ya que por el momento se está quedando sin esto productos. Agradece a KIVA por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Carlos is a hard-working man, who has been supporting his family with his business. He is married, 45 years old and he lives with his wife and two children. They live in a rented home which has space for his business. His eldest son and his wife help him with the business. His children go to public school and they get along very well with their father. Carlos maintains a good family atmosphere in his home.

He lives in the city of Atuntaqui, which is known for its traditional cuisine, mainly fried foods. Residents in the area make clothing for a living. One spot that is popular for visitors is the Ibambura Factory Museum, located in Andrade Marín near the train station.

Carlos makes a living as a general mechanic. His business is in his home, which is why he has no problem helping his customers at any time of day. He works Monday to Saturday. In addition to the help he gets from his son and his wife, he also has the help from a paid worker.

He is requesting the loan to buy brake pads, brake blocks and other materials needed to offer his customers good service, because he is currently without these products. He is grateful for the help Kiva has given him.

loans.use: to buy more materials for repairs, to be able to serve his customers promptly and maintain their loyalty.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar energy solution for his vegetable selling business and increase his income.

loans.name: Lovely Ladies - 11-01-11Hthành2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs Toán is 57 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for 4 years. Toán lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village. Moreover this job is competitive. So it is very difficult for her to get fixed income each month.

The main hardship that Toán faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase household appliances that her family needs for using and doing business.

This is Toán first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her life standard.
Toán is the group leader of 11-01-11HThành2, which consists of 3 members.

With her business profit, Toán hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase household appliances.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
Zarrina is a bright and intelligent woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1987. She is married and has three children. She has good work experience at the Technical Institute and veterans' home in her area. She likes to take care of the elders and residents of her local area. Last year she passed her test and interview at IMON and recently started work as an accountant-teller.

She is sick. She appealed to IMON asking for financial support to be treated at hospital. She hopes to recover and be healed in order to continue her job and ensure her family's future.

She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to be treated at hospital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rearrange her little store and invest in new merchandise, to make it possible for her to grow in her work and personal life.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
José, de 31 años de edad, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos está en la escuela y los otros pasan con la mamá en casa. 

José, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño un tío, que siempre lo apoyaba a él en su trabajo y así fue como aprendió el oficio.- José también por las tarde se dedica a la venta de pan, él sale a venderlo en una motocicleta por los cantones aledaños, en este trabajo de la panadería le ayuda su hermano y en la mañana realiza el trabajo de la agricultura, esto lo hace desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 11:00 a.m. y la venta de pan desde las 2:00 p.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m. 

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar abono y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, porque por problemas de sequías se secó, es por eso que ahora solo ha sembrado 4,500 metros cuadrados de maíz, para obtener el sustento para sus hijos y el resto para venderlo.

Los sueños de José, son seguir cultivando la tierra y vendiendo pan.- Y tener su propia panadería.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old and he is married. His wife is a homemaker and they have five children one of which is in school, the others stay at home with their mother. José has been working in agriculture since he was 12 years old. An uncle taught him this work since José always helped him with his work; this is how he learned it. In the evenings, José also sells bread. He goes out to sell in a motorcycle through the neighborhood corners. His brother helps him with this bakery work. In the mornings he works in agriculture from 7:00am until 11:00am and he sells bread from 2:00pm until 6:00pm.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy manure and fertilizers to grow corn since, because of drought problems, the corn dried. This is why he has only planted 4,500 square meters of corn to obtain sustenance for his children and the rest to sell. José's dreams are to continue farming and selling bread and to have his own bakery.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers and chemicals for spraying for a better harvest and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs for a better harvest, and use the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old married man from Khanyounis, which is both a city and a refugee camp in the besieged Gaza Strip, where unemployment is very high. He has been transporting goods using his rickshaw for the past three years. Ali buys the products wholesale and resells them for a small profit margin.

Ali has taken out a USD loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy more products to resell. Ali’s loan will enable him to buy more inventory and goods to resell and eventually increase the size of his business and his income.

Ali appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell

loans.name: Domitilla

texts.en:
Domitilla is 54 years old. She is married and has four children. Her business is farming. She has been in this business for 24 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty nine thousand shillings.

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds and part of it pay school fees for her children.

She will use the profits from expanded business to meet home expenses and educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children and the rest to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 24 years old. She lives in Gori district with her pensioner mother. Nino is unemployed and the family lives in poverty. They get social assistance from government monthly 104 GEL, which is not enough to cover everyday costs.

Nino wants to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of clothes at wholesale prices and will resell at higher price in Gori. She is very motivated to generate income and help her mother financially. Nino awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin sell clothes.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Adelfa works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Adelfa is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy variety of fruits to sell for her fruit vending business.

Adelfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of fruits to sell

loans.name: Jose Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado, su esposa es maestra en una escuela desde hace 15 años, junto a ella tiene tres hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos están en la escuela y uno pasa en casa.

Gonzalo, se dedica a la carpintería desde hace 7 años, actualmente está trabajando en el área de tapicería y pintado ataúdes, este trabajo lo aprendió con la ayuda de un primo, que le enseño este trabajo y hoy en día trabaja como empleado en esa carpintería.- Gonzalo, tiene posibilidad de independizarse e ir colocando su propia carpintería, porque le están vendiendo maquinaria.

Gonzalo, está solicitando el crédito para comprar una cierra y una cepilladora de mesa y una cierra de mesa, con esto va comprando sus propias herramientas para colocar su carpintería, de esa manera dará más apoyo económico a su familia y le ayudará a la esposa con los ingresos de la casa.

Los sueños de Gonzalo son, tener su propia carpintería y hacer los ataúdes para que las ganancias le queden a él.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is 38 years old, studied up to the ninth grade and is married. His wife has been a schoolteacher for 15 years and he has three children with her, two of whom are in school with one still at home.

Gonzalo has been in carpentry for seven years. He is currently working in the area of upholstery and coffin-painting. He learned this job with the help of a cousin, who taught him the trade and now works as an employee in the same workshop. Gonzalo has the chance to become independent and establish his own workshop, because they are selling him machinery.

Gonzalo is requesting this loan to buy a saw, planer table, and table saw. With this he will buy his own tools to establish his carpenter’s workshop. In this way he will give more financial support to his family and help his wife with the household income. Gonzalo’s dreams are to have his own carpenter’s workshop and to make coffins there, so that he can keep his own earnings.

loans.use: buy a saw, planer table, and table saw.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 37 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a printing shop. Shazia has been running her own beauty saloon for past 10 years, she also contribute her income with her husband to manage the house hold.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brushes and other accessories for her beauty saloon but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore Shazia has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers, it will also helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.
On this financial assistance Shazia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Pegi village. Markus joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Markus suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children.

Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Markus has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria, and to earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize this year, Markus can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields.

loans.name: Amalia Del Carmen

texts.es: Amalia de 38 años inspirada en su deseo de ser una trabajadora independiente y tener su propio negocio, aceptó la propuesta que le hizo su cuñada de vender arepas rellenas en el mismo local donde ella tiene su restaurante.  Inició su negocio en el año 2012 y ha tenido mucha acogida por los residentes del sector quienes degustan diariamente de sus arepas rellenas de queso, pollo, carne, chorizos y las trifásicas.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar maíz al por mayor y recibir descuentos. Con esta inversión espera que obtener mayor rentabilidad y así continuar ofreciéndole bienestar a sus hijos tres hijos menores de edad. su meta a futuro es abrir su propio local y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Amalia is 38 years old and is inspired by her desire to be hardworking and independent and to have her own business. She accepted the proposal made by her sister-in-law to sell stuffed arepas in the same stall where she has her restaurant. She started her business in 2012 and she has been well received by the neighborhood residents who daily enjoy her arepas stuffed with cheese, chicken, meat, sausages and combinations.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy corn wholesale so she can receive a discount. With this investment she hopes to be more profitable and thus continue supporting her three young children. Her future goal is to have her own stall and to remodel her home.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale.

loans.name: Yolmer

texts.es:
Yolmer tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el caserío Palma Central del distrito de Santo Tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Yolmer se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 4 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona.Tambien cria y vende de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, platano, viticas, menestras y otros). El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Yolmer espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yolmer, age 27, lives in a simply constructed home of his own with his partner and their children in the village of Palma Central. Palma Central is in the Santo Tomás district, which is part of the Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru. Life in the area is calm, with most people working in commerce, farming, or ranching.

Yolmer is a farmer, primarily of coffee. He has four years of experience in the field, and excellent references from people in the area, both personal and professional. He also raises and sells small
animals, including hens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others) and he also sells garden foods for take away, including yucca, plantain, chia, and assorted pulses.

This loan will be used to buy manure and fertilizers to help him adequately tend to his crop, as well as to hire additional manual labor during the harvest. By doing so, Yolmer hopes to provide his customers with better quality coffee, thus increasing his income and ultimately improving his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: care for his coffee crop by purchasing manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
Berta is a business women and she has a small shop so she is requesting a loan of $ 800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. Because she has plans to make her business a bigger store. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her shop such as sardines, cooking oils, biscuits, salts, noodles, eggs, milk, including hard drinks and other things to sell.

Berta opened her shop in 2010 with her own working capital of $200.00. She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy sardines, cooking oils, biscuits, salts, noodles, eggs, milk, including hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar system to provide an alternate energy source for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy the materials she needs to repair the roof of her home

loans.name: Beautifying Is Happiness - N05T7Đanhđsơn Group

texts.en:
Hiền is 30 years old and she is married with 1 children. Mrs. Hiền has been working in business providing beauty salon service for 5 years. She is living Đông Sơn, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to invest money to open a beauty center. In 2012, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Hiền is the group leader of the N05T7ĐAnhĐSơn, which consists of 3 members.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to invest money to open a beauty center.

loans.name: Nalaong Group

texts.en:
Thutha is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.

Thutha and his group, Nalaong Group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water, were discussed and priced out over two years.

The water filter Thutha and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years, but is known to function for up to five years. Thutha and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases.

After totaling up the costs, Thutha and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter, so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs for a better harvest and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar solution for his business, to increase his income for his family.

loans.name: Muhamadullo

texts.en:
Mahmadullo is a caring father. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1962 and lives in a small village with his family. He is married and has seven children. His wife is a housekeeper and a seamstress.

He is a clerk at a company and likes his job. He is responsible for taking care of his family. He manages his work and family and is attentive to his children.

Mahmadullo has problems with his health. He appealed to IMON and Kiva, asking for financial support to be treated at a hospital. He awaits Kiva lenders' kindness and support. He hopes to be healed and to continue working. He is a feeder of their family and responsible to ensure them all.

loans.use: to be treated at a hospital

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Melita has been in this business for 21 years. Melita earns more income from farming sugarcane for 4 years and food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 46 years old and married with three children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Alma has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from abaca weaving.

Alma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 42 years old and married with two children.

Cheryl works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, condiments, coffee, and other groceries.

Cheryl has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Cheryl aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, condiments, coffee, and other groceries.

loans.name: Erika Yessenia

texts.es:
Erika es una joven mujer ecuatoriana de 20 años de edad, vive en la parroquia  Eloy Alfaro  en un barrio urbano del sector perteneciente a  la Provincia de Cotopaxi, está casada, tiene una pequeña hija de seis meses de edad,  gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la secundaria, luego dejo de estudiar porque tuvo un nuevo reto en la vida y ese era el de cuidar a su hija, es de esta manera que ella empezó a trabajar desde muy chica para poder sustentar sus necesidades y del nuevo ser que ahora la compaña.
Para Erika no fue nada fácil emprender su negocio ya que la actividad que realiza es un trabajo muy fuerte ya que se trata de elaboración de bloques, en esta actividad la ayuda su esposo, sufrió mucho pero sin embargo ella lucho para darle lo mejor a su hija y ser apoyo para su esposo , ahora es muy feliz porque dios y la vida le dio la oportunidad de ver crecer a su hijita.
Actualmente Erika vive en casa de sus familiares desde hace varios años , a pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, ella dedica  mucho tiempo también a los cuidados de su pequeña hija.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y hoy  solicita un crédito que lo utilizará en la compra de material (polvo, chasqui y cemento),  esto ayudará a  mejorar sus estilo de vida y el de su hija, dándole la educación que se merece.
Erika agradece a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Erika is a young Ecuadorian woman of 20 years. She lives in the Eloy Alfaro parish in an urban neighbourhood in the sector belonging to the Cotopaxi Province. She is married and has a small daughter, six months old. Thanks to the effort of her parents she managed to finish secondary school, but later ended her studies because of a new challenge in her life: caring for her daughter. So she began working from a very young age to be able to support her needs and those of the new life now accompanying her.

It was not at all easy for Erika to learn her trade as the work she does is very hard, involving the production of building blocks. Her husband helps her with this work. She has suffered much but nonetheless is fighting to give the best to her daughter and be a support to her husband. Erika is very happy now because God and life have given her the chance to see her little daughter grow up.

Erika is currently living with her relatives, where she has been for several years. Despite having a job that demands a great deal of time and effort, she also spends a lot of time caring for her young daughter. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. Today she is requesting a loan which she will use for the purchase of material (powder, chasqui [an Ecuadorian raw material for brick-making] and cement). This will allow her to improve her lifestyle and that of her child, and give her child the upbringing she deserves. Erika thanks Kiva for making the growth of her professional and personal life possible.

loans.use: buy material such as powder and cement, allowing her to improve her lifestyle and that of her child, and give her child the upbringing she deserves.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
