Shamshad is 42 years old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her one son and five daughters, Her children are in school. Her husband has been running her own business of clothes selling for 7 years. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes.

Therefore Shamshad is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.
Shamshad is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Amar

texts.en:
Amar is a 31-year-old married man from Khanyounis, which is both a city and a Refugee Camp in the besieged Gaza Strip, where unemployment is very high. He has been transporting goods using his rickshaw for the past three years. Amar buys the products wholesale and resells them for a small profit margin. Amar has taken out a USD loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy more products to resell.

Amar’s loan will enable him to buy more inventory and goods to resell, and eventually increase the size of his business and his income

Amar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell.

loans.name: Punctual Repayment - N15Ttthắngxqlợi Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thúy is 34 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for 6 years. Thúy lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. In addition, the income from this job is unstable because when some diseases on poultry happen, they could be dead so she has nothing to sell and she will be in trouble with finance.

The main hardship that Thúy faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.
In 2013, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

Thúy is the group leader of N15TTThắngXQLợi, which consists of 3 members. With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is a 28-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw products and ingredients needed for her business.

Edelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw products and ingredients needed for her business

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 65 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural busines,s farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Nilda requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Nilda has been farming sugarcane for 13 years now and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emelinda is 48 years old and has one child in school.

Emelinda has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Emelinda requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed for her business.

Emelinda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Emelinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food stuffs like rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Zabulon

texts.en:
Zabulon is 30 years old, married with four children and he deals in making and selling bricks to construction sites, which he has practiced for many years. He lives in Bundibugyo Uganda and gets additional income from cocoa trading. He works hard to meet his family's basic needs and dreams of educating his children and constructing his dream house.

Zabulon is requesting for a loan to pay for labor and firewood for baking his bricks.

loans.use: to pay for labor and firewood for baking his bricks.

loans.name: Venkadasalapuram Jlg 002 Group

texts.en: Shanthi is the leader of a group of 5 women. There are 4 more enterprising women in this group. All of them used to work as daily wage workers, but the job barely paid enough to raise their families. Shanthi is married and a mother of 2 children. Worried about her children's future, she wants to make more earnings, allowing her to save a part of it for future needs. She underwent training on doing stone work on sarees. Now she wants to set up a business of her own. The income she will earn from her new business will help her contribute more to the family's income. She is joined by the rest of the group in seeking a loan and they too want to set up businesses of their own. Thus they have applied for a loan. The loan amount will be used to purchase bulk stock of semi precious stones. She is confident that earnings after the loan will be better. Shanthi and her group are thankful to their lenders.

loans.use: to buy semi precious stones to start her stone work business

loans.name: Teresita De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresita es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene 61 años, desde muy joven se dedica al comercio de frutas, y ha sacado adelante a su familia con este negocio. Es casada, vive en casa propia con su esposo de 67 años, todos sus hijos son independientes, salieron de su casa y tienen sus propias familias.
Teresita vive en el barrio San Luis de Atuntaqui, la zona es muy conocida por la producción de prendas de vestir, en Atuntaqui existen muchas fábricas que producen ropa, para la venta al por menor o al por mayor en la provincia y fuera de la provincia. Además es muy visitado por su gastronomía típica, el plato más demandado es la fritada.
Se dedica al comercio de frutas, compra las frutas en el mercado mayorista de Ibarra, y luego las expende en diferentes lugares, los productos que principalmente comercializa son los plátanos, oritos, pepinos y frutas de temporada. Sus productos los vende en el mercado de Cotacachi los días Domingos, en la Plaza de ponchos en Otavalo los días miércoles y sábados, y en el cementerio de Otavalo los días lunes y jueves, en el lugar que tiene mejores ventas es el en el mercado de Cotacachi ya que no existe mucha competencia.
Solicita un crédito para invertir en la compra de frutas de temporada e incrementar su capital de trabajo. Agradece a fundación alternativa por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Teresita is a very hard-working person. She's 61 years old, and ever since she was young she's been in the business of selling fruits. This business helped her to get her family ahead. She's married and lives with her 67-year-old husband in their own home. All their children are independent and live on their own with their own families.

Teresita lives in the neighborhood of San Luis de Atuntaqui, an area that is well known for its garment industry. In Atuntaqui, there are a lot of clothing factories that sell both retail and wholesale, within the province and beyond. It's also a very popular place to visit for its traditional cuisine, particularly a fried pork dish called fritada.

Teresita begins her work by buying fruits in the wholesale market of Ibarra and then sells them various places. She primarily sells plantains, small bananas (oritos), cucumber, and seasonal fruits. She sells in the Cotacachi market on Sundays, in the Plaza de Ponchos in Otavalo on Wednesdays and Saturdays, and in the Otavalo cemetery on Mondays and Thursdays. She gets her best sales at the Cotacachi market as there isn't a lot of competition.

She is requesting this loan to purchase seasonal fruits and increase her working capital. She is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa for the provided support.

loans.use: purchase in-season fruits to sell at market

loans.name: Shanta

texts.en:
Shanta is 46 years old. She is married and has two children aged 25 and 20. She established her agriculture business by farming vegetables. She works four hours a day, seven days a week to support her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW, using her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business.

In the future, she plans to improve the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, borrowers are able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials to improve his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal, cement, nails, boards, beams, etc. to carry out the improvement of her home.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.en: Lazaro is 57 years old and comes from the community of Getafe, Bohol.  He is married and has two adult children.  For many years Lazaro has been fishing for a living.  He would like to increase his fishing to earn more revenue.  He is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine.  This is vital, so he can fish on a daily basis. In the future, he would like to make his business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine.

loans.name: Leandro Ii

texts.en:
Leandro Li, 38 and married, hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He buys and sells coconuts.  He also sold copra (dried coconut meat). He is a father of two children, ages 7 years and 6 months. He has been operating his business for almost a year.

He is asking for a loan to buy coconuts and to purchase piglets and pig feed (for start-up). With these, he could augment his sources of income and be able to handle his expenses. He could provide his family with good food and a better home to live in.

In the future, he aims for his business to become more sustainable to enable him to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Eminda

texts.en:
Eminda is 44 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, soap, chips, etc.

Eminda has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, soap, chips, etc.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Channy, who lives in Kratie province, is 30 years old and the mother of three dependent children. Growing rice and cassava have been the main sources of her family’s income for 12 years. She earns about 13 USD per day to spend on her family’s daily needs. The depreciation of cassava’s price in the market is the main challenge for her in earning income to support her family; it has caused her to earn a very low income recently.

Due to not having enough working capital for farming, Channy is now leading a group of two to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund. This is the first loan cycle for her group. She is willing to manage her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income and have the ability to upgrade her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield, which will enable her to earn more income to save for future needs.

loans.name: Nongkhonekean Group

texts.en: Thavone understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Thavone knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Thavone purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Thavone is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Sirunatham Jlg 002 Group

texts.en:
Hemalatha is the leader of the Sirunatham JLG 002 group. Kalaiselvi, Vijaylakshmi, Rengammal and Amaravati are the other members of the group. Hemalatha is 37 and the mother of two. She earns her daily wages by doing manual labour on agricultural fields. She wants to supplement her income and ensure there is a more steady source of income to support her family. To this end, she underwent training from Gramalaya Microfin Foundation in embellishing sarees with semi-precious stones. Now she, along with the other members in the group, is seeking a loan to start a business from home.

Hemalatha will pursue the same business in stone-work on sarees, The other members will start home-based businesses in making mixed spice powders and specialty banana products. The income from the businesses will help them boost their income, and save more in the long run, for their children's education, and for any emergencies that may arise.

loans.use: to buy semi-precious stones and sarees for her embroidery work business.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga sells men's clothes at the local market. She is very experienced and always purchases the most popular styles of clothing.

Olga is a very responsible person. She successfully repaid a previous KIVA loan. Unfortunately, Olga had a stroke, but is now recovering. Her husband helps her a lot with the business.

Olga is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH through Kiva's field partner Hope Ukraine to increase the assortment of men's clothes for autumn. The loan will help her to get new clients and increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of men's clothes she will sell for autumn.

loans.name: Alba Veronica

texts.es: Alba de 38 años de edad, vive muy feliz junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 4, 9 y 14 años de edad en casa propia y humilde. Alba se caracteriza por ser una madre muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos. Desde hace un tiempo, Alba se dedica a la venta de pescado, actividad que realiza todas las mañanas y lo hace de  forma ambulante en su comunidad además Alba se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva; es así como Alba cubre las necesidades básicas de sus hijos. Anteriormente, Alba solicito un crédito a FUSAI, el cual invirtió en su negocio de venta de ropa, con el compro variedad de ropa de mujer y hombre, lo cual le permito ofrecer a sus clientes más variedad de ropa y también le genero más ingresos económicos; por lo cual su familia se siente muy agradecida. Nuevamente, Alba solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir en su negocio de mariscos y ropa, así sus negocios irán creciendo a poco a poco y le dará mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Alba is 38 years old. She lives happily with her husband and their 3 children, ages 4, 9 and 14, in a humble home they own. Alba is known to be a very hard working and tenacious mother that wants her children to succeed.

For some time, Alba has worked selling fish, a job she works at every morning as a street vendor in her community. In addition, Alba works selling new clothes. This is how she meets the basic needs of her children.

Previously, Alba sought a loan from FUSAI which she invested in her clothes selling business. She bought a variety of clothes for men and women, which allowed her to offer her customers a greater selection of clothes, and generated more income for her. Her family is very grateful for that.

Now Alba seeks a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in her businesses of seafood and clothes, so that both businesses will continue to grow, and little by little will provide greater income.

loans.use: to invest in fish, shrimp and other seafood to improve her product selection and her sales.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov is 33 years old and lives in Khsach Kandal district in Cambodia. She is married and has two young sons.

Nov has stayed at home while for the past seven years her husband has driven a tractor to earn an income. She wants to earn extra money for the family, so she has applied for a 600 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Maxima to buy a cow to raise. She wants a better life and to save some money for her children’s future needs.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Jose Rene

texts.es: José de 66 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 19 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación vendiendo pan francés en el mercado es así como ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos. José desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia por lo que desea realizar unas mejoras a su vivienda ya que el techo de la misma presenta daños que con el pasar de las lluvias el agua ingresa al interior de la casa por lo que incomoda a su familia, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, laminas, polines, clavos, etc., para la mejora del techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José, age 66, lives in his own home with his wife and their two children, ages 14 and 19. He's an entrepreneur who's spent a life of hard work and dedication selling French bread in the market, managing to get his kids ahead.

José wants the best for his family's quality of life, which is why he wants to make some improvements to their roof. Right now, it leaks when it rains, letting water into the house and discomfiting the family. He is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in sand, sheet metal, framing beams, nails, and other materials so that he can fix the roof of his home.

loans.use: buy materials to repair the roof of his home so it doesn't leak

loans.name: Can You See Our Shining Smiles? - N05T4Xqhải Group

texts.en:
Lân is 51 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture, raising pigs, for more than 10 years. Lân lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoá province. Her family is a low-income household in a village.

This region often suffered from natural disasters such as floods and drought. The bad weather conditions are a major factor that makes her pigs weaken and die. When that happens, she has nothing to sell and she will be in trouble with her finances.

The main hardship that Lân faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. This is Lân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan will be able to improve her living standard.

Lân is the group leader of N05T4Xqhải Group which consists of three members. With her business profit, Lân hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy. She also hopes for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie Estrella is a 43-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has four children aged 21, 14, 13 and eight years.

To earn a living, they are engaged in a fishing business. They have been doing this business for four years.

Aside from fishing, her husband works hard as a driver.

Melanie Estrella wants to improve their livelihood. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing weighs and materials for boat repair.

In the future, Melanie Estrella plans to buy a new fishing boat. She also dreams to send all of her children to school and to earn college degrees.

loans.use: to buy fishing weighs and materials for boat repair.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Fishing has been the source of income in most communities in Concepcion, Iloilo. Florita and her husband live in one of those communities and have been engaged in a fishing business. They have been doing this business for 30 years to earn a living.

Florita is a 57-year-old woman with seven adult children. Most of them are already married and have their own families. She raised them through this livelihood.

In the future, she dreams to improve her business, to have a better life, and to support the needs of her children who still depend on them.

As for now, Florita needs funds to buy materials used for fishing, such as a fishing net, fishing knot and a new engine for their boat.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, fishing knot and a new engine for their boat.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is a 53-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She earns a living through her hog raising business. She also raises chicken for additional income. Angelita has been in the business for quite some time. Angelita is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise, as well as animal feed and chicks. With a loan, Angelita will be able to improve her hog raising business and makes it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for future reinvestment in the same business and savings for a comfortable life in her old age.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and chicks.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 29 years old and married to Jose, a 49-year-old taxi driver. They have children who are studying. Jonah supplements her husband’s income by raising hogs in their backyard. She chose this enterprise because it provides food for the community. She’s been running this business for three years, and she’s convinced that it is beneficial for her and for other people.

Although the return of investment comes after several months, she is happy to provide reasonably priced food for her community in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. She is planning to expand her business by buying additional piglets and feeds. She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan for this purpose. She hopes you are willing to help her so she can increase her profit and boost her savings. She is looking forward to supporting her children’s education until completion in order to give them better opportunities in life.

She shares her experiences and aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional piglets and feeds

loans.name: Stephene

texts.en:
Stephene is 22 years old. He is married and has two children to support. He has been in the business for the last 13 years, earning an income of KES 13,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more farm inputs for a better harvest and to use the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

He plans to use the anticipated loan to repay his loan and to use the surplus to expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs for a better harvest and to use the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Gumyumutima Group

texts.fr:
Odette fait partie du groupe  Gumyumutima  et  habite à  Gitega. C’est une veuve de  42 ans. Elle a 3 enfants   âgés de 13  à 20 ans, dont 2 étudient.
 
Elle fait le commerce de farine de manioc et de farine maїs depuis  7 ans. 

Elle est à son  vingt-deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de farine de manioc et de celle de maїs  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait   acheter une vache et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Odette is part of the Gumyumutima group and lives in Gitega. She is a widow aged 42. She has three children aged between 13 and 20 years. Two of them are enrolled in school. She has been selling manioc and maize flour for seven years.

Odette is on her twenty-second loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she has requested, she is going to grow her working capital and buy a large quantity of manioc and maize flour for resale so that she can earn more income.

In the coming years, Odette would like to buy a cow and see her children study.

loans.use: to grow her working capital and buy a large quantity of manioc flour and maize flour to resell, so as to earn more income

loans.name: Hermitania

texts.en:
Hermitania is 64 years old and widowed. She works very hard to provide for her children who is still with her.

Hermitania runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Hermitania has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, candies, breads, coffee, etc.

In the future, Hermitania would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rayi-Zallem 04 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr BASSIBIRI est le responsable du groupe RAYI-ZALLEM 04 SAPONE. Il est marié et père de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé a  16 ans et le mois âgé a 04 ans. 07 enfants vont à l’école et il a 16 personnes en charge.
Mr fait de l’élevage depuis 23 ans. Il pratique aussi  l’agriculture. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 05 porcs.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mr. Bassibiri is the leader of the group Rayi-Zallem 04 Sapone.  He is married and the father of 8 children.  The oldest is 16 years old and the youngest is 4 years old.  7 of his children go to school and he is in charge of 16 people.  Mr. Bassibiri has been raising animals for 23 years.  He is also involved in agriculture.  He gets his supplies at his neighborhood market.  With this loan, he hopes to buy 5 pigs.  He wants to use the earnings from the loan to reinvest in his activity.  He is striving to ensure the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy 5 pigs

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married and has a son. She did have a business but her employer was not successful. Olena handled the problems and started a new business. Olena sells underwear at the market.

Olena is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to renovate a house. She wants to repair three rooms, put laminate on the floor, wallpaper, and do a suspended ceiling. The loan will help to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate 3 rooms  in a house.

loans.name: Nazurbi

texts.ru: Назурби 55 лет. Она проживает на районе Бохтар. Назурби замужем и в браке имеет одного ребенка. Назурби с 2000 года начала торговую деятельность. Она на рынке продает разную одежду. Сейчас в ассортимент ее товара входит мужские брюки. Назурби хочет расширить ассортимент товара и привезти другую мужскую одежду. Назурби для совершения своего плана просит кредит. Таким образом она собирается привлечь внимание клиентов и увеличить доход. Поддержите Назурби.
texts.en: Nazurbi is 55 years old. She lives in the Bohtar region. She is married, and has one child with her husband. Nazurbi began her retail business selling various types of clothing in 2000. She is now adding men's pants to her inventory. She wants to expand the variety of goods she offers, and bring in more men's clothing. Nazurbi is asking for a loan to reach her goals. She hopes this will attract attention from customers and increase earnings. Please support Nazurbi.

loans.use: to buy men's clothing

loans.name: Josselin Nohemy

texts.es: Josselin de 21 años de edad, vive muy feliz junto a sus padres, hermano y su hija de 17 meses de edad. Josselin es una es madre soltera, ella es muy trabajadora y responsable que busca darle lo mejor a su hija. Desde muy temprano, Josselin se dedica a la preparación de diferentes platos típicos entre ellos tamales, pasteles, elotes locos, enchiladas, etc.; luego por las tardes los vende con los vecinos de su comunidad; es así como Josselin gana económicamente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hija. Anteriormente, Josselin solicito un crédito a FUSAI, el cual invirtió en la compra de materiales para la venta de platos típicos; esto le permitió mejorar sus ingresos, por lo cual está muy agradecida. Nuevamente, Josselin solicita un crédito a FUSAI para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y de esta forma su negocio vaya creciendo poco a poco. Ella comprará: maíz,  elotes,  harinas,  yuca,  etc.
texts.en:
Josselin, aged 21, lives happily with her parents, her brother and her 17-month-old daughter. Josselin is a single mother, who is hard-working and responsible, and determined to do the best for her daughter.

Early each morning, Josselin prepares traditional local dishes such as tamales, pasteles (pies), elotes locos (grilled sweetcorn), enchiladas, etc., and sells them to her local community in the afternoon. In this way, she earns enough to cover the basic necessities for her daughter.

Josselin requested a previous loan from FUSAI, which she invested in supplies for making traditional foods, allowing her to improve her earnings. She was very grateful for the loan.

She is making another loan request so that she can continue to invest in her business and ensure it grows little by little. She will buy maize, corn, flours, yuca, etc.

loans.use: to buy maize, corn, flours, yuca, etc., in order to expand her business and increase her earnings.

loans.name: Fidel Angel

texts.es: Fidel de 27 años de edad, vive muy feliz junto a su compañera de vida, su hijo de 3 años de edad y sus hijas de 9 y 14 años de edad. Fidel se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador y responsable que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos. Desde hace 10 años, Fidel se a dedica a la profesión de la carpintería, es conocido por ser un carpintero que realiza buenos acabados con la madera, los clientes están muy contentos con su trabajo, es así como Fidel cubre las necesidades de su familia así como también busca darles  un futuro mejor. Anteriormente, Fidel solicito un crédito a FUSAI, el cual invirtió en la compra de herramientas, madera, etc. lo cual le permitió que su negocio creciera y mejoraron sus ingresos económicos. Nuevamente, Fidel solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir en su negocio de carpintería. El comprará: madera para poder aumentar su producción y así tendrá más modelos que vender.
texts.en:
Fidel is 27 years old. He lives happily with his partner, their 3 year old son, and their daughters, aged 9 and 14. Fidel is known to be a very hardworking and responsible man, who wants his children to succeed.

For 10 years Fidel has worked in his profession as a carpenter. He is well known for the nice finishes of his wood. His customers are very happy with his work. Through his work Fidel meets the needs of his family and seeks to provide them a better future.

Previously, Fidel sought a loan from FUSAI which he invested in the purchase of tools, wood, etc., which allowed his business to grow and improved his finances. Now, Fidel seeks a loan from FUSAI so that he can invest in his carpentry business. He will buy wood in order to increase his production, so that he will have more models to sell.

loans.use: to invest in wood, nails, screws and tools to improve his business.

loans.name: Zebedeo

texts.en:
Zebedeo, 57, is married and has two children. He has been a farmer for the last thirteen years, earning an income on average of 13,000 KES a month.

Zebedeo has applied for his first loan through Kiva's field partner Vision Fund Kenya. He is borrowing 25,000 KES to buy more farm inputs to insure a better harvest plus a dairy cow for milk production.

Zebedeo plans to use his anticipated profits to repay his loan and develop his farm. His ongoing goal is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs to insure a better harvest plus a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en:
Murodjon was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1976. He is married and has three children. He is a smart man and a master car repair technician. He has been in business for 5 years and has regular clients each day. He requests a loan from IMON to pay his son’s tuition fee. He plans to educate his son with a higher education degree to become a specialist.

He hopes KIVA lenders will support him, he awaits their kindness.

loans.use: to pay his son's higher education costs.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old, married, and supports six children. He has been a small scale farmer for the last 10 years. He earns an income of 13,000 KES per month.

He has applied for 25,000 KES from Vision fund Kenya to purchase certified fertilizer and seeds to get a better harvest.

He plans to use the gained profits to repay his loan and the surplus to expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more maize for sell.

loans.name: Srey Tep

texts.en:
Srey Tep is 20 years old, single, and lives with her family at Posen Chey district , Phnom Penh.

Srey Tep is a student who has studied accounting at the Vanda Institute in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is in the first semester of her second year. She also teaches English part time near her home. She would likes to apply for a loan for pay her school fee. She used to work at a garment factory for 2 years and saved some money to pay for her studies; so she wants to be an accountant in the future.

loans.use: To pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Carita De Angel Group

texts.es:
Carmen continúa con su negocio de venta y elaboración de chorizo. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de insumos de cocina como carne, aceite, especias, sal, etc. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. En esta oportunidad lidera la banca de emprendimiento para solicitar un crédito y mejorar su negocios, “mi negocio está creciendo y me siento muy feliz por esta nueva oportunidad…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de ingrediente e insumos de cocina para elaborar chorizos artesanales. Su sueño es ser la vendedora más popular, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos e ingredientes para la elaboración de chorizos. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carmen solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos e ingredientes para la elaboración de chorizos.
texts.en: Carmen continues with her business of making and selling chorizo sausages. She invested the previous loan in buying cooking inputs such as meat, oil, spices, salt, etc. She made her payments on time because she had no problems. This time, she is the leader of this undertaking group to request a loan and improve their businesses. "My business is growing and I feel very happy for this new opportunity...", she comments. The advantage of her business is that she has regular customers, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy cooking ingredients and inputs to make handmade sausages. Her dream is to be the most popular saleswoman. She wants to buy inputs and ingredients to make chorizo sausages. This is her third loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years she has been working in this job. These are the reasons why Carmen is requesting a loan to buy inputs and ingredients to make chorizo sausages.

loans.use: to buy inputs and ingredients to make chorizo sausages.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 47 years old and married with six children, four attending school. He lives in Hoima, Uganda where he is in business buying and selling produce, mainly maize and beans. This is supplemented by income from growing cassava. He started his business in 2009 to support his family only to be limited by price fluctuations and a poor road network that hinders his service delivery. He is seeking a loan to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:
Garba is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dan Magani Village. Garba joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Garba's harvest suffered from poor yields that negatively affected his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Garba will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds. He wants to earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Garba now has the opportunity to increase his yields, income, and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 33-year-old married woman with 5 children (4 attend school). She lives in Kasese,Uganda. Joyce is a teacher and gets additional income selling water and soda. She is an honest woman with a great desire to educate her children at higher institutions. She is challenged by high rental fees and delayed salary payments from the government. She intends to use the loan to pay school fees for children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, sauce pans, and cups among other items to sell

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en: Shaban is 40 years old, married with four children, and lives in Bundibugo, Uganda. He is a carpenter by profession to support his family and earns additional income from farming. He dreams of educating his children to the university level and to build a permanent house. But he is challenged by lack of enough capital to expand his business. He is requesting a loan to buy timber and carpentry materials like nails and vanish to use in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy timber and carpentry materials like nails and vanish to use in his workshop.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
From Tashar Kanawa Village, Musa is a maize farmer who joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Musa will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize.

This season, Musa has grand plans to harvest 30 bags, a yield that will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Musa now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Alhaji Ibinu

texts.en:
Alhaji Ibinu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dan Magani Village. Alhaji Ibinu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Alhaji Ibinu's harvest suffered from poor yields that negatively affected his ability to pay for his children's school fees.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Alhaji Ibinu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. His income will increase considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Alhaji Ibinu now has the opportunity to increase his yields, income, and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs.

loans.name: Shakarbibi

texts.ru: Шакарбиби дехканка. Она уже много  занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Она решила заняться этой деятельностью потому, что ее родители тоже занимались именно этой сфере деятельности. И родители ей научили, как выращивать растение и правильно вести работу. Сейчас Шакарбиби нуждается в кредит, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения, ей необходимо для обработки землю и посева урожай. Это кредит поможет ей во время провести новый посев и получить качественный урожай. Шакарбиби ждет Вашу поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Shakarbibi is a farmer. She has been in the agricultural sphere for a long time. She decided to work in this sphere because her parents were also in this same business, and they taught her how to grow crops and do the work correctly. Now Shakarbibi needs a loan to buy fertilizer for preparing and sowing the land. This loan will help her do the planting on time and grow a high quality crop. Shakarbibi hopes for your support and kindness.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees for the new semester.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 19-year-old single man from Kanyounis city, located in the Gaza strip. He lives with his family in a small house. Because it’s difficult to find a job in Gaza, he wants to open his own business, a mobile phone store. He has experience selling mobiles and providing maintenance; he has an entrepreneurial spirit.

In order to get started, Ayman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy mobile phones and accessories for his new store and become independent.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories for his new store to resell.

loans.name: Karimkul

texts.en: Karimkul is a hard-working man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan to a family of farmers. He is married and has three children. He is a teacher at a secondary school. His wife is a cook at that school. Eighteen years ago, they moved from the Ayni region to Zafarabad. It was hard for his family to move. Thanks to Zafarabad governance they were given a room where they could live. They decided to start a business and got a loan to buy livestock to raise. After five years they increased the amount of livestock and this business helped them to live better. They had no problems repaying the loan on time. One of his daughters has been sick from her childhood. She needs daily medication from the pharmacy. They tried to treat her at hospitals and medical clinics but unfortunately doctors could not help them. Karimkul and his wife decided to get a loan from IMON.to pay for medical care for his daughter and to buy pharmacy medicines. He awaits Kiva lenders' kindness and support. He hopes someday to see his daughter in good health..

loans.use: to pay medical treatment for his daughter and buy medicine.

loans.name: Haikassouma

texts.fr:
Mr HAIKASSOUMA est marié sans enfant et il a 02 personnes en charges.
Mr fait de l'élevage depuis 08 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s'acheter 100 poussins coquelets, 10 sacs de 50 kg d'aliments pour ovins, et 10 cartons de produits pour traitement.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer son activité. Il ambitionne acheter une parcelle pour son élevage.
texts.en:
Mr. Haikassouma is married with no children and he is supporting two people. He has been raising livestock for eight years. He buys his supplies in nearby markets. With the money from the loan, he intends to buy 100 cockerel chicks, 10 sacks of 50 kg each of feed for sheep, and 10 cartons of treatment products.

Mr. Haikassouma wants to use the profits from the loan to grow his business. His ambition is to buy a piece of land for his livestock-raising activity.

loans.use: to buy 100 cockerel chicks, 10 sacks of 50 kg each of feed for sheep, and 10 cartons of treatment products.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru:
Чумагул 52 летняя жительница района Файзабад. Она счастливая бабушка, мать и жена. Чумагул обожает проводить время вместе с внуками. Ее муж находится на заработках в России. Чумагул дома занимается шитьем одежды. 6 той год как она как каждый день она шьет и кроит платья с национальным акцентом. 
Чумагул решила отремонтировать дом. Она планирует купить стройматериалы, нанять рабочих строителей и начать ремонт, но ее капитал не позволяют ей совершить данную операцию. Чумагул обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купит стройматериалы и оплатить услуги строителей. Она надеется, что ее поддержат.
texts.en: Jumagul is a 52 year old resident of the Fayzabad region. She is happy to be a grandmother, mother, and wife. Jumagul loves to spend time with her grandchildren. Her husband is working abroad in Russia. Jumagul works from home as a seamstress. Its been around 6 years since she started sewing and embroidering dresses every day with traditional designs. Jumagul has decided to renovate her home. She wants to buy the building materials, hire construction workers, and begin the work, but she doesn't have the financial capital to do so. Jumagul is asking for a loan to buy building materials and pay for the contractors. She hopes that you will support her.

loans.use: To buy building materials and pay for a contractor

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 30 years old. He is married and has two children. His business is farming. He has been in this business for five years. He earns a monthly income of ten thousand shillings.

This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy water pipes for his irrigation project. He will use the profits from the expanded business to save and buy a piece of land.

His hopes and dreams are to have a large source of income.

loans.use: to buy water pipes for his irrigation project.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a teacher, and he built his home a few years ago with his own working capital. Now, his house has deterioriated, and he has a plan to repair his house.

He plans to rehabilitate it, but his money is not enough to buy more materials to repair his house. So, he is requesting a loan of $ 1,000.00 from the Tuba Rai Metin to add to his capital, and then he will use the funds to buy more materials like stone, sand, cement, iron, wood, nails and other materials to use.

He is very hopeful that with this money, he can finish the rehabilitation of his house.

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement, iron, wood, nails and other materials to use.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 50-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and their children in a simple house. Lubna's husband works as an employee for a local company. He earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Lubna would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Lubna took out a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to buy a water purification machine for the family house. With this loan, Lubna will be able to provide clean water especially for her children.

Lubna appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Agathe's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 4 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 19 novembre 2004. Il est composé de femmes  qui habitent le même quartier. Les membres vivent dans  la bonne entente et sont solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche. 
AGATHE debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est  célibataire et mère d'un garçon.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle compte faire de l'embouche en allant acheter  3 veaux. Elle achète l'un à 115 000 FCFA et le revend au bout de 5 mois d'élevage à 205 000 FCFA au plus. Avec le reste du prêt, elle achète de l'aliment de bétail. 
Les bénéfices serviront à assurer le études de son fils et aussi à satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en:
This four-member group is a part of a 'banc villeageois' established on November 19, 2004. It is made up of women who live in the same neighborhood. The members have a good relationship and are united. Their principal employments are trade and raising livestock.

Agatha, standing on the right side of the photo with her left hand raised, is 47 years old. She is single and the mother of one boy.

With this loan, she intends to raise livestock by purchasing three calves. She will by one at 115,000 francs and, after raising it for five months, resell it for as much as 205,000 francs. With the remainder of the loan, she will buy livestock feed.

With the profits, she will be able to ensure schooling for her son and also meet her needs.

loans.use: to buy three calves.

loans.name: Mame Anta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 37 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 21 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes du même quartier qui ont de bonnes relations qui s'activent dans le commerce et l’élevage
DABA  debout à gauche de la photo et levant la main droite est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère 3 enfants dont 1 garçon et 2 filles.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle envisage d'acheter des chaussures et des vêtements pour les revendre. Elle achète 23 à 24 paires de chaussures, la paire à 1 200 FCFA. Elle revend ensuite la paire à 2 000 FCFA. Elle achète aussi des vêtements 10 au total pour 1 500 voire 2 000 FCFA l’unité et la cède à 3 000 FCFA. Le reste du prêt servira pour le transport des marchandises. 
Les bénéfices  serviront à s’occuper de sa famille, surtout ces enfants, et aussi réinvestir.
texts.en: This group of 37 members is part of a village bank which was created December 21st 2009.  It brings together women from the from the same neighborhood who have good relationships with each other and are involved in business and animal raising. Daba, who is at the front left of the picture raising her right hand, is 35 years old.  She is divorced and the mother of three children, 1 boy and 2 girls. With this loan, she plans to buy some shoes and clothes to resell.  She buys 23-24 pairs of shoes at 1200 FCFA for each pair.  She then resells the pair for 2000 FCFA.  She also buys 10 pieces of clothing at 1500 - 2000 FCFA each and earns 3000 FCFA for each.  The rest of the loan will be used to transport the merchandise.  The earnings will be used to take care of her family, especially the children, and also to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy some clothes and shoes

loans.name: Coura's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 02/09/2008 et il regroupe des femmes issues du même quartier unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Coura est la responsable elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle s'active dans le commerce de poulets et de poussins avec son nouveau crédit de 400 000 francs CFA elle va acheter des poussins des poulets qu'elle va engraisser et revendre au détails.
Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires de sa familles et de renforcer le capital de son activité.
texts.en:
This group was created on September 2, 2008 and it encompasses women who come from the same neighborhood and are united by good social and professional relationships.

Madame Coura is the leader of the group. She is married and the mother of six children. She has been active in selling chickens and chicks. With her loan portion amounting to 400,000 F CFA, she is going to buy chicks and chickens that she will raise and sell retail. She has a good deal of experience in this field as she has been in it for a long time.

The profits from her business will permit her to cover food for her family and to grow the working capital of her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicks that she will resell retail.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kargo Village. Dauda joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dauda will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Dauda now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Nyarukere Group

texts.fr:
Méthode   fait partie du groupe Nyarukere  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  a 37 ans et est marié à Nonie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 2 mois à 6 ans.

Il fait le commerce des habits confectionnés  depuis 14 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  mètres de tissus  pour confectionner des habits à  vendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, il  voudrait  acheter des terrains cultivables.
texts.en:
Méthode is a member of the Nyarukere Group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 37 years old and married to Nonie, a farmer. Together, they have four children aged between two months old and six years old.

He has been selling home-made clothing for 14 years.

This will be his second loan from Turame. With this Kiva loan, he will increase his capital and  purchase several metres of fabric in order to create clothing which will be resold at a profit.

In the years to come, he would like to purchase land for growing crops.

loans.use: to increase their capital and purchase several metres of fabric in order to create clothing which will be resold at a profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a portable solar home solution for her business and to increase her productive hours and her income

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en: Barnabas is a Babban Gona farmer from Jalawa Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Barnabas no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to purchase better inputs to improve his price. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably. This season Barnabas has ambitious plans to harvest 40 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Barnabas now has the opportunity to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a Babban Gona farmer from Gayya Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, David no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  This season David has ambitious plans to harvest 60 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, David now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Feliz

texts.pt:
O cliente Feliz é casado, trabalhador como segurança e comerciante vende diversos produtos em sua casa, pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam o ensino primário e 1 ainda sem idade escolar, vive na casa cedida pelo pai.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar, caixa de omo, cigarro, óleo, arroz, farinha para reforçar o seu negocio .
A cliente tem como sonho ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes, pagar o empréstimo sem problemas.
Tem como principais desafios financeiros e a concorrência no mercado tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Feliz is married. He works as a security guard, and he is a businessman selling a variety of products out of his home. He is a father of 3, 2 of them in grade school and 1 a small child. He lives in a house his father gave him.
With this loan, he will buy laundry detergent, cigars, oil, rice, flour to better stock his business. 
His dream is to expand this business to answer to the needs of his customers, and to repay this loan without problems.
He struggles financially, but his goal is to work hard and request for future loans in order to fulfill his dreams and overcome his difficult times.

loans.use: to buy laundry detergent, cigars, oil, rice, flour to better stock his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in lumber, roofing and posts to construct a hallway.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and sand to cover the walls with cement in the rooms of her house to prevent a pest infestation.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan to a family of workers. She is a widow and has four children. She is hardworking, responsible, honest and a bright person.

Her husband left his children and family and married another woman. Nargis felt hard times over her life period. It was not easy to raise her children alone. In order to live and support her family, she started to work as a rental worker at a collective farm. She tried to feed her children.

Afterward, she found a job vacancy at a lyceum and successfully passed exams. Recently, it was her 14th anniversary of working there. She has been tired for several years and is sick. She is willing to be healed at a medical clinic. She appealed to IMON, asking for financial support to be treated at a hospital. She hopes to be supported and awaits KIVA lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to be treated at hospital

loans.name: Isano Group

texts.en:
Clemantine is a single 31-year-old woman, who has assumed the care and responsibility of four orphans. She is the leader of Isano Group and is pictured above sitting on the right side holding a paper in her hands. Clemantine works hard to support her family and provide them with a better life. For the past 14 years Clemantine has sold second-hand clothing.   

Every morning Clemantine opens her shop at 8 am and works tirelessly until her daily supply is sold. Sometimes she is required to venture outside the confines of her shop to sell her items door to door. She is requesting a loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, to expand her business buy purchasing additional inventory for her resale business. Because the cost second-hand items are less than new items, she will be able to maximize the value of her loan and increase her profit margin. With her profits, she will be able to get medical insurance for the orphans under her care and will use the remaining profit to expand her current second-hand offerings.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Arts and craft as an industry used to be regarded as a job meant for men, however some Zimbabwean businesswomen are breaking the custom and also venturing into that lucrative industry. It requires bravery and expertise for one to be a successful artist.
Blandina has proved that she has what it takes to be into the arts sector. She is a 32 year old woman and she is married and has 3 school going children. In the process of her work, she prepares flour porridge and treats the fabric for painting. She draws the designs on the fabrics with flour and she puts the fabrics outside for the whole day to dry in the sun and thereafter she paints different designs imitating the flour designs on the fabrics. When it is festival time, she travels to Tanzania where she sells and markets her naturally designed products.

The loan will help Blandina to make paintings of different sizes which are more marketable and of high demand by most of her prospective buyers. The larger paintings require more capital as they need more raw materials and paints.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to expand her painting business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy cattle for fattenning to sell. This is his main business although he practices crop growing maize for selling. The reason behind being involved in the above businesses is to generate income for a better future. He works hard and tirelessly as he plans for the health and future of his family despite the setbacks from his business of prolonged droughts and lack of enough water plus pastures for his cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Halliru

texts.en:
Halliru is a Babban Gona farmer from Pampaida Dutse Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Halliru no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see increase him increase his income considerably. This season Halliru has ambitious plans to harvest 70 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Halliru now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Tarkdead Group

texts.en:
Khamphong’s village sources much of its drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Khamphong and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.

The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Khamphong’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

Khamphong and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter in order to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: The person featured in the picture is Rose. She is 35 years old and married, with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 to access financial management and enterprise development training. Since then Elizabeth has been able to acquire these skills and she has been able to grow her business by adding more stock and enlarging her fish business, located outside her shop. She also operates a kiosk where she sells consumables such as maize flour, sugar and also basic household items. Rose is applying for a Kiva loan to enable her add more stock, which will improve her sales and income. She intends to use a portion of the income to re-invested in the business and the rest in improving and uplifting her family living standards by getting better education and clothing for her children. She is thankful to Kiva and their lenders, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To add more stock to improve sales and enable her meet the cost of school fees for her children

loans.name: Seesawangneua Group

texts.en:
Team understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Team knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Team purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Team is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter in order to have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar solution for his business and to pursue an increase in his income.

loans.name: Codou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 31 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 28 décembre 2009. Il est composé de femmes  qui habitent le même quartier. Les membres vivent dans  la bonne entente et sont solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce, l’élevage et l'agriculture.
ASTOU debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont 2 filles et 1 garçon.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle compte faire de l'aviculture. Elle va acheter une caisse de poussin à 30 000 FCFA. la caisse fait 50 poussins. Elle achète aussi de l'aliment pour un montant de 20 000 FCFA. Après maturité, les poulets sont revendus à 2500 FCFA l'unité.
Les bénéfices serviront à répondre aux charges familiales d'une part, et d'autre part à épargner.
texts.en:
This 31-member group is a part of a 'banc villageois' established on December 28, 2009. It is made up of women who live in the same neighborhood. The members have a good relationship and are united. Their primary employment is trade, raising livestock, and farming.

Astou, standing on the right side of photograph with her left hand raised, is 29 years old. She is married and the mother of three children, two girls and one boy.

With this loan, she intends to raise poultry. She will purchase one crate of chicks for 30,000 francs. There are 50 chicks in a crate. She will also purchase 20,000 francs worth of feed. Once full grown, the chickens will be resold for 2,500 francs apiece.

The profits will allow her to both meet her family's needs and to save.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a Kiva borrower and she describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops and her primary customers are locals. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use

loans.name: Eyaima Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Aminata is a thirty-five-year-old business woman. She is a member of Eyaima solidarity group, which has four women. Aminata sells cooked food. She has been in this cooked food business for the past five years. She opens her business six days a week from 9 am to 6 pm.

Aminata established her business to help support her family.

Aminata and her group members need a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL of which she is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL to buy more; three bags of rice, two rubber containers of palm oil, two cartons of fish, two bags of onions, etc. for her business. Aminata is standing on the left of the group picture.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Aminata is married and has two children who are in business.

In the future, Aminata plans to save more money to provide for her to expand her business. She and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more; three bags of rice, two rubber containers of palm oil and two cartons of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizer and seeds for planting in order to get a better harvest.

loans.name: Bokum Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Ramatu is a thirty-three-year-old business woman and a member of Bokum solidarity group, which has four members, all of whom are women. Ramatu sells slippers to the general public.

Ramatu has been in this business for the past 8 years. She opens her business six days a week from 8 am to 6 pm. She established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food from the profit she gets from her business. Ramatu is on the left of the picture.

Ramatu and her group members need a loan totaling 5,500,000 SLL of which she is entitled to 1,500,000 SLL in order to buy 20 bundles of slippers for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Ramatu is married and has two children with the ages of 14 and 7 years, who are both school going children.

In the future, Ramatu plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Ramatu and the rest of the group members will be very appreciative to anyone that can help.

loans.use: to buy 20 bundles of slippers for her business

loans.name: Colgate Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Kumba is the leader of Colgate Solidarity Group, which is made up of four members. All four members including Kumba are engaged in petty trading but selling different products. She sells charcoal and firewood. Joseph has been selling charcoal/firewood for the past two years. She uses proceeds of her business to pay fees for her children’s education and to provide a livelihood for her family.

Kumba and the other group members of Colgate Solidarity are requesting for their first loan a total of 4,000,000 SLL. Of this amount, Kumba will personally receive 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to purchase 100 more bags of charcoal for her business. Kumba is standing in the middle of the picture.

Kumba is married and has a cheerful family of two children with the ages of 30 and 22 years old. Kumba hopes that her business continues to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and also prepare for her old age. Kumba hopes that this loan will earn her more profit to support her family.

Kumba and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase 100 more bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 29 years of age, a married father of two children and both attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in produce, mainly the buying and selling of maize and beans. He also owns a market stall in order to supplement his income.

Isaac expects to grow and fulfill the increasing demand of his customers, only to be limited by inadequacy of capital. He will use the loan facility to buy maize and beans for resale. The extra person in the photo is the borrowers child whom we captured while taking the photo.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Muhtasar

texts.en:
Muhtasar is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1981, had a hard childhood, and lives in a small town with her family. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an emigrant. Her parents are farmers and she helped them raise livestock.

After getting married, she thought her life would be easier, but it was not. It was hard for her and her husband to support the family. She is happy to have an agriculture business to grow wheat, potatoes, and grains. Her husband works abroad and sends money when he can. They have cows and she sells the milk to earn money to cover their expenditures.

She is sick and needs to visit a medical clinic. She hopes KIVA lenders will support her. She hopes to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses.

loans.name: Rebeca Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Rebeca Yolanda pertenece al banco comunal VILCANOTA, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia sigue dedicándose a la venta de artesanía, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia sigue  vendiendo portavasos, mantas y telares entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia, a la vez la socia es profesora cesante.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar mantas entre otros.
La socia es una persona un poco timida y al momento de tomar la foto la socia se agacho.
Las personas mayores de 65 años de edad están excluidas del sistema financiero formal y gracias a los inversionistas de Kiva pueden lograr su financiamiento de tal manera la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This group member, Rebeca Yolanda, belongs to the VILCANOTA communal bank which is located in the province of Urumba in the Cusco department. Rebeca still works selling craftworks. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her repayments. She is a responsible and diligent person. She sells coasters, blankets and weaving for all her clients who ask her to. This is how Rebeca helps her family to get ahead. At the same time she is currently out of work as a teacher.

Rebeca is asking for this loan in order to buy blankets, among other things. She is a little shy and looked down when the photo was taken.

People over 65 years old are excluded from the formal financial system and thanks to Kiva investors they can manage their financing in such a way that Rebeca is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy blankets and other craftworks.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is 61 years old, a married woman, and she runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews garments, and then sells them to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being.

For the improvement of her business, Tasleem has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently so as to increase her net income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently so as to increase her net income and improve their standard of living.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El socio Domingo pertenece al banco comunal VILCANOTA, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio continua con su negocio de Imprenta, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
El socio requiere el préstamo para la compra de papeles, tintes entre otros.
 El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
Las personas mayores de 65 años de edad están excluidas del sistema financiero formal y gracias a los inversionistas de Kiva pueden lograr su financiamiento de tal manera la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Domingo belongs to the "Vilcanota" communal bank, which is located in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

He continues with his printing business and he is a responsible and determined person. He has worked in this business for years and things are going well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his business each day. He hopes to continue working so he can keep supporting his family.

He requires a loan to buy paper, ink and other items.

He is grateful for the opportunity he has been given by means of the loan and he promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

People over age 65 are excluded from the formal financial system, but thanks to Kiva investors, they are able to get financing in such a way that the member promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 2 bales of used clothing for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy two sacks of shoes for men and women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase concentrated feed and vitamins plus metal sheets and chicken wire for the roof of the chicken area.

loans.name: Quisito

texts.pt:
O cliente e trabalhador, casado pai de 3 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino secundário , 2  frequentam o ensino primario, tem tambem 3 netos na sua responsabilidade vive em casa própria.
 O cliente conseguiu com os empréstimos anteriores começar a sua casa tipo 2  e com este pretende comprar, ferro, cimento, porta, chapas de zinco e pagar a mao-de-obra para dar continuidade da sua obra.
O cliente tem como sonhos concluir e ampliar a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família.
Tem como desafios financeiros tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
He is a working man, married, and the father of three children; one goes to secondary school, and two to primary school. He also has three grandchildren under his care. He owns the house where he lives.

With the previous loans, he was able to start building a two-bedroom house. With this one, he is planning to buy iron, cement, a door, and zinc sheets, and pay for the labor needed to continue with the construction works.

His dreams are to finish building his house and enlarge it in order to offer his family a better home. His challenges are financial in nature. He has continued to work and is planning to apply for more loans in order to overcome the difficulties and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, a door, zinc sheets, and pay for the labor needed to continue with the construction works.

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.pt:
A sra Esperanca, casada, mãe de 06 filhos dos quais 03 estão nos lares e os restantes estão na sua responsabilidade.
