Para alem dos seus filhos, sustenta ainda 03 sobrinhos e 06 netos que frequentam o ensino escolar. Com o emprestimo pretende comprar duves, lençois, fatos, e outros utensilios para revender.
Ela sonha em ampliar o seu negócio, construir a sua loja para poder colocar a mercadoria. O seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo estabelecido.
texts.en:
Esperanca is married and the mother of six children; three of them have their own homes, and the remaining ones are under her care. In addition, she takes care of three nephews/nieces and six grandchildren; all of them go to school.

With this loan, she is planning to buy duvets, bed sheets, clothes, and other products for resale.

Her dream is to expand her business and build a store to sell her products. She faces the challenge of paying off the loan according to plan.

loans.use: to buy duvets, bed sheets, clothes, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a Babban Gona Farmers Organization maize farmer from Masama Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  

In the past, Bitrus suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Bitrus has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Bitrus will have access to high-quality farm inputs, such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. 

With ambitious goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize this year, Bitrus can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm yields.

loans.name: Gricelda Rocio

texts.es:
Gricelda, es una mujer joven, emprendedora y con grandes deseos de superación, estudio hasta quinto grado, actualmente está acompañada y es madre de una niña.

Griselda, desde pequeña le ayudó a su mamá en la agricultura y aprendió mucho de ese oficio, ahora junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio; ella anteriormente había solicitado un crédito, el cual lo invirtió en una tienda y gracias a las ganancias obtenidas, junto a su esposo iniciaron con la venta de verduras que también les ha dado muy buenos resultados.

El crédito que ahora está solicitando le servirá para surtir más su tienda y la venta de verduras, de esa manera podrá obtener mejores ganancias. 

Sus sueños a futuro son, ampliar más su tienda y obtener resultados favorables para ella y su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Gricelda is a young and enterprising woman with a strong will to get ahead. She studied up to the fifth grade. She is in a relationship and has a daughter.

Since she was a little girl, Gricelda has helped her mother with her agriculture activities, so she learned a lot. Now, she and her husband are businesspeople. She had requested a loan before, and used it to open a store. Thanks to the profits they made, she and her husband started selling vegetables, which has given her very good results too.

With this loan, she will buy products for her store and vegetables to sell. This will result in more profits for her. Her dreams are to expand her store in the future, and obtain good results for her and her small family’s sake.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store, and vegetables to sell, such as tomatoes, chilies, and onions.

loans.name: Devine Group

texts.en:
Devine is a golden group of ladies, who might be defined in the business circles as women who have outlived their purpose to be in business, but surprisingly they are still operating like never before.

In this group we have four ladies who are all widows, ladies who befit the title heroines of many battles since they have seen many challenges in leading their families.

In this group we have Felistars (the one with a white hat in the picture) who usually goes to a local lake with clothes and trades those clothes for fish. Felistars then resells fish in a town outside Harare.

Her business may sound petty, but through it she has earned income enough to send her children to school. She sometimes face challenges of bad debts, which always reduce her business activity.

Felistars hopes that a loan from Thrive will help her to buy more fish which will help in dealing with the cashflow gaps that result from the fish credit sales.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Macharia

texts.en:
Macharia is 36 years old. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially on enterprise development. She practices vegetable farming, growing potatoes, cabbage, kale and carrots. She also operates a grocery store and sells secondhand clothes.

Macharia is taking out a Kiva loan to buy more secondhand shoes to expand her clothes selling business. She intends to use the profits to buy certified vegetable seeds in order to boost farming production.

Macharia is grateful to Kiva and lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy secondhand shoes to expand her clothes selling business and to buy certified vegetable seeds with the profits to boost farming production.

loans.name: Plaza Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Yeabu is a member of Plaza Solidarity Group. She is married with five children. Some of them are students and the rest are presently working in different institutions. (See group picture; Yeabu stands in the middle, fair in complexion).  

Twenty years ago, Yeabu established her business, where she sells rice, salt, oil, pepper etc., to support herself and her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning material, and provides food from the profit she gets from the business. She sells six days per week from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Yeabu plans  to use the loan to buy bags of rice, pepper, oil, salt, etc. for resale. She will use the proceeds from the business to open a savings account which will be used in paying her children’s school fees. Yeabu plans to save some money to pay fees, build a house, and live a happy life.

Yeabu and her group members need a loan totaling 5,000,000 SLL, of which Yeabu is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL. They thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, pepper, oil, salt, etc. for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es:
María, de 45 años de edad, es una persona emprendedora, solo estudio hasta primer grado, es madre de cinco hijos, la mayor de ellos ya está casada y los otros cuatro hijos están solteros, dos de sus hijas mayores trabajan y los dos varones aún estudian y el esposo de María, se dedica a la agricultura.

María, ella tiene un puesto de frutas y verduras en el mercado, tiene aproximadamente dieciocho años de ser comerciante; gracias a las cosechas agrícolas que se generaban en su hogar, fue como ella comenzó a ir al mercado y de esa manera poco a poco comenzó en el negocio, gracias a su trabajo y el de su compañero de vida, logró darle el estudio a todos sus hijos, viaja aproximadamente treinta minutos desde su casa hasta el mercado todos los días y trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m.

María, necesita el crédito para pagar otro puesto que adquirió, para ampliar más su negocio.

Sus sueños a futuros son, poder darle el estudio a sus últimos hijos, para que ellos se puedan desempeñar en el campo laboral.- De igual manera ella quiere continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
45-year-old María is an enterprising person. She only studied up to the first grade, and is the mother of five children. The eldest daughter is married, and the remaining four are single. Her two daughters work and her two sons are still in school. María’s husband works in agriculture.

María has a stall at the marketplace, where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has worked as a businesswoman for approximately eighteen years. Thanks to the food her family grew, she started to visit the marketplace and that is how she started her business, little by little. All her children could go to school, thanks to her and her husband’s work. She travels approximately thirty minutes every day to go to the marketplace. She works from 05:00 am until 3:00 pm.

María needs this loan to pay for another stall she got in order to expand her business. Her dreams are to be able to pay for her youngest children’s studies in the future, so that they can find a job. She also wants to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy another stand she got in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada y vive junto a sus hijos y su esposo que es pescador.

Marta, es empleada en un rancho en la playa desde hace un año, su esposo también le apoya económicamente a través de la pesca. 

Marta, necesita el préstamo para comprar venta y compra de ropa, para comenzar a vender en la zona donde ella reside.

Los sueños de Marta, son tener una casa propia y darle un mejor estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Marta is 29 years old and attended school through the fourth grade. She is married and lives with her children and husband who is a fisherman. Marta has worked on a ranch by the beach for close to one year. Her husband also supports her financially through fishing. Marta needs this loan to purchase clothes and a small store front to begin selling in the area where she lives. Marta's dreams are to have her own house and give her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and a small store front.

loans.name: Ando Tiana

texts.fr:
Ando Tiana est une femme travailleuse de 27 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants de 8 et 11 ans. Ces derniers vont actuellement à l'école. Son époux travaille comme agent de sécurité.
Pour aider son mari à entretenir sa famille, elle exerce une activité de vente de viande de poulet de chair et de poissons et ceci depuis l'an 2005. Avant cette année elle était femme de ménage.
Son projet est d’effectuer elle-même l’élevage des poulets de chair car en ce moment elle ne fait qu'acheter et puis revendre après les viandes. Elle a calculé que cette option est plus bénéfique et plus avantageux que l'achat et revente.
En plus, son objectif dans la vie est d'avoir sa propre maison, c'est pourquoi, elle s'efforce d'épargner davantage en ce moment pour pouvoir réaliser ce rêve.
texts.en:
Ando Tiana is a hardworking 27-year old woman. She is married and mother to two children aged 8 and 11 years. They are currently going to school. Her husband works as a security guard.
To help her husband take care of the family, she has been selling chicken and fish since 2005. Prior to this she was a housewife. Her goal is to rear the chickens herself as right now all she does is purchase them and then resell the meat. She has calculated that this option is more beneficial and advantageous than purchasing and reselling.
In addition, her goal in life is to have her own house, which is why she is ensuring to save more right now so that she can achieve this dream.

loans.use: to buy chicken and fish.

loans.name: Gabriela Maria

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene 19 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Actualmente trabaja cuidando a unos niños, por lo cual recibe medio salario básico, y estudia  el último año de secundaria. Ella trabaja para apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar y para poder acabar la secundaria. Vive en casa familiar con su madre y sus hermanos, su padre se encuentra de viaje, y únicamente regresa a casa una vez al año.
Vive en el barrio Machángara alto, de la ciudad de Otavalo, en el sector las personas se dedican a la producción y comercio de prendas de vestir, en esta temporada principalmente confeccionan sacos y pantalones en tela polar, que son los productos más demandados tanto por comerciantes como por turistas que visitan la ciudad los días miércoles y sábado. Otavalo también es muy conocido por sus atractivos turísticos, como la plaza de ponchos, el mirador ubicado en el centro cultural Kinty wasi, más conocido como Colibrí.
Gabriela aparte de su trabajo también se dedica al comercio de productos AVON, empezó con el comercio de estos productos desde el mes de noviembre del año pasado, pero por falta de capital tuvo que dejar esta actividad, ahora desea reiniciar nuevamente con este negocio, y necesita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos, bisutería y otros productos. Agradece a Fundación Alternativa por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a hardworking young woman. She is 19 years old, single and has no children. She currently works by caring for children, where she receives an average based salary. She is in her senior year of her studies.

She works to support her mother with household expenses and to be able to finish high school.

She lives in the family home with her mother and her brothers. Her father is currently away, and only returns home once a year.

She lives in the high Machángara neighborhood of the city of Otavalo. In this area people are engaged in the production and trade of garments. For the current season they mainly produce coats and fleece pants, which are the products most in demand by both traders and tourists who visit the city every Wednesday and Saturday.

Otavalo is also well known for its tourist attractions, like the Plaza de Ponchos,and the look-out located in the cultural center Kinty Wasi, better known as Hummingbird.

Gabriela, besides her work, also sells AVON products. She started to work with these products since November of last year, but due to lack of capital had to stop this activity. She now hopes to restart again with this business.

She needs a loan to invest in buying cosmetics, jewelry and other products. She is very thankful to Fundacion Alternativa for their support.

loans.use: to start her cosmetics, jewelry and other products business, thus she will be able to continue supporting her mother and siblings.

loans.name: Miriam Aguedita

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 46 años de edad,conviviente, vive con su conyuge y sus hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Miriam se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Miriam espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Miriam is 46 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in a rural area in the district of Cayaltí that is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. The residents of this district make a living mainly through farming, raising livestock and trade. 

Miriam makes a living raising and selling small animals such as chickens, roosters, ducks and turkeys, among others. Her business is located in her home. She has several years of experience in the business and very good personal and work references in the area.  

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy a greater quantity of animals such as roosters, ducks, turkeys and chickens, as well as nutritional feed for them.

With this, Miriam hopes to offer a better product to her customers, which will allow her to generate more profit and therefore increase the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals.

loans.name: Aida Rosemary

texts.en:
Aida is a 50-year-old married woman with seven children living in Masindi, Uganda.

Aida operates a bar and lodge as her major business, but she also owns rentals. She has been in this business for the last ten years and is grateful to Kiva for the previous loan which helped her to improve her business.

Aida has a dream of educating her child and requests for a loan to buy sodas, beer and spirits to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer and spirits to sell

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
María, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera de una niña de 2 años de edad, su pareja viajó a E.E.U.U. y se olvidó de ella, es por eso que ha tenido que trabajar duro, para sacar adelante a su hija y actualmente vive con su mamá.  

María, se dedica a la venta de materiales para limpieza por catálogo desde hace 1 año y le está dando buenos resultados, pero existen promociones que se hacen compradas y ella no tiene capital para aprovechar esas oportunidades, este trabajo lo hace por tardes desde las 2:00 p.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. todos los días.
 
María, necesita el crédito para comprar productos por catálogo para vender, porque si los compra le darán un porcentaje mayor de ganancia en algunos de los productos.

María, sueña con seguir trabajando para darle lo necesario a su hija y en un futuro poder tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Maria is 20 years old and studied up to sixth grade. She is a single mother of a 2-year-old girl. Her partner traveled to the US and has since forgotten her. This is why she has had to work hard to raise her daughter. She currently lives with her mother.

For one year now, Maria sells cleaning materials through catalog and is getting good results, but there are promotions that are done in cash and she has no capital to seize these opportunities. She works afternoons from 2:00 pm to 5:00 pm every day.

Maria needs a loan to buy catalog products to sell, because when purchasing she will get a greater percentage gain on some products.

Maria dreams to continue working to give her daughter all that she needs, and in the future be able to have their own home.

loans.use: to purchase catalogue products to sell.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a forty-five-year-old married man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda.

Tadeo operates a pub and sells sodas and beer as his major business. He loves his business and is very hardworking. He hopes to educate his children and improve his business despite the hardship of high taxes that affect his output.

Tadeo requests a loan to buy sodas and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beer to sell.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tashar Kanawa Village. Isah joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Isah will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help himearn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize.

This season, Isah has grand plans to harvest 30 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Isah now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Marilu se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 12 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Marilu espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marilu is 38 years old, married, lives with her husband and son in a rural area of the district of Oyotún which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The residents of this district are mainly engaged in agriculture, cattle raising and trade.

Marilu is dedicated to the breeding and sale of small animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, among others.  Her business is located in her own home.

She has 12 years of experience in the business and comes with very good personal and work references from the area.

The requested loan will be used to purchase a greater number of animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, chicks, among others, as well as for the purchase of balanced feed for these.

With this Marilu hopes to offer a better product to her customers, which will in turn allow her to generate more income and therefore increase her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater number of animals

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a twenty-eight-year-old, ambitious man living in Masindi, Uganda, with a dream of serving his community diligently.

Richard deals in selling veterinary medicine as his major business and source of income. He is very passionate about his business. Richard started this business to help him cater to the basic needs of life and works hard to maintain it. However, in the long run he has realized that his services are highly appreciated by his community, and he wants to increase his operations. He is challenged by inadequate capital to run his business given the high demand.

Richard is requesting a loan to buy drugs for his veterinary drug shop.

loans.use: to buy drugs  for his veterinery shop.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 32-year-old married man from Kan younis city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, which has an economic blockade imposed by the Israeli authorities since 2007. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income.

Mohamad also has a grocery store where he sells basic grocery products. Mohamad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new inventory for his grocery store. With this loan, Mohamad can buy more cold soft drinks for his store to resell, which is popular because Gaza can get very hot! Mohamad appears in the photo

loans.use: can buy more stock, including cold soft drinks for his store to resell,.

loans.name: Twisungane Sub Group A

texts.en: TWISUNGANE is a group led by Jeanette who is 25 years old. She has 1 child is not yet go to school.The group name means “Solidality” in English. She has been a group leader for 2 years. She sells clothes and has been selling in a business for 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and dresses for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a medical insurance and improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tashar Kanawa Village. Alhaji joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Alhaji will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags.

This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Alhaji now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 23 years old. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially on enterprise development. He practices vegetable farming and also operates a general retail shop selling commodities like flour, sweets, biscuits, soft drinks, bread and sugar.

Samuel is taking out a Kiva loan to buy additional foodstuffs, hence, add stock for increased income. This will enable him to provide better food and clothing as well as pay school fees for his children.

Samuel is grateful to Kiva and lenders for the financial support. He promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs, hence, add stock to his general retail shop for increased income to pay for school fees and provide better food and clothing to his children.

loans.name: Xatira

texts.en:
Xatira is 46 years old and married, with 4 children.. She is from Agjabadi and is a dairy farmer. Her husband doesn’t work but he always helps her. Xatira doesn’t earn enough money. She loves her family and knows that by growing and expanding her business, she can also improve her family's living conditions.

Xatira needs money to buy medicines and vaccines for the welfare of her cows. So she needs Kiva lenders support.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her cows.

loans.name: Maria Arely

texts.es: María de 25 años de edad, vive muy feliz junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos 2, 4 y 5 años de edad. María es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable que quiere dar lo mejor a sus hijos. Desde hace 15 años, María se dedica a la venta de mariscos en un mercado de su localidad, actividad que realiza 5 días de la semana de forma ambulante; es así como María gana para poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Además, su compañero de vida realiza oficios varios en ranchos de playa, es así como aporta a la economía de su hogar. Anteriormente, María solicito un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir en su negocio de venta de mariscos, lo cual tuvo resultados positivos ya que sus ingresos económicos mejoraron; por lo cual su familia está muy agradecida.  Nuevamente, María solicita un crédito a FUSAI para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio de mariscos; de esta forma para que poco a poco  su negocio pueda ir creciendo y también mejorar sus ingresos.Ella comprará: pescados,camarones,lonja, etc.
texts.en:
María, 25 years old, lives happily with her partner and three children – ages two, four and five. She is a very hardworking and responsible woman that wants to give the best to her children.   

For 15 years, María has made a living selling seafood at a market in her area. She works five days a week as a street vendor, and this is how she earns enough to be able to cover her family’s basic necessities. Her partner works various jobs at ranches near the beach, as this is how he contributes to the financial wellbeing of the home. 

Previously, María requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in her seafood business, which had positive results as her profits improved – for which her family is very grateful.

Currently, María is asking for a loan from FUSAI to continue investing in her seafood business. Through this, her business will be able to grow and her profits improve little by little. She will purchase fish, shrimp, etc.

loans.use: to invest in fish, shrimp, etc. to improve her business.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena is a 50-years-old, married woman, with 4 children, running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalos for milking purpose and sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation before so now she has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales, to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Solar Light Solution for her business and also wants to increase her income.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis used his previous loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm for the next season. He still deals in crop farming as his main source of income, although he also earns an extra income from his monthly salary and sale of produce. He started this business to look after his family and educate his children. He faces the challenges of seasonal changes and price fluctuations but has a vision of constructing a good home and become a model farmer in his area.

He is requesting a loan to buy coffee to sell and manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 27 years old. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development. 
He practices mixed farming: crop and dairy farming. He is borrowing Kiva loan to buy animal feeds hence boost milk production for increased income.  This will enable him provide better clothing and shelter for himself and his mother.

He is thankful to Kiva and the lenders and promises to repay his loan well.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds hence boost milk production for increased income, to provide better food and clothing  for himself and his mother.

loans.name: Mirian Noemy

texts.es:
Mirian, de 35 años de edad, nunca fue a la escuela, actualmente vive con su esposo que se dedica a la pesca y sus hijos están estudiando.

Mirian, tiene una panadería desde hace tres años y distribuye su mercadería en la comunidad donde vive.

El crédito solicitado lo necesita para fortalecer su negocio y compran todos los insumos básicos para su panadería como: harina, jalea, manteca, aceite.
  
Sus sueños a futuro es que el negocio crezca mucho más y que le siga generando muy buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mirian, 35 years old, never attended school and currently lives with her husband that makes a living fishing and with her children that are studying. 

Mirian has had a bakery for three years and distributes her products throughout the community where she lives. 

She needs the loan requested to strengthen her business and purchase basic supplies for her bakery including flour, jelly, butter and oil. 
  
Her dream for the future is for her business to grow much more and for her to continue generating good profits.

loans.use: to strengthen her business and buy basic supplies for her bakery: floor, jelly, butter and oil.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida  is 46 years old married woman and a mother of 4 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increse her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increse her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a butcher who also earns a monthly income from his rentals and farming. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda.

The need to be self sustainable and fully cater to his family's needs forced him to engage in business. There was a time when people in his area had a demand for goat meat, which was hard to get. His business has steadily grown as he has strived to meet the increasing demand of his community.

His main challenge, however, is a scarcity of resources to buy more animals to slaughter. He is requesting a loan to buy more goats to slaughter and sell.

He hopes to expand his business into a modern butchery and have all his children educated.

loans.use: to buy more goats to slaughter and sell.

loans.name: Jyambere Sub Group A

texts.en:
Chantal, 32, is not yet married. She is a group leader. Her group is called Jyambere, which means “go ahead” in English. The group members sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to achieve better futures.

Chantal sells clothes and has been running a business for three years. With this loan, she would like to buy more more clothes to sell.

The profits from her business will be used to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 32 years old, married woman doing business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband, for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is working very hard for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. 

She has requested a loan of 45000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 45 years old lady, married and blessed with six children who are all attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development.

She practices poultry and vegetable farming. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy poultry feed and certified seeds hence boost production for increased income. This will enable to support her children's education.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds and certified seeds to boost production for increased income and support her children's education.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 41 years old and is a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses, she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Hady's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois est créé en juillet  2008, il est composé de femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Soucieuses de leur condition de vie, elles mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenu comme le petit commerce et l’agriculture.

Madame Khady (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette  du groupe. Elle est âgée de57 ans, veuve et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 garçons et 3 filles elle a aussi à sa charge 5 de ses petits-enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de fruits de saisons (mangues), elle tient  aussi une gargote près de l’école élémentaire où elle vend le petit déjeuné. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité en gros et demi gros pour la revende au détail. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ses activités pour l’avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 5 ans.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 20 sacs de 50kg de mangues et 1 sac de petit pois de 25kg, 1carton de spaghetti de 24 sachets de 250g et divers bouillons culinaires et ingrédients.

Avec ses bénéfices elle assure la dépense quotidienne et la  prise en charge des frais médicaux et scolaire de ses enfants et petits-enfants.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' was founded in July of 2008. The group is made up of women, who all live in the same village. Suspicious of their living conditions, they are all pursuing businesses that generate income, such as trading and farming.

Mrs. Khady (seated at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 57 years old, widowed, and a mother of five children, 2 boys and 3 girls. She also takes care of 5 of her grandchildren. She works selling seasonal fruit (mangoes) and she also has a greasy spoon restaurant near the elementary school, where she sells breakfast. She resupplies at the weekly markets in her area in bulk or medium quantities. She enjoys her business experience, which she has been practicing for more than five years.

With her new loan, she plans to buy 20 sacks of mangoes (50kg), one sack of peas (25kg), one box of spaghetti and 24 pouches of various culinary stocks and ingredients (250g).

With her profits, she can insure daily costs, medical fees, and tuition for her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of mangoes (50kg), one sack of peas (25kg), one box of spaghetti and 24 pouches of various culinary stocks and ingredients (250g).

loans.name: Gaye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 32 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 21 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes du même quartier qui ont de bonnes relations qui s'activent dans le commerce et l’élevage.
OULEYE debout à gauche de la photo et levant la main droite est âgée de 62 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 9 enfants dont 4 garçons et 5 filles.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle envisage d'acheter des légumes pour les revendre. Elle achète des légumes pour un montant de 20 000 FCFA. Après écoulement elle a un bénéfice de 5 000 voire 7 00 FCFA.
Les bénéfices  serviront à entretenir sa famille et à épargner aussi.
texts.en:
This group of 32 members makes of a banc villageois that was founded December 21st, 2009. It brings together women from the same neighborhood, who have good relationships and who are practicing business and raising livestock.

Ouleye, standing to the left in the photograph and raising her right hand, is 62 years old. She is married and a mother of nine children, 4 boys and 5 girls.

With the loan she receives, she plans to buy vegetables for resale. She buys vegetables for a sum of 20,000 FCFA. After turnover, she makes a profit of 5,000, even 7,000 FCFA.

The profits will help support her family and also to save money.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Kaunda

texts.en:
Kaunda is 45 years old. He is married and has four children. His business is operating a retail shop and selling cattle and goats. He has been in this business for five years. He earns a monthly income of ten thousand shillings. 

This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy cattle and goats for sale. He will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy cattle and goats for sale.

loans.name: Fagaye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 5 Décembre 2007. Les membres vivent dans le même quartier.

Seynabou L'emprunteur en vedette est âgée de 51ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 1 garçons.Elle 

est assise à droite de la photo et a levé sa main

Elle s'active dans le commerce de chaussure en cuire pour dame.Elle fait a une expérience de plus de 06 ans.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter 52 paires de chaussures à 1500f chacun. Elle mène son activité chez elle et 

dans le quartier. Avec les bénéfices, elle va aider son mari dans la gestion de la famille et renforcer son 

épargne dans le BV.
texts.en:
This group was founded on December 5th, 2007. The members live in the same neighborhood.

Seynabou, the featured borrower, is 51 years old. She is married and a mother of 4 children, one of which is a boy. She is seated on the right side of the photograph with her hand raised.

She works selling leather shoes for women. She has more than 6 years of experience.

With her loan, she plans to buy 52 pairs of shoes at 1500F each. She operates her business from her home and in the neighborhood. With her profits, she is going to help her husband manage the family and his savings in the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Alois

texts.en:
Alois is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. While he previously had a milk shop, he has now added another business a mobile money transfer (M-Pesa) business. He has been in business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of ten thousand shillings.

This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy another fridge and milk cans for holding incoming milk.

He will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy another fridge and milk cans for holding incoming milk.

loans.name: Reyna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reyna, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta 6 grado, tiene 3 hijos, los cuales están en la escuela, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja como seguridad en una empresa. 

Reyna, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 6 años, este negocio lo aprendió gracias a una amiga, anteriormente se dedica a la venta de tortillas, pero no era tan rentable.- Decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa casa por casa, la distancia que camina es variable 4 a 9 kilómetros y en este negocio se involucran sus hijos después de estudiar y su esposo en días libres.

Reyna, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para surtir el negocio, ella quiere incrementar su inventario para obtener más ganancias y comprar más ropa. 

Los sueños son ampliar, aún más el negocio y que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Reyna, 39 years old, studied until her sixth year of school and has three children who are in school. She is married, and her partner works in security for a business. 

Reyna has made a living selling clothing for six years. She learned this business thanks to a friend, as previously she made a living selling tortillas but it was not as profitable. She decided to start selling clothing house to house, and the distance she walks varies between four and nine kilometers. She involves her children in her business after they study and her husband when has free days. 

Reyna needs a loan to buy more merchandise to supply her business. She wants to increase her inventory to earn a better profit and purchase more clothing. 

Her dream is to expand her business more and for her children to be able to earn a university degree.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to supply her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil  for her business.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, nunca fue a la escuela, está casada y vive con su esposo y su hija se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus otros hijos ya tienen sus propios hogares.

María, trabaja en la agricultura junto con su esposo desde hace muchos años, desde pequeña le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, su hijo le ayuda.
 
María, el crédito lo necesita para comprar abono y semilla para sembrar, ya que en las siembras pasadas perdieron las cosechas y ahora que con la ayuda de Dios.

María, sueña con obtener buenas cosechas.
texts.en:
María never went to school, is married, and lives with her husband and her daughter. She is a homemaker and her other children already have their own homes. María has been working in agriculture together with her husband for many years. She was taught to work the land from the time she was small. Her child helps her.

María needs the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant since in seasons past they lost the crop, and now but with the help of God. María dreams of achieving good harvests.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida  is 43 years old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Sajida ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Sajida  has requested for 45000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to produce more milk for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 27 years old, married lady woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has received a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring for running her household activities. Now, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

She has requested for a loan of 35000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for making more dresses on time and to get a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on providing quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for sewing more dresses on time.

loans.name: Ayesa

texts.en:
Ayesa launched Incite Photography in 2010 – the latest in a long line of female entrepreneur-run businesses in her family. She grew up in a camera and imagery loving household where her father or grandfather’s vacation photos were projected at parties and their prints covered the walls. 

After a decade helping to tell others’ stories in the motion picture industry, she returned to still photography; initially shooting educational institution and nonprofit events to engage potential donors through imagery. Eventually, she progressed to her current love: telling the stories of people, where and how they live.  

With the help of the Kiva community, she’ll be able to replace her old camera and continue to help other small business owners succeed in sharing their vision of their business through imagery with the community.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Flor is establishing a new business to sell beauty products. Her business will operate from home, but will be mobile to sell products at different events throughout San Diego. 

Flor is an independent beauty presenter and will sell a product line that is mineral based and environmentally friendly.  She will use her Kiva loan to purchase additional inventory. 

She currently works for the County of San Diego and she is excited to have additional income to support her family and pursue her dream of becoming an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María, está casada, vive con sus 3 hijos, 2 de ellos estudian y el otro trabaja en la agricultura, al igual que su esposo y solo los dos menores dependen de ella.

María, trabaja en la agricultura desde muy joven, sus padres le enseñaron esta labor, aparte de eso también sale a vender tamales y pan en la comunidad, todo esto lo hace para llevar el sustento diario a sus hijos.
 
María, necesita el crédito para comprar herbicidas y para comprar una red para la pesca de su esposo, esto mejorará hacia una mejor producción y también para invertir en los cultivos para sacar suficientes cosechas.

María, sueña con tener su propio equipo de pesca para que sus hijos y su esposo pueda trabajar y llevar el pan a la casa.
texts.en:
María is married and lives with her three children. Two of them are in school and the other works in agriculture, just like her husband. Only the youngest two depend on her. 

María has worked in agriculture since she was very young. Her parents taught her this work. In addition, she goes out to sell tamales and bread in the community. She does all this to be able to feed her children every day.
 
María needs this loan to buy herbicides and to buy a fishing net for her husband. This will help her for better production and also to invest in her crops to get  sufficient harvests. María dreams of having her own fishing equipment so that her children and her husband can work and make a living.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and to buy a fishing net for her husband

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 49 years old. He is married and has three children. His business is welding workshop making metal doors and window grills. He has also added a Mobile Money transfer business since taking last loan. 

He has been in this business for 11 years. He earns a monthly income of eight thousand shillings.This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to increase float for Mobile Money transfer business. 

He will use the profits from expanded business to buy metal bars for welding workshop. His hopes and dreams are to be successful in business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy welding materials.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 63 years old. She is married and has six children. Her business farming. She has been in this business for 15 years. She earns a monthly income of ten thousand shillings. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of tomatoes, potatoes, onions for the grocery stall and fertilizer and seedlings for the farm.


She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock of tomatoes, potatoes, onions for the grocery stall and fertilizer and seedlings for the farm.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Remedios is 75 years old now.

Remedios has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Remedios requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fresh fish to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Remedios would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Mary Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Mary Jean is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell for her clothing retail business.

Mary Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Myrene

texts.en:
Myrene is 29 years old, married with two children.

Myrene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal product care, mineral water, home product care, and other groceries.

Myrene has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Myrene aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal product care, miniral water, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Geramie

texts.en:
Geramie is 27 years old and married with one child.

Geramie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Geramie has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from clothing retail.

Geramie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a married man and hardworking farmer. He raises goats in Kamwenge, Uganda, and earns additional income from growing crops.

Lawrence intends to be a prominent businessman. He has worked six days a week since 2006 and has been able to develop himself. Still, he has been hindered by inadequate capital and unfavorable weather changes.

Lawrence is challenged by drought, which causes an inadequate supply of grass and water for his animals. He is requesting a loan to buy more goats for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more goats for his farm.

loans.name: Kansiime

texts.en:
Kansiime is a hardworking lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She used the previous loan to buy materials for making bricks and to pay laborers to start constructing her house. She is a farmer growing food crops like tomatoes, matooke, and cabbages. She also rears goats for additional income.

She is faced with challenges of limited capital to buy more goats, as well as pests and diseases that hinder growth of her crops. However, she is working very hard to make sure she diversifies her income by dealing in motorcycle transportation that can add more income. Kansiime has asked for a loan to buy seeds and sprays for spraying the tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy seeds and sprays for spraying the tomatoes.

loans.name: Fazal

texts.en: Fazal  is 56 years old, married woman. She is a mother of 2 children.  Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested for a loan of 30000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She aspires to save money for providing prosperous future to her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Dorofia

texts.en:
Dorofia (56) is a divorced mother of four. She is a respected elder in her community where she is known for her caring nature. Even as she ages, Dorofia still has the zeal and drive to work. She is a founding member of a self-help group that has identified an opportunity in agriculture. The group secured land and has erected tunnels (greenhouses) for crop farming.

She is requesting a Kiva loan to help her buy organic seedlings to grow in the greenhouse. She will then supply the vegetables to small-scale vendors in her neighborhood.

"I hope to create jobs for other people," says Dorofia when asked about her 5-year plan.

loans.use: to buy organic seedlings

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 60 years old. She works at a private company. She is divorced and takes care of three children.

Gloria is healthy and needs a loan to fix a room in her house. She works hard, and she hopes you can help her again. Gloria also sells cosmetics in her free time. She loves her family a lot.

In the photo, Gloria is in the room in her house that needs work done on the walls.

loans.use: to fix a room in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails in order to improve the hall and kitchen of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and labor to cement the floor of his house, which is earthen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer and chemicals to spray for a better harvest and, with the surplus, to buy an additional dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 44 years old. He is married and has five children. His business farming and brick making. He has been in this business for 20 years. He earns a monthly income of ten thousand shillings. 

This is his third loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. He will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Natali

texts.es:
María, nunca fue a la escuela, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, mientras que su segundo hijo estudia y le ayuda a su padre en los cultivos. 

María, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 2 años, fue idea de ella colocar esa tienda porque no había tienda cerca, sus hijos le apoyan para vender todos los días y en ocasiones hacen tortillas para vender.
 
María, solicita el crédito para surtir la tienda con productos para el consumo: arroz, frijoles, maíz, entre otros; esto servirá para tener más diversidad de mercadería, para vender y mejorar sus ingresos.

María, sueña con tener una tienda y ser muy conocida por sus precios y buenos productos.
texts.en:
María never went to school. She is married and lives with her husband and three children. Her husband works in agriculture and her second child studies and helps his father with his crops.

María has had a small store for two years. It was her idea to set up this store as there was no store nearby. Her children help her to sell every day and at times they make tortillas to sell. .

María is requesting a loan to stock her store with products for consumption: rice, beans, corn amongst others. This will serve to have more diversity in her merchandise to sell and improve her income.

María dreams of having a store well known for it's prices and good products.

loans.use: to stock her store with products for consumption: rice, beans, and corn amongst others.

loans.name: Elsy Antonia

texts.es:
Elsy, está estudiando en la universidad, está soltera y vive con sus padres, los cuales no trabajan, solo se dedican a los oficios domésticos. 

Elsy, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 2 años, ella de las ganancias que obtiene de la tienda, está pagando sus gastos de sus estudios, su madre le ayuda en la tienda y el horario de atención es de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 8:00 p.m.
 
Elsy, necesita el crédito para surtir el negocio con productos como: arroz, frijoles, entre otros, ella considera que teniendo gran variedad de productos, habrá mayores ventas y mejores ingresos.

Elsy, sueña con terminar su carrera universitaria e implementar sus conocimientos en un negocio propio; además sueña con crear su propia familia y tener hijos.
texts.en:
Elsy is studying in the university. She is single and lives with her parents who don't work. They just spend their time working around the house.

Elsy has had a small store for two years. With the earnings she gets from the store, she is paying the expenses for her studies. Her mother helps her with the shop which is open from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.

Elsy needs the loan to stock her business with products such as rice and beans amongst other things. She thinks that, by having a great variety of products, she will have better sales and greater income.

Elsy dreams of finishing her university course of study and implementing her knowledge in her own business. She also dreams of creating her own family and having children.

loans.use: to stock her business with products such as rice and beans amongst other things.

loans.name: Abaticumugambi Sub Group A

texts.en:
ABATICUMUGAMBI is a group led by Yvette, who is 38 years old. The group name means “They don't give up” in English. She is married and has three children between the ages of 5 and 12. She owns a shop that has been in business for the past five years.

The group members sell different items and want to change their lives. With her portion of the loan, Yvette would like to buy more sugar, soap, salt, and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, salt, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy beehives realizing the importance of honey for the health of the community. He has a business of making cushions, farming and bee rearing, where he works six days a week. Jonathan is grateful to Kiva whose support rendered to him that has seen him serve the community a dream he has always earned to acheive.

He is faced with challenges of inadequate finances that hinder expansion of his businesses. Besides that, he is working very hard to make sure he constructs a permanent house for his family. Jonathan has asked for a loan to buy materials for making cushions.

loans.use: to buy materials for making cushions

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old and lives in the municipality of Urrao. He has two daughters of 7 and 5 years old. They are his main reason to work hard. He owns a coffee growing business, something really traditional in Colombia, and a hard and beautiful job.

He believes it is time to grow his business, which means he needs to increase the inputs in order to increase the production of coffee. He wants to invest in his business to accomplish that. He asked for a loan to buy a pulper and to make some location changes.

Juan´s biggest dream is to pay for his daughters’ education and to fix his house so his family can have a better quality of life. You can help Juan to get closer to accomplishing his dreams. A loan can do a lot for him.

loans.use: to buy a pulper and to make some location changes

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is happy married woman, mother of 2 kids and she is a dedicated lawyer and her husband is an accountant. Sandra and her husband are the owners of the house where she lives with her family, but the house needs a lot of construction work because the place is old.

This time Sandra needs another loan to pay for repairs at her house and to buy construction materials. Sandra works hard and she hopes you can help her again

loans.use: to pay for repairs at her house and to buy construction materials .

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед молодой фермер из района Шахритус. Ему 23 года. Он недавно женился и готовится стать отцом. Хуршед занимается животноводством. У него не большое количество скотов и он хочет увеличить поголовья, чтобы расширить бизнес и увеличить доходность. Хуршед хочет стать успешным человеком, вполне обеспечить свою семью и быть примером для своих детей. Вы можете сейчас сыграть роль в жизни Хуршеда. Поддержав его, он сможет купить пару голов телят и расширить бизнес. Поддержите Хуршеда.
texts.en:
Khurshed is a young farmer from the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan.  He is 23 years old.  He got married recently and he is now ready to be a dad.  Khurshed raises livestock.  He has a few head of cattle and he would like to increase the size of his herd in order to increase his business and his income.

Khurshed wants to be a successful man, capable of fully supporting his family.  He also wants to be a role model for his children.  You have the power to make a difference in his life.  With your support, he will be able to buy a couple of calves and expand his activity.  Please help him.

loans.use: to buy a few calves.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 28-year-old single man from Khanyounis city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, where an economic blockade has been imposed by the Israeli authorities since 2007.

Mohamad works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. He also has a grocery store where he sells basic grocery products.

Mohamad is taking a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new inventory for his grocery store. With this loan, he can buy more cold soft drinks for his store to resell, which is popular because Gaza can get very hot!

Mohamad appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to buy new inventory for his grocery store.

loans.name: Miatta Conference Solidarity Group

texts.en:
This is forty-eight years old Miatta, she is married and has four children. Her children are all school going children. Miatta belongs to a solidarity group of two men and three women, who have come together to complement each other achieve their individual dreams. “Miatta Conference” is the name of Miatta’s solidarity group. “Miatta Conference” group needs a total loan of 5,000,000SLL. Miatta will receive 1, 000,000SLL which she needs in order to buy more different kinds of drinks for her business.

Miatta established her food business in 2013 to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs. Miatta uses profit from this business to provide livelihood for her family and support her children’s education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week. Miatta is a hardworking women, she opens her business from 7 am to 6 pm. See Miatta (is in the middle of the group picture).
In the future, Miatta plans to support her children to acquire university education. She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to buy more different kinds of drinks for her business

loans.name: Veronica Pilar

texts.es:
Verónica es una joven ecuatoriana de 20 años de edad , es soltera  gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la secundaria  y luego  la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy chica para poder sustentar sus necesidades y poder ayudar en las necesidades de su familia, Verónica es oriunda de la ciudad de Latacunga, viven en un barrio urbano de la ciudad junto a su madre y hermanos en casa propia, por ende no pagan arriendo.
El mayor obstáculo que han tenido ha sido la falta de financiamiento para poder hacer que su negocio crezca, actualmente tiene un  pequeño negocio que consiste en la venta de artículos de aseo como papel higiénico, pasta dental, jabón, cepillos , etc.  aprendio de esta actividad ya que trabajaba con una vecina, trabaja de 8 a 10 horas diarias, le ayuda en ocasiones su mamá.
Requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra  más producto y en estudios,  esto también ayudará a  que Veronica  pueda mejorar sus estilo de vida y la de su familia, dándole la educación que ella no tuvo y la la oportunidad de salir adelante. Además a Veronica le gustaria en un futuro que que su negocio crezca cada día mas. Verónica  agradece a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Verónica, age twenty, is a young Ecuadorian lady. Thanks to her parents' hard work, she was able to complete her secondary education, but afterwards, a lack of financial resources led her to go to work at a young age, in order to support herself and help support her family.

Verónica is a native of the city of Latacunga. She lives in an urban neighborhood of the city with her mother and siblings. They have their own house, so they don't have to pay rent. The biggest challenge that they have had is the lack of financing to make their business grow.

Currently, she has a small business selling personal care items, such as toilet paper, toothpaste, soap, toothbrushes, etc. She learned this occupation by working with a neighbor. She works between eight and ten hours daily, and her mom helps her sometimes.

She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of more products, and in her studies. This will also help Verónica to improve her quality of life and that of her family, by giving her the education that she didn't have, and the opportunity to get ahead. Additionally, In the future, Verónica would like her business to keep growing everyday. Verónica is grateful to Kiva for making it possible for her to grow in both her working and personal life.

loans.use: to stock her business with new merchandise, and in this way, pay for her studies and support her mother and siblings.

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en:
Phyllis is a 26-year-old, single mother, living in Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe where she operates a clothing shop at the local business center. She started her business with the savings she made as a part-time farm laborer. She sells cosmetics, accessories, jackets, shirts, bags, and shoes. Phyllis inspires young women in her community both as a Camfed Learner Guide, who teaches students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur.

She also has a cattle rearing project that she intends to expand with the loan that she is requesting for. She started this cattle rearing project using the proceeds from her shop. She ventured into this diversification because she wanted to expand her sources of income. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to rear and sell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is 64 years old she is a retired person but she is selling cosmetics because her retirement payment is low.  Miriam needs a loan this time to buy perfume and cosmetics for her activity. She is divorced, is healthy now and she hopes you can help her. Miriam is living with her 2 sons and her house belongs to her

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics for selling

loans.name: Landa

texts.en:
Landa works at a factory and she also started to sell bedsheets by herself because she wants to improve her income. Landa is a single woman and she would like to move to another place where she could live more comfortably. She is living with her parents and she shares the place with her brothers and her nephews. Her parents help her with the food but she has to help with other expenses at the house.
Landa needs a loan to buy bedsheets for her business she hopes you can help her Landa is at her work in the picture

loans.use: to buy bedsheets for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her business and bring in almonds and nuts.

loans.name: Kpanmanga - Kpabi Group

texts.en:
Shahada is a 30-year-old economically active woman living in Kpabi, a suburb of Bimbilla in the Northern region of Ghana. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 3 and 10, 3 of whom attend school.

Shahada is a member of a Shea-butter processing group named ‘Kpangmanga, Kpabi - Bimbilla’ group. She is the woman squatting with a hand on a pot full of yellow butter in front, among her group mates in the photo.
Shahada did that business over the past 5 years and like all members of her group, has been trained by experts on improved techniques of processing shea-nuts and shea-butter. She dreams to become a leader in the business within her community and has applied together with her mates for a loan of GHC9,500.00. Her share of the loan is GHC 500.00 which would be used to buy 4 bags of shea nuts for processing into Shea-butter.
She intends to get more income for repayment of this loan and to grow the business and support her family. Shahada wants to thank Kiva lenders for their understanding and support.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of shea nuts for processing into shea-butter.

loans.name: Ndinda

texts.en:
Ndinda is 56 years old. She is a widow and has five children. Her business is farming. She has been in this business for 14 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy a water tank. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Genera

texts.en:
Genera is 65 years old, married and has 5 children to provide for. After the maturity of her coconuts, she harvested them and sold them at the market. She owns a farm also, where she grows rice and delivers it to the market.

Her aim to is to increase her income because of the increasing price of commodities nowadays, so she decided to take a loan to purchase fertilizer for her farm. That way she can produce a good quality of rice and coconuts and can deliver them to the market, so that will generate more income.

Genera plan for the future is to save money from her business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to restore the nutrients of the farm

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is 27 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is responsible mother of three children. Her husband has been running a jewelry shop for past 10 years.

Shumaila's husband wants to purchase different a type of jewelry e.g artificial jewelry, earrings,lockets etc to fulfill the demands of his customers, but due to financial constraints her husband is not in the position to buy these merchandises for reselling purpose. To fulfill his business needs, Shumaila has applied for Kiva Loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these things to fulfill his business needs. This will also helpful for him to increase his daily sales and earn more profitable income to manage the business and family's needs
Shumaila is very happy and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's jewelry business.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from. Nelita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, perfume, etc. for her buy and sell personal product care business.

Nelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to buy and sell home product care.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is just 20 years old and lives in the City of Medellín. At her young age, she already knows what she wants to do with her life, she wants to study and be a professional. She loves cooking since she was a little girl, so that’s the road she wants to take.

This young woman has big dreams, like starting her own business, that’s what motivates her the most. She also wants to buy a house for her family someday and to give to her family a good quality of life. She’s asking for a loan so she can pay her studies in bread making.

She’s determined to study hard and to fight for her dreams, give Manuela a little help so she can study, a loan will mean a lot for her and her family.

loans.use: pay her studies in bread making

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.en:
Gloria is a 51-year married woman who has 2 children, a son and a daughter. They live in the municipality of Envigado, near to Medellín. This mother has big dreams, and one of them is to study, something that she hasn’t been able to do in the past, but now she’s decided to do it.

She wants to do it for two main reasons, first one is because she loves cooking, and the second one is because she expects that she can start her own business soon. She’s asking for a loan so she can pay for her studies in bread making.

Gloria has some problems in her life in this moment, she has some health issues and the economy in her house is not in its best, but these problems won’t stop her. You can help Gloria to achieve her goals; a loan will do a lot for her.

loans.use: pay for her studies in bread making.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Ее зовут Махбуба. Ей 39 лет. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж и два старших сына уехали на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Махбуба одна занимается младшими детьми. Скоро начнется учебный год и Махбубе необходимо собрать детей в школу. Махбубе подготовить детей к школе финансово трудно, и она обратилась за финансовой поддержкой. За счет заемных средств Махбуба приобретет учебники и школьную форму для детей. Махбуба будет благодарна, если ей помогут.
texts.en: Meet Mahbuba, a 39-year-old mother of four.  While her husband and oldest two sons are currently in Russia (making a living as migrant workers), she takes care of her youngest children by herself.  A new school year is starting very soon. Mahbuba needs to get her children ready for school, but this is unfortunately financially very difficult for her.  For this reason, she is requesting some financial support.  Mahbuba will use her loan to buy textbooks and school uniforms for her children.  She will be very grateful to receive your help.

loans.use: to buy textbooks and school uniforms for children.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana is 29 years old and lives in the municipality of Yarumal; she’s a single mother, with a handsome baby boy who is 3 years old, and she considers him like the blessing of her life and her reason to succeed in life. For a while she was thinking to create her own business, but now she wants this to be a reality.

She wants to start a cafeteria, because she loves serving people, and sees this business as a great opportunity, so she can improve her family’s quality of life. She needs some help so she can start her business because she doesn’t have the money to do it, so she’s asking for a loan to buy some inputs like groceries, chips, sodas, and food.

Viviana dreams with a buying a house for her family where she and her son can live comfortable and safe. You can help this responsible woman to accomplish her dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: buy some inputs like groceries, chips, sodas, and food.

loans.name: Luis Albeiro

texts.en:
Luis is 45 years old and lives in the municipality of El Carmen de Viboral. He has 4 children, 2 sons and 2 daughters, although he is divorced, he still provides for them and her ex-wife and has a great relationship with his family. His main reason to work hard and search for success. He owns a raising cattle business and he focus in selling milk.

He started his business so he can give to his family a good quality of life, because they were in bad economic situation, and thanks to his father he learned all what he knows. Unfortunately, the milk price is really low in the market right now, so the profits hasn’t been much, so in order to increase his sales and make his business last in time, he asked for a loan so he can buy two extra milking cows, so he has more to offer.

Luis dreams with paying for his children education and buying a house for his family. Help this devoted father to accomplish his dreams, a loan will do a lot for him and his family.

loans.use: buy two extra milking cows.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 65 years old. She is married and has six children. Her business is growing maize and beans and animal keeping. She has been in this business for five years and earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings. 


This is her fifth loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and animal feeds. She will use the profits from expanded business to expand her business and increase her savings to borrow bigger loans in future. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and animal feeds.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. Her business is buying and selling poultry, cattle and goats. She has been in this business for the last four years and earns a monthly income of eight thousand shillings. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan.She will use the profits from expanded business to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. Her hopes and dreams are to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle, goats and poultry for sale.

loans.name: Emlyn

texts.en:
In order to support her children in their daily needs, Emlyn engaged in buy and sale business. Emlyn  has been selling crabs for many years.For five years running the business, she wants to offer the best crabs that she could be offer to her customer. She took a loan to purchase a variety of of crabs to provide the needs of her customers.
