Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Cesar is from the city of Encarnación, currently he is working at a transport business and is also studying to be able to be a good professional.

He is studying for a law degree and wants to be able to, through his studies, to be someone in life and also to be able to help his loved ones through his knowledge.

He asks for this loan to be able to pay his program tuition and in this way be able to continue with his studies as he has been doing, and he is grateful for the opportunity that he is getting to be someone in life.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, comenta que por medio de sus estudios quiere poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos, ya que ellos siempre le han apoyado en todo.
Liz es una persona luchadora que quiere ser alguien en la vida, es por eso que lucha y se esfuerza día a día, a la par que estudia también trabaja.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, para poder ser una buena profesional como desea.
texts.en: Liz is from the city of Encarnación. She is studying Accounting. She says that through her studies, she wants to be able to help her family and loved ones, because they have always supported her in everything. Liz is a determined person who wants to be someone in life. For that reason, she fights and strives every day. At the same time she is studying, she is also working. She is asking for this loan to be able to pay for her college fees. This way she can continue with her studies to be able to be a good professional like she desires to be.

loans.use: to pay for her college fees.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo vive en la ciudad de Paraguarí, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y comenta que sus metas futuras son la de abrir una sucursal de su negocio que hace 10 años tiene.
Es una persona luchadora que pone todo de sí para poder ser alguien en la vida, y por medio de ello poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y a través de ello estar más cerca de cumplir con su anhelo de ser un buen profesional.
texts.en: Hugo lives in the city of Paraguarí and is currently studying accountancy. He says that his ambitions for the future are to open a branch of the branch which he has been running for 10 years. He is a determined person who gives his all to make something of himself and, by doing so, is able to help his family. He is seeking this loan to fees pay his course fees and, as a result, make progress towards fulfilling his dream of having a successful professional career.

loans.use: to pay course fees.

loans.name: Maria Luz De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de 31 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 8 años, tiene muchos clientes y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su casa, el ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de golosinas, sopas, galletas, aceite, granos básicos, refrescos, etc. para surtir su negocio con más productos y tener buenas ganancias
texts.en: María is 31 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her two children. She has had a store located in her home for 8 years. She has many customers and with her earnings she manages to cover some household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy sweets, soups, cookies, oil, basic grains, soft drinks, etc., to supply her business with more products and have a good income.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soups, cookies, oil, basic grains, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Gloria  Leticia

texts.es: Gloria de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas de manera ambulante, desde hace 25 años se dedica a este negocio con el cual ha podido salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Gloria is 62 years old. She lives in her own home with her family. She works selling stuffed tortillas on the street. She has done this job for 25 years and has been able to get ahead with it. She is asking for a loan to buy raw materials such as pork rind, fresh cheese, beans, corn, etc., all at wholesale price to continue with her sales and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as pork rind, fresh cheese, beans, corn, etc., all at wholesale price.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
Alba vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está estudiando la carrera de criminología, comenta que sus  metas futuras son la de recibirse y trabajar en lo que va ser su profesión,  seguir estudiando obtener un mejor ingreso ayudar a su familia.
Ella es una persona que quiere ser alguien en la vida, es por ello que está poniendo todo de si para poder cumplir con sus anhelos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su tesis, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en: Alba, who lives in the city of San Lorenzo, is studying criminology. She says that her ambitions for the future are to graduate and then work in her chosen career and to continue studying to earn a better income with which to help her family. She is determined to achieve something in life and that is why she is giving her all to achieve her ambitions. She is seeking this loan to pay the costs involved in doing her thesis.

loans.use: to pay the costs of her thesis.

loans.name: Rositas Group

texts.es:
REVISADO
En un poblado veracruzano ubicado a orillas de una carretera federal se encuentra una gran concentración de personas que conservan la lengua mazateca. De igual modo conservan sus tradiciones como, por ejemplo, la cocción de sus alimentos a través de leña y sobre un “fogón” o pequeña parrilla rustica. 
   El grupo Rositas proviene de dicha comunidad y está integrado por nueve personas activas y amigables, el nombre refiere a la hermosa flor que decora el paisaje de su localidad. Los miembros son: Joana y Bertha quienes venden pollo; Emiliana, ropa; María, masa; Ana, productos para habitación; Paula, ropa y productos naturistas; Adriana, zapatos y ropa por catálogo; Juana, recipientes plásticos y Cristina, pan y abarrotes. 
   Doña Cristina decidió hacerse cargo de la tienda de abarrotes de su tía ya que ésta falleció y quería que el fruto de su esfuerzo continuara. Para Cristi, como la conocen sus vecinos, el cuidar de la tienda es un reto y un lindo recuerdo de su tía por lo que día con día da lo mejor de sí en orden de incrementar su éxito. 
   La tienda se ubica frente a su casa en un amplio cuarto donde coloca la mercancía sobre anaqueles de metal para que así sus clientes puedan observar con facilidad el producto. Las ganancias obtenidas le han permitido mantener una amplia variedad de mercancía además de la posibilidad de asociarse con su madre para elaborar pan. Actualmente venden de 2000 a 2500 piezas de pan cada semana, lo que muestra el crecimiento que ha logrado gracias a su calidad y  buen trato. Así, Cris elabora el pan por la mañana  y por las tardes atiende su negocio de abarrotes; mientras no se encuentra su hijo se hace cargo de la tienda.
    El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar, arroz, frijol, aceite, huevos, queso y detergente para mantener la variedad en su local. “Gracias a VisiónF México por confiar en nosotros y otorgarnos un préstamo para continuar con nuestra actividad” son palabras de Cris quien se muestra muy entusiasmada cada vez que recibe el apoyo.
*En la fotografía Doña Cris es quien viste blusa color melón y pantalón azul; junto se ubica Doña Emiliana quien viste blusa color amarillo.
texts.en:
Revised -
In a community in Veracruz, located on the banks of a federal highway, there is a large concentration of people who keep using the Mazateca language. They also keep their traditions such as, for example, cooking food by firewood and on a “fogón” or small, rustic grill.

The Rositas group comes from this community and is made up of nine active and friendly people. The name refers to the lovely flower which decorates the landscape in this place. The members are Joana and Bertha who sell chicken; Emiliana, clothes; María, dough; Ana, household products; Paula, clothing and natural products; Adriana, shoes and clothing by catalog; Juana, plastic containers and Cristina, bread and groceries.

Cristina decided to take on running her aunt's grocery store since she died and she wanted the fruits of her efforts to continue. For Cristi, as her neighbors know her, caring for the store is a challenge and a lovely memory of her aunt for whom day by day she gives her best self in order to increase her success.

The store is located in front of her house in a large room where she places the merchandise on metal shelves so that in this way her customers can easily see the products. The earnings she gets have permitted her to maintain a wide variety of merchandise in addition to the possibility of working with her mother to make bread. Currently they sell 2000 to 2500 bread items per week, which shows the growth that she has managed thanks to its quality and their good treatment. So, Cris makes bread in the morning and in the afternoon she takes care of her grocery business. When she is not there, he son takes over the store.

The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, beans, oil, eggs, cheese and detergents to maintain the variety in her shop. "Thanks to VisiónF México for trusting in us and granting us a loan to continue with our work," are the words of Cris who shows great enthusiasm each time she gets the support.

*In the photo, Cris is the one who wears a melon-colored blouse and blue pants, Emiliana, who is wearing a yellow blouse, is next to her.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, beans, oil, eggs, cheese and detergent.

location.town: La Reforma, San Miguel Soyaltepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Ricardo Alfredo

texts.es: Ricardo de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años, inicio con capital propio comercializa sus productos durante todo el año, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografia para tener una buena cosecha y asi tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: 51-year-old Ricardo lives in his own house along with his wife. He has worked in agriculture for 10 years, having set up his business with his own capital, and he sells his produce all year round. He is seeking a loan to buy seeds, fertiliser, manure, etc. and to improve his plot of land (shown in the photo) so he can have a good harvest and, as a result, boost his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertiliser, manure, etc. and to improve his plot of land

loans.name: Rosa Hilda

texts.es: rosa de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como pude salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos de consumo diario por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa is 44 years old. She lives in her own home with her family. She has had a store located in her home for 2 years. With what she gets from her sales, she can get ahead. She is asking for a loan to buy more everyday products at wholesale prices, to continue with her sales and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more everyday products at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida es estudiante de Formación docente vive con su mama, estudia esta carrera porque le agrada mucho trabajar con niños.
Su meta es recibirse y trabajar en las escuelas de las compañías para ayudar a los niños. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder ser una buena profesional que ayude a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Aida is studying to become a teacher because she very much enjoys working with children. She lives with her mother. Her ambition is to graduate and then work in schools run by companies, where she can help the children. She is grateful for this opportunity to be able to have a successful career helping others. She is seeking this loan to pay her course fees so she can continue to study as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está estudiando la carrera de psicología, y a la vez tiene su local de ventas de frutas y verduras.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida, y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus seres queridos en todo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en: Diana, who comes from the city of Encarnación, is studying psychology and, at the same time, runs a greengrocers. She is a very hardworking person who is fighting hard to make progress and make something of herself, as this will enable her to help her loved ones. She is seeking this loan to pay her university fees so she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: pay her university fees.

loans.name: Solecitos Group

texts.es:
Conocida como la novia del sol, esta comunidad veracruzana se mantiene como una de las más calurosas del estado. Tanto en el día como en la noche la temperatura es elevada y los habitantes se han acostumbrados a vivir bajo la calidez del clima. De dicha región es originario el grupo Solecitos cuyo nombre hace clara referencia al sobrenombre de su población. Ellos son: Aracely quien vende comida y cosméticos; Yessica, recipientes de plástico y cosméticos; Erika y Gladys, comida; Rosa, mochilas, ropa y dulces; Miriam, tortillas; Anayeli, cosméticos; Cesar y Abril, ropa; Margarita, ropa y cosméticos; Nelly, zapato, cosméticos y abarrotes mientras que Claudia, oro laminado.
   Rosa es una joven emprendedora que tiene un gran sentido de la responsabilidad y el trabajo. Inició con la venta de dulces para solventar los gastos de su educación; sobre una mesa colocaba la mercancía y mientras no había clientes se dedicaba a realizar sus tareas escolares. Posteriormente decidió vender todo tipo de bolsas y mochilas para incrementar sus ingresos. Tiene cuatro años desempeñando dicha actividad donde, para satisfacer el gusto de sus clientes, compra su producto en una localidad célebre por su calidad y precio. Con las ganancias obtenidas apoya con el gasto del hogar además de iniciar un negocio de venta de ropa en conjunto con su hermana, de igual forma trabaja con su esposo Ricardo vendiendo mascotas. 
   El préstamo que solicita le será de utilidad pues se podrá abastecer de mochilas, lapiceras, loncheras y bolsas de mano ya que la reanudación de clases está muy próxima lo que representa mejores ventas y por ende mayores ganancias. Ella comenta, “gracias por la oportunidad que nos brindan al otorgarnos un nuevo préstamo para poder hacer realidad nuestros sueños”. Las metas que tiene planeadas a futuro son establecerse en un local fijo y ofrecer la mejor variedad de productos en su localidad.
   * La fotografía fue tomada en la casa de Nelly, Rosa es quien viste blusa negra con estampado blanco; detrás se encuentra Anayeli quien viste blusa azul y delante de ella está su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Known as the Novia del Sol, this community in Veracruz is one of the warmest in the state. Day and night, the temperature is high and the people have gotten accustomed to living under the heat of the climate. The group Solecitos is from this region, whose name makes a clear reference to the nickname of the population. They are: Arecely who sells food and cosmetics; Yessica, plastic containers and cosmetics; Erika and Gladys, food; Rosa, backpacks, clothing and sweets; Miriam, tortillas; Anayeli, cosmetics; Cesar and Abril, clothing; Margarita, clothing and cosmetics; Nelly, shoes, cosmetics and groceries, while Claudia sells gold laminate.

Rosa is a young entrepreneur who has a great sense of responsibility and work. She began with the sale of sweets to pay her educational expenses. On a table, she placed her merchandise and when there weren't any customers, she worked on doing her schoolwork. Later, she decided to sell all sorts of bags and backpacks to increase her earnings. She has been doing this work for four years where, to satisfy her customers' tastes, she purchases her products in a place known for its quality and price. With the earnings she gets, she supports the household expenses in addition to beginning a business selling clothing with her sister, and also her husband, Ricardo, works selling pets.

The loan that she requests will be useful because she will be able to stock backpacks, pencil cases, lunch bags and hand bags since school will beginning very soon, which represents her best sales, and in the end her best earnings. She says, "Thanks for the opportunity that you have offered us when granting a new loan to be able to make our dreams come true." The goals she has planned for the future are to establish a permanent retail space and offer the best variety of products in her area.

*The photograph was taken at Nelly's house. Rosa is the one wearing a black blouse with white print, behind her is Anayeli who is wearing a blue blouse and in front of her is her little daughter.

loans.use: to buy backpacks, handbags, lunch boxes and pens.

loans.name: Edbert

texts.en:
Edbert is a 24-year-old college graduate who lives in Bago City. He belongs to a family of five. His father is deceased and his mother is a village health worker.

Edbert is the second to the youngest in their family. His older brother works as a nurse in a Chinese general hospital in Manila, while his younger sister is still in elementary school. Their total monthly family income of only Php 7,200 ($156) is not enough for their personal needs.

Through his training at Bagosphere, Edbert hopes to eventually work in a BPO company that provides high standard of customer service and have a good salary.

He aims to improve his English, and help his family and sibling to college once he gets a stable job and income.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a  two month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a 31-year-old college graduate who lives in Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She belongs to a family of five. Her father works in Asian Alcohol Corp. in Pulupandan and her mother is a housewife.

Aileen is a single parent of a 10-month-old child. Aileen’s siblings are both married. Her elder sister works as an overseas foreign worker in Singapore while her brother works in Distileria Bago Incorporated as field officer. Because she cannot support herself and her child, Aileen has been living with her parents. The family’s total monthly income of Php 17,500 ($379) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs.

Aileen would like to earn more for herself and her family. She believes that the training at Bagosphere would help her realize this goal.

Your generosity in funding her loan will help Aileen have a chance in landing a stable job and a better life opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: Saragen

texts.en:
Saragen is a 24-year-old college undergraduate who lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of seven and is a single parent to a 2-year-old child. Her father is a welder and her mother is a housewife. Saragen has four siblings. The family’s total monthly income of Php P20,000 ($433) is not enough to provide even for their basic needs. This motivated Saragen to find means to help the family to earn more income.

This is why she braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully qualified for the two month training program.

Apart from helping her family, Saragen wants to boost her self-esteem and to become a successful call center agent. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Saragen secure a stable job and a better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: Glair

texts.en:
Glair is a 23-year-old vocational graduate who lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of 11. Glair is the youngest in the family, and she’s raising her 3-year old child as a solo parent. Her father is a farmer and her mother is a housewife. Glair has eight siblings, six of them are already married. Their total monthly income of only Php6,500 ($141) is not enough for their personal needs.

Glair would like to earn more for herself and for her family, and she believes that the training at Bagosphere will allow her to realize this goal.

Glair wants to work in a BPO company that provides a high standard of customer service along with a good salary.

She aims to improve her English and help her family once she gets a stable job and income.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: Marietou's Group

texts.fr: le banc villageois a été créé depuis 2008. le groupe est composé de 6 femmes qui habitent  le même quartier et qui font toutes le commerce.Coura est la représentante du groupe elle a 57 ans, mariée et mère de 4 garçons et 4 filles.Elle fait du commerce et avec son prêt elle compte acheter de l’encense à 300000f et des parfums à 100000.Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine,c'est pourquoi elle fait des mélanges d’encence qui sens trop bon.en plus elle n'a pas beaucoup de concurrentes dans son quartier ce qui explique sa vaste clientèle .Avec ses bénéfices elle assure les petits besoins de ses enfants et injecte le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was created since 2008. The group is made up of six women who live in the same neighbourhood and all engage in trade.
Coura is the group representative, she is 57 years old, married and the mother of four boys and four girls. She is a traeder, and with her loan she intends to purchase incense for 300,000f and perfumes for 100,000f. She has a lot of experience in this area, this is why she makes incense mixes that smell really good. Furthermore, she doesn't have many competitors in her neighbourhood, which explains her large clientele.
With her income she will take care of her children's needs and inject the rest into her activity.

loans.use: to buy incense grains for 200,000f, incense paste for 100,000f and perfume for 100,000f.

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Ama est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Ama vit à Tokoin et est âgée de 41 ans. Ama fait le commerce des caleçons et des habits pour enfants pour gagner son revenu. Ama s’approvisionne deux fois par mois  au marché et sollicite ce crédit pour commander des douzaines d’habits pour enfants et des caleçons en vue d’augmenter ses recettes ; ce qui permettra à Ama de mieux préparer la rentrée scolaire de ses enfants  et  assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ama is married and the mother of two children. She lives in Tokoin and is 41 years old. She trades in underpants and children's clothes in order to earn her income.
Ama gets her supplies twice per month at the market and is requesting this loan to order dozens of children's clothes and underpants so as to increase her sales; which will permit her to better prepare for her children's return to school and ensure that she covers the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy five dozen underpants and five dozen clothes.

loans.name: Amelia Veronica

texts.es:
El ayudar a las demás personas ha sido la pasión de Amelia, una joven de 24 años de edad que decidió estudiar la licenciatura de Enfermería los domingos, para ser parte de un cambio ante la humanidad. Anteriormente, ella había solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una computadora, con la cual ha podido realizar todos sus trabajos, razón por la cual agradece a todas las personas que le apoyaron en esta inversión. 
Ahora Amelia no dudó ni una vez más para volver a solicitar un préstamo para tomar un curso de inglés. Crédito que le permitirá ser parte de un mundo donde la diversificación de culturas y aprendizaje global se cuelan. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y con una remesas de una tía por lo que sus planes ya está bien trazados y sabe que después de sacar la licenciatura optará por una maestría.
texts.en:
Helping others has always been Amelia's passion. She is 24 years old and wanted to be part of making a change in humanity, so she decided to study for a Nursing degree on Sundays. She had previously applied for a loan so she could buy a computer which helped her with her school work, and she is very grateful to everyone who supported her in that investment.

Now Amelia has not hesitated to request a loan once again so she can take a course in English. This loan will allow her to become part of a world where cultural diversification and global learning are intermingled.

Fortunately her husband supports her and so does an aunt who sends money, so her plans are well laid-out and she knows that after getting her undergraduate degree she will go on to a master's.

loans.use: to pay for an English course.

loans.name: Manisha

texts.en:
Manisha is a 27 years married woman, with one daughter of 3 years. She has started a vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seeds and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiizers

loans.name: Daleski Jeanneth

texts.es:
Durante la niñez, Daleski ha mantenido una vida donde su madre es el pilar para salir adelante y quien se ha convertido en tu apoyo emocional, desde que padre se fue al extranjero por mucho tiempo. Pero esto lo ha hecho que esta joven de 21 años de edad sobre salga con sus metas. Razón por la cual ya está en cuarto año de la carrera de Química y farmacias.  
Ya estando a punto de graduarse se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para comprar una computadora, la cual le facilitará y le ayudará a ahorrar dinero al momento de elaborar todos los trabajos de culminación, pues no tendrá que pagar en un cibercafé, como lo ha estado haciendo siempre. En sus planes está terminar su licenciatura y trabajar siempre en una institución acorde a la carrera estudiada.
texts.en:
During her childhood Daleski led a life in which her mother was the pillar that helped her get ahead and who provided emotional support ever since her father went abroad for a long time. But this helped this 21-year-old excel in reaching her goals and is the reason why she is now in her fourth year of her Chemistry and Pharmacy degree.

Now that she is about to graduate she finds it necessary to apply for a loan so she can buy a computer. This will make it easier for her and help her to save money when she does all her culminating research papers since she won't have to pay to work at a cyber cafe which she has been doing up until now.

Her plans are to finish her degree and to work at an institution related to her field of study.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Busu Bundibombi Abagwane Womens Grp Group

texts.en:
Kasifa is 45 years and lives in Bundibugyo-Uganda with her five children. She is a hardworking woman dealing in cocoa buying and selling. She got involved in the businesses to earn income and for family upkeep. She is challenged by bad weather and limited capital that hinders expansion of her cocoa business. Aisha has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa seeds for drying and resale to her customers.
She is a member of Busu Bundibombi Abagwane womens grp where members guarantee one another for a loan since they do not pledge security.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for re sale to cocoa buying companies.

loans.name: El Ferdous Group

texts.en:
Fahda is the featured borrower for El Ferdous Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.
Fahda is a 37-year-old married mother of three children. Ten years ago, she started renting out a house she owns to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to prepare her house for the upcoming cold winter season through buying carpets and fireplace fuel oil. Fahda is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to prepare for the winter season through buying carpets and fireplace fuel oil

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
A 64-year-old mother of two dependent children, Pov is living in Kandal province. The only main source of her family’s income is form rice farming. She has been involved in this business for forty-two years and it allow her to save about 10 USD each day after offsetting her family’s expense.
This is the second loan cycle for Pov with VisionFund and she has fully repaid her previous loan that enables her to have a water filter, which provides clean water to support her family. Because of drought, her crop has grown not well and return her a very low income which really hard for her to support her big family. Due to having not enough working capital to do farming for this season, she is now leading a group two to apply for a new loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yields and allow her to sell it in a better price. She hopes that she this loan will help her to earn more income to upgrade her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yields, which will allow her to earn more income to save for future need.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 34-year-old, married man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house and he is the only breadwinner for his family, so they depend on him for support.

Rami has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict. Rami took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers and eventually save enough income to cover school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Ubumwe Group A

texts.en:
Assia is a group leader; 28 years. She is married with 2 children aged between 2.5 and 7 years. The group is called UBUMWE means “Unite” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

Assia sells foodstuffs and has been running a business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava, beans, banana and Irish potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees and make savings.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, beans, banana and Irish potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is requesting a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as sugar, candies, soaps, hand body lotion, cooking oils, aqua, coffee, noodles, cigarettes, including soft drinks and hard drinks ans other things to sell.

Anita started to open her kiosk a few year ago, with her own working capital of $ 500.00. She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. And she will use this loan to improving her management for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, candies, soaps, cooking oils, aqua, coffee, noodles, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Christian Abby

texts.en:
Christian Abby is a 19-year-old high school graduate who lives in Bago City. He belongs to a family of 6. His father works in a multi-trader printing press in Bacolod City, and his mother is a day-care center teacher.

Christian Abby has 3 siblings. His elder sister works in a call center in Bacolod City and his elder brother works in a machine shop for calibration in Dumaguete City.

The family’s total monthly income of PHP 18,500 ($ 401) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. Therefore Christian Abby applied for Bagosphere’s 2-month training program, aiming to help augment his family’s income by having a well-paying stable job as a call center agent.

Your generosity in funding his loan will definitely help Christian Abby to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: April Joy

texts.en:
April Joy is a 27-year-old college undergraduate who lives in Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She belongs to a family of 7. Her father works as a farm laborer and her mother is a housewife. April Joy is the eldest child in the family. Her sister works in a computer shop in Bago City while two of her younger sisters are still in high school.

The family’s total monthly income of PHP 8,000 ($ 173) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. April Joy dreams of becoming a call center agent and of having a stable job that can help her family.

Your support in funding her loan will help April Joy to have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Ederly

texts.en:
Ederly is 50 years old with one child. Ederly works very hard to provide for them.

Ederly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Ederly has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Ederly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Nolita

texts.en:
Nolita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her selling sea shells.

Nolita dreams that one day, She will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 65 years old and has seven children. Felipa is married woman.

Felipa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Felipa requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Felipa has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Felipa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Leah works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Leah is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business like flour, oil, etc. for her food vending business.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business like flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias used the previous loan to to rent a kisubi (banana) plantation, an ingredient used in making waragi a local brew. He brews waragi alongside growing banana and running an aggro-shop that adds him more income. He is faced with a challenged of price fluctuation of waragi which is a hindrance to his business expansion. However, he looks forward to becoming a financially independent person. Elias has asked for another loan to help him  buy more agro products and add in his shop for sell.

loans.use: to buy more agro products and add to his shop for sale.

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en: Aaron is a 36 year old married man with 3 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a farmer growing tomatoes and also earning salary that add him more income. He is faced with hardships of pests and diseases that affect growth of his business. However, he is looking forward to constructing a personal residential house for his family. Aaron has asked for a loan facility to buy tomato herbicides and spray his tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy tomato herbicides and spray his tomatoes.

loans.name: Balijukira Kakwese Group

texts.en: Robert whose hand is raised in the group photograph is a thirty two year old man, married with two children living in Masindi-Uganda. He started a retail business in 2006 with an aim of providing the basic needs of life to his family. Robert also works as a primary school teacher where he gets extra income. He is ambitious and hopes to educate his children. He requests for a loan to buy shop items for selling.

loans.use: to buy shop items like salt and soap for selling.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine in Kamwenge, Uganda used his previous loan to buy hardware items such as nails, cement and rods to sell. He now has 2 children and still runs a hardware/plumbing shop. With the proceeds he has been able to look after his family, buy land and build a residential house.

Augustine earns supplementary income from a salary but like most traders in the developing world, he still faces hardships of inadequate capital and the high cost of living. However, he hopes to increase his profits and have a known plumbing wholesale store.
He is requesting a loan to buy more plumbing items such as pipes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more plumbing items such as pipes to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: For 5 years Joseph has been operating a video library on a busy street in Kagadi-Uganda. He has a banana plantation from where he gets additional income to support his nuclear family and meet his personal needs. Thanks to his hard work that has enabled him look after his wife and also maintain the business and serve the community in terms of entertainment. He has a dream of transforming his business into the biggest video library in his area. On a sad note, Joseph faces a difficulty of electricity break downs yet his business mainly depends on power. He has requested for a loan to buy latest videos that his client are demanding for.

loans.use: to buy latest videos that his client are demanding for.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ruby works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Ruby is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Ruby has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en:
A 53-year-old mother of two dependent children, Vorn is living in Kampong Thom province. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and cassava growing for five years. The price of cassava is depreciated in market, which is the main challenge for her in earning income to support her family. For Vorn, she has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and completely repaid her past loan. The previous loan helps her to have a better living condition.

Due to having not enough money to fulfill her family’s needs, she is now leading a group of two to apply for a Kiva loan again. As a group leader, she is willing to take her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine to improve her family’s living, health and protect her children from illness. She hopes to be able to save more money for the future needs by reducing the cost of health care service.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine to improve her family’s living, health and protect her children from illness.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 28 years old, she is married and she has a very high interest in doing business. She is applying for a loan of $ 800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. Because she has a small kiosk, she is taking a loan, which she will use to buy more items according to what people like, such as biscuits, aqua, eggs, noodles, Pop mie, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.  Rita has been involving in business activities in 2010, she started with her own working capital of $ 300.00. She is earning a good income every day, so she has plan to open her business a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, aqua, eggs, noodles, Pop mie, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Jurytha Dy

texts.en:
Jurytha Dy is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jurytha Dy is 37 years old and has six children who are in school.

Jurytha Dy has a buy and sell feeds business in the Philippines. Jurytha Dy requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more feeds, and other supplies to use in her business.

Jurytha Dy has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Jurytha Dy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more feeds, and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Marven

texts.en:
Marven is a 25-year-old college undergraduate who lives in Bago City. He belongs to a family of 5. Marven is the youngest in their family, and he’s separated with 2 children who are now in elementary level. His father works as a casual employee in an engineers' office in Bago City, and his mother is a housewife.

Although Marven’s eldest brother works in Bago City as a casual employee and his eldest sister works as an overseas foreign worker in Sweden, the family’s total monthly income of PHP 17,000 ($ 368) is not enough.

Marven wanted to help his family but he didn’t know how, until he learned about the 2-month training program at Bagosphere that could lead to a high paying job. Now that he has passed Bagosphere’s selection process, he needs your help to finance his tuition. Once Marven gets employed and starts earning, he can then help to provide for his family’s basic needs and also save money for his children’s education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marlyn is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Marlyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Marlyn has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Abakundumurimo Sub Group B

texts.en:
Lydie is a group leader; aged 25 years.She is married with 2 children aged between 3 and 7 years. The group is called ABAKUNDUMURIMO means “the hardworking people” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

Lydie has a shop and has been running in a business for 11 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 34 years old and married with two children who are still in school. Dina works very hard to provide for them.

Dina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, and other personal care products. She has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Dina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 43 years old and married with five children.

Fely works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, biscuits, junk food, homecare products, and other groceries.

Fely has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Fely aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, biscuits, junk food, homecare products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Dolorosa

texts.en:
Dolorosa is 44 years old and married with four children.

Dolorosa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, and other personal care products.

Dolorosa has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Dolorosa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles,  spices, drinks, snack foods, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen is 48 years old and has six children who are in school.

Helen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell.

Helen has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Twekambe Kibaali Kitonde Group

texts.en: Luka whose hand is raised up in a group photograph is a fifty one year old married man with five children living in Masindi-Uganda. He deals in crop production but also does market vending. He has a passion of serving the local people with food and this is why he decided to engage in crop production. Luka is very hard working and has managed to look after his family using the proceeds from his business. He wants a loan to plough and buy chemicals for spraying.

loans.use: to plough his gardens and buy chemicals for spraying.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a coffee grower in Kamwenge. He used his previous loan to buy more manure & fertilizers. He  is  hardworking and also gets additional income from goat rearing and growing other food crops. With this, he has been able to get income and sustain his family. He hopes to expand his coffee plantation; however, his main challenge is still poor seasonal conditions and loss of soil fertility due to over planting.

He is requesting a loan to buy more manure and fertilizers  and hire labor for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more manure & fertilizers  and hire labor for his farm.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey trades in local brew commonly known as Waragi. This is his major business but also he practices farming and owns a bar to supplement his incomes. At the age of 47 Godfrey is married and has been in business since 1993 having started it with a purpose of earning a living to support his family and dependants at large.

He intends to use the loan to buy Waragi to sell. His business has moved on due to the zeal and hard work that he puts in even though he faces a setback of inadequate capital. He dreams of expanding his business to the city where prices are very attractive.

loans.use: to buy more waragi to sell.

loans.name: Seferita

texts.es:
Por más de veinte años, Seferita lleva adelante y con pasos firmes su negocio de venta de ropa. Ella ha tenido que pasar por viento y marea para estar hasta donde está ahora. A sus 39 años siente que le falta mucho por descubrir y saber que será, para mientras disfruta de su esposo, de sus dos hijos, quienes adoran estar estudiando en un buen colegio, y de ese pequeño tramo que se ha convertido en la fuente económica y motivadora. 
Lo que fue una idea y se convirtió en  realidad, son el ejemplo de una persona muy dedicada y con esfuerzo, a pesar de las limitaciones económicas. Ahora desde de tanto tiempo y al ver que es lo que le asegura el futuro a sus hijos, para ella invertir en este es necesario. Razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para  comprar camisas, ropa de cama, pantalones, ropa interior, entre otro tipo de mercadería que es de mayor demanda. En sus planes está llegar a tener su propio espacio para vender y hacer más grande negocio.
texts.en: For over twenty years and with a strong will, Seferita has managed her clothing business. She has had to struggle to be where she is at now. At 39 years of age she feels that she still has a lot to discover and to know how things will develop with this economic and motivating source, as she enjoys spending time with her husband, her two children who enjoy very much studying in a good school. What was once an idea has come true, and it is an example of a very dedicated and focused person, in spite of her economic limitations. Now, after all this time,  she needs to ask for a loan to buy shirts, bed linens, pants, underwear, among other type of merchandise of greater demand. She plans to get to a point where she will have her own space to sell and generate more business.

loans.use: To buy shirts, bed linens, pants, underwear, and other items.

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.en:
Purificacion is 61 years old, widow with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Purificacion has a personal care product retail business in the Philippines. Purificacion requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of personal care products to sell.

Purificacion has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Purificacion would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Levy works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Levy is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients like vegetable, fish, oil, spices, etc, for her food vending business.

Levy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetable, fish, oil, spices, etc,

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Yvonne is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Yvonne has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gad

texts.en: Godi a businessman doing produce majorly dealing in maize and beans is requesting a loan to buy maize and beans to sell ahead of the picking season. He is aged 37 married with 5 children; three of them are attending school. His major business is produce buying and selling though he also owns rentals and farming a business he started to earn a living. He has intentions of expanding his business but his major challenge is lack of enough capital to invest in his business. Godi is a hardworking man living in Kagadi –Uganda.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell ahead of the picking season.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a 49-year-old married woman with 10 children, 7 of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Eden has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing net and gasoline for her boat, and bamboo and other personal care products. She has been in this business for 6 years.

Eden would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and gasoline for her boat, and bamboo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Felma is 46 years old and married with four children, three of whom are still in school. Felma works very hard to provide for them.

Felma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, and other personal care products. She has been in this business for 3 years.

Felma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Haguruka Group

texts.en:
Seraphine is a group leader; aged 30 years.She is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 11years. The group is called HAGURUKA means “WAKE-UP” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

Seraphine has a shop and has been running a business for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
A $ 1,500.00 is offered to Cristina to improve her business. She has a small shop where many people come to buy every day.She will buy some additional supplies such as coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, soap and body lotion etc. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Cristina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, salt, milks, water, soap and body lotion etc

loans.name: Limeng

texts.en:
Limeng is 21 years old, a single and a teller at a bank since 2014. She lives with her parents in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She can earn approximately $7 per day.

She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Accounting in the fourth year at university in the province. This is her second loan cycle with Kiva. Now Limeng is requesting a loan because she lacks the finances to pay her tuition fees. This loan will help her graduate successfully and earn skills to achieve her future goal. In the future, Limeng wants to find a better job with higher salary.

loans.use: to pay her university fees for a BSc. in Accounting.

loans.name: Abadahemuka Group B

texts.en: ABADAHEMUKA a group led by Pauline who is 35 years old. The group name means “IMPORTANT PEOPLE” in English. She is married with 3 children aged between 3 and 10 years. She owns a shop and has been doing in a business for the past 7 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, soaps, salt and cooking oil for sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soaps, salt and cooking oil for sell.

loans.name: Karanjung Lestari 2 Group

texts.en:
The Karanjung Lestari 2 group paid off the previous loan. They are very grateful to MUK, Kiva and lenders for the funds provided.

Because the prices of feeds are low enough, the Karanjung Lestari 2 group went on with a new loan. At the time of disbursement of funds in the field, 1 member could not attend due to attending ceremony at the temple. Ni Nyoman used her portion to purchase 4 superior piglets. Feed and vitamins provide with her own money. Each member gets 3.500.000 IDR. Ni Nyoman give the piglets a quality feed for increasing growth. To reduce costs, she still gives the mixture feeds. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and not attacked by disease to ensure a maximum result.

loans.use: to purchase 4 superior piglets

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 27 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Maribel works very hard to provide for them.

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Maribel has been in this business for 7 years. 

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane.

Remedios dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Melanie is 40 years old, and six of her children are still in school.

Melanie has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 5,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her local market.

Melanie has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her local market.

loans.name: Mechelle

texts.en:
Mechelle is 31 years old and married with one child. Mechelle works very hard to provide for the family.

Mechelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, bread, spices, drinks, snack foods and other products.

Mechelle has been in this business for eight years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, bread, spices, drinks, snack foods and other products.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nilda works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nilda is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell like banana and mango for her fruit-vending business.

Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell like banana and mango.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 60 years old and married with six children. Raquel works very hard to provide for them.

Raquel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, bread, spices, drinks, snack foods and other products.

Raquel has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Raquel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, bread, spices, drinks, snack foods and other products.

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es:
El esfuerzo y la dedicación han sido las principales características de Maria, una emprendedora de 63 años de edad, que ha salido adelante solamente con sus tres hijos. Razón por la cual decidió hace 25 años establecer su pulpería, pues lo miró como una oportunidad estable, después de haber intentado en un bar, que le permitió ahorrar la inversión de este bonito negocio. 
María es un ejemplo a seguir, pues a pesar que ella no sabe leer, nunca ha dejado una idea sin llevarla a cabo. Afortunadamente siempre cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. Su sueño es fortalecer aún más la pulpería, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar una vitrina, que le permitirá exhibir mejor sus productos. En un futuro pretende mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en: Effort and dedication have been the principal characteristics of Maria, a 63 year old  entrepreneur who has gotten ahead by herself with her 3 children. 25 years ago, she opened her grocery store as she saw this as a stable opportunity after she opened a bar which generated enough savings for this nice business. Maria is an example to be followed, because, although she doesn't know how to read, it didn't stop her from developing an idea and making it happen. Luckily, she has the support of her children. Her dream is to improve her store, that is why she is asking for a loan to buy a display cabinet which will allow her to display her products better. In the future, she intends to improve her business infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet.

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
Rea is 30 years old and single.

Rea works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, bread, spices, drinks, snack foods and other products.

Rea has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from e-loading (mobile phone credits).

Rea aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, bread, spices, drinks, snack foods and other products.

loans.name: Chicken Little In Life - N01T6Hyênhtrung Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thanh is 58 years old and is married. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for 5 years. Thanh lives in Ha Trung district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region. In addition, the income from this job is unstable because when some poultry diseases occur, her poultry may die, leaving her nothing to sell and creating financial difficulties for her. The main hardship that Thanh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. This is Thanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her life standard. She is the group leader of N01T6HYênHTrung, which consists of 5 members. With her business profit, Thanh hopes her family can be healthy and happy to travel for vacation within the country, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of herbal medicine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling recycled materials.

Salvacion is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy assorted herbal medicine to sell for her herbal medicine business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 50 years old and married with three children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Gina has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Sotera

texts.en:
Sotera is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sotera is 54 years old and has seven children who are currently in school.

Sotera has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Sotera requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more assorted fish to sell to her customers.

Sotera has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 48 years old and married with three children. Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, eggs, junk food, home care products, and other groceries. 

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending. 

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, eggs, junk food, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Lucely Maria

texts.es:
Lucely es madre soltera con 31 años de edad, debido a que no cuenta con el apoyo de su ex pareja para el sostenimiento de sus hijos, esta mujer se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado, de allí obtiene los ingresos mínimos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
Su propósito es continuar trabajando, formalizar su negocio y en un futuro dejárselo a sus hijos.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de pollos de engorde, alimento y mejorara los galpones.
La actividad que realiza esta  mujer para sobrevivir con los suyos son dignas de aplausos y es aconsejable prestarle el beneficio de apoyo que necesita.
texts.en:
Lucely is a 31-year-old single mother. Due to her ex-partner not supporting her or her child, she is earning a living raising and selling livestock. From this she gets the minimal income to meet the basic needs of her home.

Her intention is to keep working, to establish her business, and give it to her children in the future.

She is requesting this a loan to invest in buying chickens for fattening and food, and to improve the chicken coops.

The work this woman is doing to survive own her own deserves admiration and it is advisable to grant her the benefit of the needed support.

loans.use: to buy chickens for fattening and food, and to improve the chicken coops.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 24 years old and married. Janet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, condiments, home care products, and other groceries. Janet has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. Janet aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, condiments, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Huberley

texts.es:
Huberley es un hombre con 22 años de edad, presta el servicio de transporte a personas en el Municipio de Turbo, una actividad que aprendió gracias a un amigo, quien se dedica  lo mismo.
Con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, el dinero obtenido es invertido en sus estudios y su familia.
Su problema actual es que la motocicleta con la que labora  no es propia, es alquilada por un vecino. Es por esto que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de una motocicleta, la cual sea propia. 
Su meta es continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de tener propia casa.
La actividad que realiza este hombre es digna de aplausos y es aconsejable prestarle el beneficoo de apoyo que necesita.
texts.en:
Huberley is a man, 22 years old. He offers transportation service to people in the Municipality of Turbo, an activity that he learned thanks to a friend who also works at the same thing. With this, he's had great progress. The money obtained is invested in his studies and his family.

His current problem is that the motorcycle he works with isn't his own, it's rented from a neighbor. It's for this that he's found applying for a loan, which he will invest in the purchase of a motorcycle which will be his. His goal is to continue working until he fulfills the dream of having his own house. The activity that this man does is worthy of applause and it's advisable to offer him the benefit of support that he needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.fr:
Crée le 02 juillet 2008, le banc villageois est composé de femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles sont très dynamiques, elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenu du petit commerce à l’agriculture. Il existe une bonne entente entre les membres du groupe. 

Madame Rose (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans est mariée mère de 2 enfants dont 1 garçon et  1 fille. Elle s’active dans l’élevage de porcs et la culture d’arachide. Elle a une grande expérience dans ces domaines. Pour l’agriculture, elle fait un hectare d’arachide et pour l’élevage elle achète de petits pour dans les villages frontaliers l’’engraisse au moins pendant 06 mois avant la revente à l’état ou par abatage. 
 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle désire acheter de la semence 04 sacs de 25 kg de l’engrais, l’urée 02 sacs de 50 kg et autres produits pour la culture. Concernant l’élevage elle achètera 05 à 10 sujets pour engraissement et revendre.

Avec ses bénéfices elle assure parfois la dépense quotidienne et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Created on July 2, 2008, this "banc villageois" (loan group) is made up of women who all live in the same village. They are very dynamic and they have various money-earning activities ranging from small-scale commerce to agriculture. The members of the group get along very well with each other.

Madame Rose (seated on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 49 and is the married mother of two children, one son and one daughter. She works at raising pigs and growing peanuts. She has a great deal of experience in these fields. She grows a hectare of of peanuts, and as for raising livestock, she buys piglets to fatten in the border villages and fattens them for at least six months, before selling them to the state or for slaughter.

With her new loan she wants to buy seeds, four sacks of 25kg of fertilizer, two sacks of 50 kg of urea, and other products for crop growing. As for livestock raising, she will buy 5 to 10 piglets for fattening and later resale.

With her profits, she sometimes covers the daily expenditures and school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, four sacks of 25kg of fertilizer, two sacks of 50 kg of urea, and some other products for crop growing, as well as 5 to 10 piglets to raise and resell later on.

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
La Neri socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Neri still runs a grocery store, where she is selling basic goods like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

She works from 8 in the morning until 7 at night. She has had this business for 5 years and it is going well for her. Her goal is to expand her grocery store.

She is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

She is very happy about the loan and is committed to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more stock such as noodles, eggs, rice, snacks, etc., and to buy pig fodder.

loans.name: Susie May

texts.en:
Susie May is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susie May is 38 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Susie May has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Susie May requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell.

Susie May has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell

loans.name: Bartolo

texts.es:
Bartolo es un hombre con 52 años de edad, trabajador, humilde y lleno de vida, desde niño se dedica a realizar labores de campo, como lo son cultivos de hortalizas, con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, no solo obtiene buenos ingresos sino que sus posibilidades de cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda son muchas, ya que diariamente puede ahorrar parte de sus ganancias hasta cumplir lo que desea.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de los materiales necesarios para mejorar los canales, principalmente los secundarios.
La adversidad que lo ha perseguido no ha sido obstáculo para este hombre rendirse y dejar sus sueños atrás, es aconsejable prestarle  el beneficio de apoyo que solicita.
texts.en:
Bartolo, age 52, is a hard-working, humble man who is full of life. He has been working in the fields, like growing vegetables, ever since he was a boy. He has made great progress with this. He not only gets good earnings, but he has a lot of possibilities to fulfill his dream of improving the condition of his house. Every day he is able to save part of his earnings towards fulfilling this wish.

He is requesting a loan to buy the materials needed to improve the canals, primarily the secondary ones. The adversity that he has faced has not been an obstacle for this man to give in to and make him leave his dreams behind. It is recommended to lend him the benefit of the support he is requesting.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to improve the canals, mainly the secondary ones.

loans.name: Danila

texts.es:
Danila tiene 21 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres quienes hasta hace poco le pagaban sus estudios, ya con experiencia en peluquería consiguió un empleo en un salón de belleza hace un año y están muy conformes con ella y su trabajo, sigue estudiando para obtener mayor profesionalismo en lo que le gusta hacer y tiene como aspiración futura abrir su propio salón de belleza, trabajar independientemente y construir su propia casa.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su curso de peluquería profesional, para de esa forma estar más cerca de cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Danila is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents, who paid for her studies up until recently.
With her experience as a hairdresser she got a job at a beauty salon one year ago. They are very happy with her and her work. She continues to study to get more professional at what she likes doing.

Her aspiration for the future is to have her own beauty salon, work independently, and build her own house.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees of her professional hairdresser's course in order to be closer in reaching her goals.

loans.use: pay for the costs of professional hairdressing course.

loans.name: Doda

texts.es:
Doda es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, está estudiando la carrera de Radiología, comenta que su meta es llegar a terminar sus estudios y formarse como una buena radióloga y así ayudar a su familia y también a las personas que necesitan atención.
Ella es una persona muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante por medio de sus estudios y de esa forma hacerse conocida como profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma continuar con sus estudios y así estar más cerca de su meta.
texts.en: Doda is from the city of Coronel Oviedo, she is studying the career of Radiology. She comments that her goal is to arrive at finishing her studies and make herself a good radiologist and therefore help her family and also the people who need attention. She is a very tenacious person who wants to get ahead by means of her studies and, in this manner, make herself known as a professional. She's applying for this loan to be able to pay her fees, and in this manner continue with her studies and therefore be closer to her goal.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Julieta
