texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Julieta works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Julieta is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, etc., for her bakery business.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Felomina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Felomina is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish-vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Felomina has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Catarina Armida

texts.es:
Catarina, tiene una fuente de ingresos estable, ya que con el crédito anterior ha podido mantener la tienda surtida para que las ventas sigan creciendo y su estilo de vida es más confortable.
En vista de la afluencia de clientes que tiene su negocio opta por solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de aceite, granos básicos, cereales, pan, huevos, etc., de esa manera ahorrara y venderá sus productos a un precio justo.
texts.en: Catarina has a stable source of income, since with the previous loan she's been able to maintain the store stocked so that sales keep growing and her lifestyle is more comfortable. In view of the influx of customers that her business has, she's opting to apply for a new loan to buy a greater quantity of oil, basic grains, cereals, bread, eggs, etc. In this manner she will save and will sell her products at a fair price.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of oil, basic grains, cereals, bread, eggs, etc., in this manner she will save.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en: Phan’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Phan works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help them to safeguard the health of their families and to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Aramata's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois est créé en juillet  2008, il est composé de femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Soucieuses de leur condition de vie, elles mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenu comme le petit commerce et l’agriculture.

Madame Aramata (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41ans et mère de 4enfants dont 2 filles et 2garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de divers produits alimentaires comme le jus de citron et l’huile de palme, qu’elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants pour la revendre dans la sous-région et les régions centre de la capitale elle jouit d’une expérience de plus de 3ans.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 5 bidons de 20l d’huile de palme de, 10 bidons de jus de citron et les balais traditionnel.

Avec ses bénéfices elle appuie son mari dans la gestion des besoins de la famille en nourriture, santé, et le renouvellement de fournitures scolaire
texts.en:
This 'Banc Villageois' was created in July 2008. It is made up of women who all live in the same village. They are all very aware of their poor living conditions so work to make money through commerce and agriculture.

Aramata (sitting on the far right in the photo, with her hand raised) is the representative borrower of the group. She is forty-one years old and mother to four children, two girls and two boys. She sells various food products such as lemon juice and palm oil which she buys in local villages. She then makes her sales in the local region and also in the central regions of the capital. Aramata has more than three years' experience in her business.

Aramata will use her loan to buy five, twenty litre drums of palm oil, ten drums of lemon juice and traditional brushes. Her profits will help her husband provide food, healthcare and school equipment for their family.

loans.use: to buy 5 x 20 litre drums of palm oil, 10 drums of lemon juice and traditional brooms.

loans.name: Love Beautifying Others Lives - N03Đtâmttâmthóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khanh is 32 years old and married with two children. She has had a manufacturing business that sews curtains for four years. Khanh lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market demand is low in this region.
The main hardship that Khanh faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes and a machine to sew curtains. In 2013, Khanh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Khanh has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the N03ĐTâmTTâmTHoá, which consists of four members. With her business profit, Khanh hopes for her children to go to school, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and a machine to sew curtains

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en:
Marigen is 31 years old with one child.

Marigen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Marigen has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marigen aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and married with three children. With one child is still in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products.

Josephine has been in this business for 19 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 60 years old and married with four children. Nida works very hard to provide for them.

Nida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products.

Nida has been in this business for 31 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Belma

texts.en:
Belma is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children, two attend school. Belma works very hard to provide for them.

Belma has run a general store for 2 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products and groceries.

In the future, Belma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy personal  care products and  groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kafui Aku

texts.fr: Kafui est une femme mariée de 41 ans habitant à Tokoin. Mère de trois enfants, Kafui est une commerçante de pagnes qu’elle achète deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des pagnes de haute qualité, Kafui demande ce prêt afin d’avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kafui is a married woman aged 41, living in Tokoin. The mother of three children, Kafui is a small-scale retailer selling pagnes (lengths of bright cloth) that she buys twice a month in the market. She resells them out of her home and in neighboring districts.

So as to order high-quality pagnes, Kafui is asking for this loan, intending to have a high profit margin and help her husband with family expenses as well as permit her children to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy 12 lengths of pagne (brightly colored African print cloth) of high quality.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chhin's Group

texts.en: Chhin’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. Chhin grows rice and  farms to support his family. Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nhank's Group

texts.en: Nhank’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Nhank grows rice and  works at a factory to support her family. Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Race Of Aquatic Creature - 12Tlộchlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huyền is 36 years old and she is married with 2 children.
She has worked in agriculture raising marine aquaculture for 6 years.
Huyền lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Huyền faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to catch fish, shrimp and frogs.
In 2014, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Huyền has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the 12TLộcHLộc, which consists of 6 members.

With her business profit, Huyền hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to catch fish, shrimp and frogs.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz tiene 21 años, está estudiando la Carrera de Administración de Empresas y espera recibirse pronto poder trabajar en la carrera que ella eligió.
Liz pese a su corta edad tiene muchas metas y anhelos, por las cuales está luchando, para poder ser una buena profesional y por medio de sus estudios poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por lo que ella sueña ser.
texts.en: Liz is 21, she's studying the career of Business Administration and hopes to graduate soon to be able to work in the career that she chose. Liz, despite her young age, has many goals and longings for which she is fighting to be able to be a good professional and by means of her studies be able to be someone in life. She's applying for this loan to be able to pay the fees of her degree, and in this manner, be able to continue fighting for that which she dreams to be.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a 47-year-old, resident of Las Pinas City, Philippines who is married to Benjamin, an auto mechanic driver. They have two high-school-aged children. Her husband's salary is not enough to raise a family so Mercedes started a food vending business.

Mercedes buys ice candies and peanuts and then peddles them to her community. Her different flavored ice candies are loved by children and teens. Her roasted and boiled peanuts are one of the favorite snacks of Filipinos. She has regular customers.

She would like to request for 20,000 PHP to buy several packs of ice candies and peanuts from wholesalers to sell. She is hoping for your positive response. Your help will go a long way to assist her livelihood. Her income will surely cover their daily sustenance and send her children to school.

Mercedes plans for her business to flourish and send her children to a good university. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ice candies and peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Madeline successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Madeline's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana, vive junto a sus padres, hermanos y un hijo, practica la crianza de cerdos y además ha hecho la apertura de una tienda en la que vende detergentes, jabón, golosinas y otros productos de primera necesidad, la responsabilidad de ser madre soltera la motivo a buscar su propia fuente de ingresos.
Con el crédito comprara boquitas, jugos, toallas sanitarias, arroz, etc., y el resto lo invertirá en equipo para acomodar los productos en la tienda, mostrara un negocio bien organizado y atenderá de manera adecuada a sus clientes.
Sus aspiraciones son generar más ingresos para cancelar su deuda y sostener su familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her parents, brothers and a son. She practices animal raising and additionally, has made the opening of a store in which she sells detergents, soap, snacks and other staple goods. The responsibility of being a single mother motivated her to look for her own source of income.

With the loan, she will buy snacks, juices, sanitary napkins, rice, etc. and the rest will be invested in equipment to accommodate products in the store. She will show a well-organized business and will tend to her customers in an adequate manner. Her aspirations are to generate more income to pay off her debt and sustain the family.

loans.use: to buy snacks, juices, sanitary napkins, rice, etc. and the rest will be invested in equipment to accommodate products in the store.

loans.name: Pedro Manuel

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre con 52 años de edad, trabajador, humilde y lleno de vida. Actualmente él realiza labores de campo, una actividad que aprendió desde muy pequeño gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres, quienes anteriormente realizaban esta labor.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de los materiales necesarios para mejorar y crear  nuevos canales.

Sus sueños son muchos, pero el pero el principal es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que esta lleva muchos años de construida y su estado actual no es el mejor.

Con su aporte este hombre podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Pedro is a man aged 52, a worker, humble and full of life. Currently he does farm labor, an activity he learned from a very young age thanks to the teachings of his parents, who before carried out this labor. He is found applying for a loan, which he will invest in the purchase of the necessary materials to improve and create new [irrigation] troughs.

His dreams are many, but for him the main one is to improve the conditions of his home, since it was constructed many years ago and its current state isn't the best. With your support, this man will be able to make his dreams a reality. Go ahead, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials to improve and create new [irrigation] troughs.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman, 50 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Gemma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to her stall.

Gemma has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to her stall

loans.name: Herng's Group

texts.en: Herng’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. Herng grows rice and farms to support her family. Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families,  save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

texts.en: Vern’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia.  Vern grows rice and work as a factory laborer to support her family. Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ama Germaine

texts.fr: Mariée, Ama est femme âgée de 30 ans qui vit avec ses deux enfants à charge à Tokoin. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins de ses enfants, Ama  vend la boisson alcoolisée  locale appelé « Sodabi »  à domicile et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Ama réalise une bonne marge bénéficiaire grâce ce commerce et désire ce crédit pour commander des bidons de «  sodabi »  afin de tirer profit et aider son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants et favoriser ainsi donc leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Ama is thirty years old, married and lives with her two children in Tokoin. To earn her living and help support her children, she sells Sodabi (West African palm wine liqueur used in local ceremonies) from her home. She buys new supplies twice a month from the market.

Ama makes a good profit from her business and has requested this loan to order drums of Sodabi to increase her profits and help her husband take care of their children and pay for their school education.

loans.use: to buy 5 drums of sodabi (West African palm wine liqueur used in local ceremonies).

loans.name: Jesus El Buen Pastor Group

texts.en:
Huehuetenango is a city and a department in the northwestern highlands of Guatemala. It is a very busy area and is a major commercial center of the region. It is often a stop for travelers on the journey to or from Mexico. The mountainous scenery is quite striking as the area is part of the “Sierra de los Cuchumatanes”. Those who inhabit this area are of Mayan descent.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Jesus El Buen Pastor” or “Jesus The Good Shepherd” has been formed by 9 ladies who have varying degrees of formal education. They are of various ages as well. The women are involved in various commercial ventures including the sales of used clothing, cosmetics, plastic products, books and chocolate. Another lady has a convenience store.

Brenda is a 30 year old member of the group who is married with three children who are 3, 5, and 10 years of age. They are her inspiration and motivation to excel. Brenda has a cosmetic business and sells items by catalogue as well. She is requesting a loan to purchase cosmetic items and other supplies. Brenda wants to have plenty of inventory available for her clientele.
The women of the Trust Bank comment that their expectation is to expand their small businesses, increase their earnings and send their children to school. Thanks to KIVA investors and the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, that combines small loans and education, they are on their way to achieving these goals.  

Thank you, KIVA investors, for your interest in Brenda and her friends in the Trust Bank. With their small loans and educational trainings, they are poised to step into a brighter and more prosperous tomorrow, benefitting themselves, their families and their community!

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic items and other supplies for resale. .

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 40 years and she is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better when she applied for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $ 1.500.00. she will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as  coffee,sugar,noodles.soap.slippers,biscuits,fish,salt,beer,fanta and oils.She is happy with TRM (TubaRaiMetin) that offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, noodles. soap. slippers, biscuits, fish, salt, beer, fanta and oils.

loans.name: Jyambere Acb Group

texts.en:
Laetitia is a group leader; aged 45 years.She is married with 5 children aged between 10 and 22 years. The group is called JYAMBERE means “GO A HEAD” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

She has a shop and has been running a business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 33 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines. Maricel is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maricel has been raising chickens for 1 year and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her chickens

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is 35 years old and married with one child. Gena works very hard to provide for them.

Gena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snacks foods and other personal care products.

Gena has been in this business for 4 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snacks foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Atsoupoé Chantal

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Chantal est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans résidant à Tokoin. Chantal est une marchande de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant dans les quartiers environnant pour gagner ses revenus. Chantal désire ce prêt pour commander des paniers de tomates fraîches, de piment et des légumes. Avec le résultat positif gagné, Chantal va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Chantal is thirty-nine years old, married and mother to three children. They live in Tokoin. Chantal sells food products which she buys once a month from the market. She sells them on foot in her local neighbourhood.

Chantal has requested this loan to order baskets of fresh tomatoes, chillies and vegetables. She will use her profits to help her husband provide for the expenses of their family and pay for a good education for their children.

loans.use: to buy 4 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 5 baskets of chillies and 5 baskets of vegetables.

loans.name: Sreytou'ch's Group

texts.en: Sreytouch’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia.  Sreytouch makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer and driver to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Amele

texts.fr: Amélé est une femme mariée âgée de 34 ans habitant à Tokoin. Commerçante des objets en plastiques et des défrisants de mèches, Amélé achète ses marchandises au marché et les revendent dans sa boutique. Amélé achète ses marchandises quatre fois par mois et nécessite ce prêt pour commander des bassines en plastique, des défrisants et des déodorants  afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable. Amélé prendra ce gain pour soutenir les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Amélé is thirty-four years old, married and lives in Tokoin. She sells plastic items and hair straighteners. She buys her stock from the market four times a month and sells it in her shop.

Amélé has requested this loan to order plastic bowls, hair straighteners and deodorants to meet the needs of her customers and make a good profit. She will use this to provide for the day-to-day expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy 8 plastic bowls, 7 units of hair straighteners and 6 units of deodorants.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire is 19 years old, single and student and lives with her parents at Amulung. She is now a third year student and wanted to finish her education that is why she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to pay her tuition fees. She hopes to finish her education and acquire good paying job someday. She will pay back her loan in full with the help of her supportive parents.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Blanquita

texts.en:
Blanquita is 61 years old and married with six children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Blanquita is borrowing PHP 6500 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Blanquita has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending and farming corn.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Suzielyn

texts.en:
Suzielyn is 57 years old and has five children. Suzielyn is married and has two children who are in school.

Suzielyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Suzielyn requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Suzielyn has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Suzielyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 54 years old, married with four children.  

Zenaida is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Zenaida has been raising livestock for ten years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 55 years old and married with six children.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Thelma has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Thelma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 58 years old and married with one child. Cornelia works very hard to provide for them.

Cornelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, noodles, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Cornelia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Cornelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, noodles, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Hav's Group

texts.en: Hav’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. Hav makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.en: Octavia is taking a loan of $ 1,200.00 to improve her business. She is married and she  has three children and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as noodles, sugar, salt, fish and biscuits.She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 600.00.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, salt, fish and biscuits.

loans.name: Dinora Idalia

texts.es:
Dinora, elabora meriendas típicas como: empanadas, tamales y pupusas para salir a vender, actividades que aprendió por su cuenta; es madre de tres hijos, actualmente solo vive con dos de ellos.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar maíz, harina, chicharrón, aceite, azúcar, entre otros materiales para preparar sus productos, le permitirá salir adelante con su negocio, crecer económicamente y cancelar sus deudas.
Desea seguir trabajando y tener una vida familiar con menos carencias.
texts.en:
Dinora makes typical snacks like: empanadas, tamales and pupusas in order to go out and sell, activities that she learned on her own. She is the mother of three children, currently she only lives with two of them.

She will use the loan to buy corn, flour, pork rinds, oil, sugar, among other materials to prepare her products. This will allow her to get ahead with her business, grow economically and pay off her debts. She wishes to continue working and have a family life with fewer shortcomings.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, pork rinds, oil, sugar, among other materials to prepare her products.

loans.name: Maria Lusmila

texts.es:
La socia Maria Lusmila  se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Lusmila continues in her business of raising animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens. Through her work she would like to start a grocery store, as it is her dream to have her own business. She would also like a bigger space so that she can sell her animals.

She seeks a loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and food for the animals. She is happy because of the loan and promises to comply with the required payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and food for the animals.

loans.name: Juliefer

texts.en:
Juliefer is 30 years old and married with three children.

Juliefer is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Juliefer requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Juliefer has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 58 years old and married with three children. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snacks foods and other personal care products.

Gloria has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snacks foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Hayde

texts.en:
Hayde is 62 years old, married with nine children.

Hayde works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snacks foods and other personal care products.

Hayde has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buy and sell dried fish.

Hayde aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles,  spices, drinks, snacks foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny, 61, is a widowed mother of five children and only one of them is in school. They live in a rural area of Kampong Speu province. Rice farming on a one-hectare farmland has been the only main source of her family’s income for forty-three years. Recently, her rice farmland was destroyed by a drought, which has been the main challenge for her in earning income to support her family. Vanny has been with VisionFund for six cycles already and those loan cycles help her to earn a better income and have the ability to send her children to school.
Due to having not enough capital to keep sending her children to school, she is now applying for a Kiva loan in order to pay for her child’s school fees and buy school materials for the studying of her child. She hopes this loan will help her to be able to continue keep her children in school until they graduate and have good jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and to buy school material to support her child's studying.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Revendeuse  de fruits et peau de bœuf,  Yawa habite à Tokoin avec sa famille ; elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Yawa est âgée de 30 ans et s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois chaque cinq jour au marché et les revendent de quartier en quartier.  Yawa sollicite un microcrédit  pour réaliser ce rêve, celui d’avoir une grande marge bénéficiaire et participer aux charges du foyer pour  mieux vivre telle qu’elle espère voir naître.
texts.en:
Yawa lives in Tokoin with her family. She is thirty years old, married and has two children. She sells fruit and ox skin. Twice in five days, she buys more supplies from the market and then sells her stock on foot from district to district.

Yawa has requested a loan to realise her dream. She would like a large profit margin so she can contribute to the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 10 baskets of mangoes and 160 units of ox skin.

loans.name: Yedou

texts.fr: Agée de 58 ans et mère de cinq enfants, Yedou est une femme mariée habitant à Agoè. Yedou est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qu’elle achète deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de sa maison. Pour s’approvisionner, Yedou demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue  d’épargner et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Yedou is fifty-eight years old, married and mother to five children. She lives in Agoè.

Yedou sells charcoal which she buys twice a month from the market and sells from the front of her house.

Yedou has requested this loan to order more sacks of charcoal. She hopes to be able to save some money and use it for the school education of her children.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Bopharoth's Group

texts.en: Bopharoth’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Bopharoth works as farmer and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is a 31-year-old widower who is a motor taxi driver with one child, who attends school. He resides in the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Sokha has been a motor taxi driver since 2002. Sokha can earn approximately$12 per day.

Now he would like to request a loan to buy land a plot of land. With the loan, he will have enough money to buy the land. In the future, he wants to build a new proper house and will help his child to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy land a plot of land

loans.name: The Women And The Sea - 02Thùnghlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs An is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has been catching fishes for 6 years. An lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income is unstable because the amount of fishes she can catch belong to the weather conditions.

The main hardship that An faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to catch fish, shrimp and frogs.

In 2011, An joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. An has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the 02THùngHLộc, which consists of 4 members.
With her business profit, An hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to catch fish, shrimp and frogs.

loans.name: Frecel

texts.en:
Frecel is 39 years old and married with two children. Both of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Frecel is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Frecel has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Isodora

texts.en:
Isodora is 36 years old and married with four children, four children are presently in school, Isodora works very hard to provide for them.

Isodora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snacks foods and other personal care products.

Isodora has been in this business for 4 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snacks foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Jurita

texts.en:
Jurita is 52 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jurita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jurita requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Jurita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Jurita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 35 years old and married with three children, three children are currently in school, Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snacks foods and other personal care products.

Janet has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, snacks foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Sengran's Group

texts.en:
Sengran, living in a Zinc-roofed house located in Kratie province, is age 46 years old and a mother of three children. Growing rice is the main source of her family’s income for more than five years and working on her co-villager’s farm for fee is an additional source of her family’s income. She could earn about 13 USD per day to spend on her family’s daily needs. 
Due to having not enough working capital to do farming, she is now leading a group of four to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund. This is the first loan cycle for her and she is willing to manage her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income and have a better living condition through this kind loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield in order to earn more income for upgrading her family's living condition.

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en: Chanthorn’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chanthorn works as farmer and she also does extra work as business woman to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Akoko est une femme mariée avec un enfant à charge. Agée de 44 ans, Akoko habite à Agoè  où elle exerce ses activités. Akoko  est une revendeuse de friperies de quartier en quartier qui s’approvisionne au marché une fois dans le mois. Akoko sollicite ce crédit pour commander des jupes, des habits pour femmes et des robes. Grâce à la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Akoko  compte accroitre son commerce et de répondre favorablement  aux attentes de ses clients en vue d’aider son mari avec le bénéfice aux charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Akoko is forty-four years old, married and responsible for one child. She lives and works in Agoè. She sells second-hand clothing from district to district and buys new stock once a month from the market.

Akoko has requested this loan to order skirts, dresses and outfits for women. Her resulting profits will enable her to expand her business and better meet the expectations of her clients. She hopes to be able to help her husband provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy 60 skirts, 50 outfits for women and 40 dresses.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de trois enfants, Afi  est une femme âgée de 51 ans résidant à Agoè. Afi  est une revendeuse  de produits d’alimentations générales qui achète ses marchandises trois fois par mois au marché et les revendent à la devanture de son domicile pour gagner des revenus. Afi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs et des cartons de tomates en vue d’acquérir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider sa famille dans l’éducation des enfants et à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes  éprouvées.
texts.en:
Afi is fifty-one years old, widowed and mother to three children. She lives in Agoè. She earns her living selling general food products which she buys three times a month from the market and sells from the front of her house.

Afi has requested this loan to order sacks of maize and boxes of tomatoes to increase her stock levels and maximise her profits. This will enable her to help her family provide for the education of the children and pay for their day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of maize and 5 boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes continúa con su negocio de tienda de barrio. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo inconvenientes en su trabajo. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio. Su tienda cuenta con ventas diarias y es muy concurrida, “mi negocio me mantiene activa porque levanto y recorro cajas y envases de todo peso…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecerla constantemente.  Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de abarrotes por mayor para abastecer su negocio. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 16 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lourdes solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes por mayor para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Lourdes continues with her neighborhood store business. The payments of her loan were punctual as she had no problems with her work. She invested the loan she got in buying groceries to stock her business. Her business has daily sales and is very busy. "My business keeps me active as I lift and move boxes and cases of all weights" she commented. The advantage of her business is that her sales are every day and her disadvantage is the lack of capital to constantly restock. Her dream is to improve her business.She wants to make the purchase of wholesale groceries to stock her store. This is her third loan with the Institution in the 16 years she has run her business.

For these reasons Lourdes is requesting a loan to buy groceries wholesale to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale to stock her store.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Barbara works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dress shop. Barbara is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy materials for her business such as needles, thread, etc. for her tailoring business.

Barbara has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business such as needles, thread, etc.
